review: Worst Food Ever! French fries did not taste fresh, food tasted so stale.  & the worst part about it, is that it is OVER PRICED.  I would of been much more happy if I want to a Fast Food Restaurant & paid half the price for food that tasted fresher. Never Again Will I come here. Especially TO GO Orders.

Wow! What can I say? I used to come here a lot. I always enjoyed their Jack Daniels Flat Iron. Tonight I came here and hear they no longer carry the flat iron. Then I went to order a house salad and found out they no longer carry Thousand Island Dressing. When I received my JD Rib-eye, it was tasty and cooked to my satisfaction. The broccoli was brown and old and not appetizing at all. Such a shame as I won't be coming back any time soon.

Hello everyone,   If I were you I would NOT eat here because the STAFF will eat some of your food before they take it to your table! For example: THE STAFF WILL EAT YOUR fries! I have seen it when I passed by the kitchen and if you walk by the kitchen you can tell that the kitchen is completely filthy.

I was heading home, super hungry and decided to do the 7mile drive to come eat here, sat myself, and now it's been 28minutes and no one came up to my table, nobody, there are at least 8 servers working , on my side at least 4 and none of them had the idea to ask me if i want anything, the table I sat on had a tablet, pressed the button to call for service a red light on top of the tablet blinked for 10 minutes, again nothing. People walked by , looked at me, at my super dirty table, yes, no one came to clean the table from the last customer's... this is the worst service I ever seen at a restaurant, and I've been to a lot of them... Just ask a server if I could order, she said, let me get someone for you... hahaha  I'm super hungry and I think I won't be able to get any food here!!! Worst experience at a T.G.I. Friday's!!!

I've came here a bunch of times and service isn't all too great. They have their good and bad days. When I came with my sister, our food took a little over an hour to be served and we were starving. I was so upset by the slow service. I always get something from their Jack Daniel's menu 'cause I love the taste of the sauce. If you haven't tried it, you should! It's a bit pricey and sometimes their steak isn't all that great but it's worth a try. It comes with 2 sides!  Some other times I would get the baby back ribs (half rack) if I'm feeling not too hungry. It's not too heavy for me and the meat is so soft. I think I actually prefer the baby back ribs than the Jack Daniel's steak and shrimp (it really depends on whether or not the steak is cooked good).

Poor management; has not trained some of the waiters. Came on a Sunday night, not that busy. Our waiter never came back after some of our requests.  Not sure if she was not as attentive since it was close to the end of her shift.  We had our 'call server' light on and she never came by to check on us.

I haven't been here in years but some friends invited me and I was quite impressed. I ordered ribs with a lobster tail and really didn't expect much from the lobster but it was so good I ordered a second one on the side. Who would have thought they had better lobster than Outback?

I went here with a friend and I ordered a plate (I forgot the name) that had shrimp, chicken, and mashed potato. It was mediocre. The shrimp was a bit dry on the inside.  This place is expensive in my opinion. Especially for the food you get, which can sometimes be really good and sometimes not that great.  Again, my experience was mediocre. It wasn't bad but it definitely wasn't worth anywhere near the almost $20 dollars I paid for that one dish.

Visited over a month ago 2/4/17 charges posted 2/6/17. As of today I noticed I was charged again 3/8/17 for the same meal. The manager explained they had an issue with VISA in February and suggested I call the bank. How Annoying!

Solid spicy black bean and avocado burger...Wall to wall TV'S to watch sports!! I'm not a big fan of chains but, todays visit was good, service was on point and free parking... But... No WiFi in 2017 WTH??!!!!

Visited here with my sister a few nights ago and sat at the bar which was open seating. Our server greeted us about 5 or 10 minutes after we checked the menu. We both ordered bar drinks, a Peach sangria (recommend if you like something fruity but not too sweet) and a Moscow mule. I also ordered the bourbon barrel chicken which was very delectable! Came with 2 scoops of mashed potatoes and a bed of broccoli. Had a pleasant experience compared to the last time I visited TGIF which was about 3 years ago. Service was a bit slow but the waiters dropped by a few times to check on us so I was thankful for that. I would recommend coming here early for happy hour before 6pm :)
Very good food nice people working there make you feel welcomed great service makes me want to come back every time

I have been here a couple of times and they have all been pleasant. I usually order the southern fried chicken sandwich or the chicken tenders but have also tried the black bean cheesecake. Everything I tried were pretty good so I don't really try anything else even though I should. The service has been nice all the times that I have been. Will have to go back to try some more items.

Endless appetizers for the win! I came with a group of 7 people on a Friday evening (TGIF!!!) around 6:45pm. Any later, we would have definitely had to wait for seats. This place fills up quickly! We asked for the endless app menu. For $10, you can pick one appetizer and refill that same one as many times as you want. For $12, you pick an appetizer, and then refill with appetizers of your choice. If you go in a big group like I did, you can do multiple $10 options and share with your friends. What a steal! -Mozzarella sticks: Crispy and cheesy -Spinach Florentine Flatbread: Tasty but very filling -Pan-Seared Potstickers: More like dumplings because they didn't pan fry them enough -Beef Tostadas: Tasty but the tostada was pretty hard -Boneless Wings: You can never go wrong with Garlic Parmesan and BBQ. However, Ghost Pepper was definitely my favorite - spicy but super flavorful. The PB&J totally tastes like Thai curry, which I surprisingly enjoyed. Every 15 minutes or so, we got rounds of the appetizers I just listed. I think we did about 6-7 rounds and we were stuffed! I had a wonderful time feasting and catching up with my boys from high school. Our server Greg was the best! He was very accommodating, and made sure all our requests were fulfilled.

I used to love Fridays, but now this place is ridiculously expensive and the amount of food they give you is smaller. The service was good, but seriously.... there's no reason for me to come back here for 10 fried shrimp for $17. Insane.

This place deserves a one star because, well, there was just nothing good about it. First of all our waiter, a skinny, blonde guy with a small head took forever to place, bring out our order, and take our payment. Even after we had asked him for the check he took his time lingering around the back and talking to his friends. The food was also terrible.

All this negative comments must be from ignorant people that obviously can't cook or else they would stay there ass home and eat what ever garbage it is they like to eat I say garbage because all they are speaking is trash this place is great! Don't listen to the bad reviews this people out here yelping like their life depends on it lol ok bye now...

Service was not very good today. I ordered one thing and they sent me something different and when I tried to tell the server that this was not what I ordered she wanted to argue with me and told me that was what I ordered.   I had to ask for a manager.  The food was not good and we had to return some of the food

This is my first Yelp review ever. Had the worst experience. Food was late and overcooked. I wanted to complain but I had no time to get a new steak because it was late. The server was rude to me when I complained. She made it sound like it was my fault. She claimed to have many to customers, but she was busy talking to her friends. I've never felt so unimportant in my life. I will never go back there, ever.

After my run I decided to come in for lunch, little skeptical on what to eat but since it's union landing you can find anything. So here I am at Friday's for a quick meal. First off I've been here many times before from watching the big game and birthday gatherings with friends. Surprisingly I had yet to write a review. Well here we go.        They gave a great two for $20 deal that I indulged in with the wifey. Keep in mind you get what you pay for so the portions are a bit smaller. We have a rewards deal that allowed us to get a complimentary chips and salsa with our meal. I went with the chicken parm with tomato and the Mrs tried the 6 once steak with sweet potato fries. Not too bad and filled us up. Our waiter was very observant and checked in on us periodically for refills and condiments.        This place is always packed on the weekends to capacity and big games forget it. But once your in its a blast with usually a great crowd to have a good time. There's outdoor seating with heaters to keep you warm on those chilly nights. Definitely a fun place to chill and have drink or dinner dates with the fam.

This place is a joke.  I had to come here for a birthday dinner and it was a horrible experience.  After waiting 45 to get seated, we waited 15 minutes just for the waitress to take our order. Then 20 minutes just to get the drinks (sodas).  The food took another 45 minutes to get here.  Altogether almost 1.5 hours to get the food

Me and my husbands always comes here and overall the experience is usually good but today experience was horrible. First it took almost an hour to get our food and my husband was eating coleslaw when he noticed the bowl had some dried brown substance inside. We asked for the manager and his comment was it looks like beer cheese. Omg we ordered coleslaw so that means they serve us coleslaw in a dirty container.

Haven't been here for years... sat at the bar, since we didn't want to wait to sit down... plus we just wanted to drink beer and get appetizer's... the employees kept check up on us every 10min which is a good thing... but the restrooms of course was gross as usual. Nothing new with dirty restrooms there...
I miss this place. Nothing like underage drinking, smoking pot in your car outside, and snorting coke in the bathroom. Simpler times those were.

I come to this restaurant all the time. I usually like to come during bball games& happy hour- I love their appetizers! I've never really ordered an entree meal, only because the meals never look so great. But this time I decided to pick an entree, and I wasn't too impressed. I chose the shrimp& baby back ribs combo with a baked potato. The shrimp was actually really good, too bad they only gave about 4 pieces. As for the ribs, they were so dry I could barely get the meat off the bones. Then I get to the baked potato and that wasn't so great either. All there was on it was a clump of butter, no seasoning, no cheese, no sour cream. Just butter. I told her I wanted it loaded but I guess she misunderstood, and I would much prefer not to complain.  Overall, I like TGIF, I just think their cooks could put a little more TLC into their food.

I came here with my bf to experience happy hour as I saw some good deals online. I came in around 6:45 and happy hour ends at 7, I ordered one margarita for 6.25, which was so delicious, you couldn't taste the alcohol but it was definitely in there. I also ordered two sliders which were $1.50 each and a basket of fries for $1.50. My boyfriend ordered one electric lemonade which was delicious too. We absolutely loved our server, he was fast, courteous, and simply amazing!!! The margaritas came within a minute and the food was fast too! Like he was on it!!! Which made my experience a 10/10. I wanted to try the pineapple mojito and he put it in the check but came back and told me they were out. When we got the check the $7 was on there but he came back before we even explained it and corrected it. It was definitely a great experience!!

I've been coming here for years, and over the years the service has gotten worse and worse, orders incorrect and my White Russian drink having more cream than alcohol. The wait staff has changed from a young energetic college crowd eager to please to older folks supplementing their income, with a "you get what you get attitude" My food looked so unappealing I sent it back along with my drink that has less than a half an oz of alcohol.  (The rest of the food looked GOOD, I think I got he sh!t treatment for saying my drink was wrong) There isn't any way to correct this issue and even my four year old said she's tired from waiting so long for our food. The waitress made no attempt to fix my issue so she won't be getting a tip. Smh NEVER AGAIN!! RIPTGI FRIDAYS.

Today I am really disappointed the food was not good today we had to send back several items from our plate I ordered a strawberry daiquiri a virgin strawberry daiquiri it was Sour like a lemon it had huge chunks of ice. nothing is coming through the straw I am really disappointed today. I'm not coming back for a very long time.

TGIF is a nice restaurant located in Union city landing next to 880 freeway. We went there for a quick drink and snacks prior to our movie in the nearby Century 25 Theaters. They had a few selection of beers on tap - mostly IPA's. We ordered beers, Chicken nachos, chicken strips and onion rings with fries. Service was average and we had to wait some time before the server came by to take our order. Overall a nice restaurant but just about average.

If I could give 0 stars, I would. The first messed up on a burger that we ordered and took the complete order back without offering any fries or anything. The second time around, the messed up the burger again and blamed it on a party of 10 being there, which we didn't even see. We also had 2 sizzling chicken and shrimps and let me tell you, it WAS NOT sizzling at all. They served our dishes with sliced pieces of the sandwhich American cheese on top of our vegetables. Seriously? It was so cold and it didn't even melt which it should have if it was "sizzling". The waiter was this chick who was a complete bimbo and did nothing to compensate for the inconvenience. She was so monotoned and sounded like she didn't even care that they messed up on our order twice and served us cold food. No wonder TGIF Fridays is closing down in a lot of areas!

I regret going in here and spending my money. The quality doesn't meet its price. I ordered the southern style chicken burger because it looked good in the picture. When it came it was soggy. On top of that when I was picking my side, our server, JULIAN, recommended rice with my meal. I was astonished the fact that he would offer knowing that my order was a burger. I wanted to ask him if he ever tried rice on the side when he eats a burger. It sparked in my mind that the reason why he offered it was because I am Asian. I decided to go for lemon butter broccoli. I was surprised that when it came, it was still inside a plastic bag that recently was just microwaved. I totally lost my appetite. It was disgusting. To save anyone who are trying to eat here, DON'T EVER GO ON THIS LOCATION.
Maurice , our server, was very nice. He was very attentive and professional . I would definitely come back again !!!! Thank you Maurice !!!!

I haven't been to Friday's in forever! Shitty service, microwaved frozen foods and watered down drinks.  Not sure wtf we were thinking last night, but somehow we all decided to swing by for a last drink after a night of great food and drinks in Oakland.  We walked in behind a couple and we're told the bar side was closed for a VIP party. Tf? The bar was 3/4 empty, every table was minding their own business, does NOT look like anything was going on at all... Again, wtf we're we thinking assuming that Friday's would be a great spot to end our night. Ugh, never again.

OH GOD NO...JUST NO! Lol, If you're a fan of long wait times, sticky seats, and uncooked shrimp then this is the place for you. Growing up, I remember seeing the TGI Fridays commercial and have always wanted to go. Last weekend was my first time at the restaurant and the food really bad. My S/O and I ordered some pasta dish. He finished his plate and I didn't. The sauce tasted like canned sauce and my shrimp was definitely uncooked! I mean, I like raw shrimp...in sushi, but not in my pasta! Lol. The Oreo ice cream cookie/cake was really good and our waiter came by really promptly, hence the "extra star."

I'll give you the most honest review. This place is absolute ass. If you're really desperate go here for lunch you'll save a lot of money for over expensive food. I expected that when I paid $17.80 for pasta that said it was 1430 calories on their menu I would receive a decent meal with leftovers. Instead, i got a small portion which hardly filled me up. At best, I'd say it was about 600 calories. I won't be coming here again and I'd warn anyone before coming to this place. Like legit fuck this place. False advertising and over expensive food that doesnt even taste that good

I wished I could give a better review but sitting at the door waiting to be seated for five minutes was disappointing. When you stand there and five employees including the manager do not even attempt to help you can leave a bad taste in your mouth.  Finally a busser helped us and he was very pleasant.  Once we got seated we were greeted by a very friendly server named Gregg. He took our order and helped me with a drink choice. Which I ordered a blended Mango and strawberry Margarita. It tasted great!  My husband ordered the Jack Daniels ribeye with mash potatoes and broccoli. The ribeye was a little tough but to be expected since our first choice was Texas Roadhouse and they were packed.  I ordered a shrimp cocktail and a back potato. The shrimps were slightly over cooked and they are certainly not prawns but the average size you normally see. The baked potato was the best part of our meal.

Was starving and the wait for a party of four at Texas Roadhouse was nearly two hours, so we casually settled for TGIF since it was basically next door and er...big mistake. Walked in, waitress said it'd be around ten minutes till we'd be seated. I looked around - half the place was empty, but okay. We ordered fish and chips, half rack of ribs, and some burger.  Fish and chips were alright, but came out cold and pathetic looking. The fries were soggy. Taste-wise, they weren't horrible. Can't imagine any place fucking up fish and chips lol. Ribs were a joke. Half a rack of ribs was smaller than my hand. They were some piglet ribs cause that shit was tiny as hell and filled NOBODY up. Moreover, they were super overcooked and crispy, and barely had any barbecue sauce on them at all.  Burger was meh.  Overall, huge disappointment and waste of money. Should've just feasted over at Jollibee's lol.

I've been here several times over the years, for all types of celebrations (Birthdays, Mother's Day, etc.) The last time my family was here was for Mother's Day. The wait wasn't that long, only about 30 minutes for Sunday @6pm. I think it helped that we were waiting seated inside because the hostess was aware of our presence and seated us sooner than I had anticipated. They now have ipad type machines on each of the tables that I assume you can order and play games on. Ours was broken so I don't know why it wasn't just removed (it took up a lot of unnecessary space!)  The burger that my sister and I shared was delicious but the reason why I am giving it 3 stars is because of the service; it could've been better. When my dad ordered, he had ordered the Jack Daniels BBQ ribs. However, what came was just regular ribs, lightly coated in sauce... We noticed the difference between my mom's Jack Daniels ribs and his and asked the waitress why his was different. She said it was because his meal did not come with the Jack Daniels option. She could've told him that when he ordered; that definitely could've altered his decision. His meal also came with two sides but the french fries did not come out. He reminded her to bring the fries twice because she had forgotten to get them again.. Lastly, my sister noticed some small plastic pieces in her water. She initially shrugged it off because she thought it was ice but when she couldn't chew it down, she spit it out. I told our waiter, and she her response was, "Ew, what is that?!"... I have no clue what that was! We paid with gift cards that my mom had which was also a confusing process.  In short - it's a good place in the area for gatherings if you're craving American food, but service could be better

Loved our service here on Saturday! I haven't been to a TGIF in a long time.  Food:  I ordered the Cajun Shrimp Pasta without the chicken and it was delicious!   (Note) don't order the lobster tail, so tiny that I could compare it to the size of a prawn.. Ambiance:  Old school classic songs and beats. Where I found myself enjoying conversations with my friends and bringing back memories of old bands. Fun atmosphere and we got seating within 25 mins here on a busy night. Not bad. Service:  Our waiter was Daniel, he was on it! Our orders were brought the same time. He made sure everything was brought out and if our orders came out right. Daniel was professional!

Food is disgusting and overpriced. My food tasted stale and cold. Never coming back here again. I should've read other reviews before coming in. They're right that I could've gotten better fast food somewhere else.

Late Post. Had a good experience Sunday afternoon. Started off rocky with the hosts. (not very attentive, just lost). Server: Yesina was very good. (engaging, friendly, and attentive). Food: Appetizers came out quick, and was hot. Rest of food came out in a timely manner order was correct food was hot. Surprisingly good experience.
Haven't been awhile and ordered their 12.99 bbq ribs. Will definitely be ordering the ribs again.
Loved our waiter! He was great, did the endless appetizers with a couple of friends and they were great with the service. Absolutely coming back! :)

This was my first time trying TGI Fridays and let me say, it sucks!  First off, the guy who was serving us didn't know anything about the steak because my friend asked a question about the steak and he said he didn't know anything.  Second, the food portion is SUPER SMALL! Why is it less portion and so expensive? I personally don't understand. Also the mashed potatoes had cheese in it which I find weird because it did not say that in my menu.  Third, customer service was horrible! They took forever and my friend was not satisfied and did not eat her food and got a refund. Worst place ever.

We went to TGIF's for a late business lunch.  The establishment was clean and the staff was very friendly.  Service was terrific. We had the Ribs and JD Chicken.  I was very pleasantly surprised that the chicken breast was actually tender and not tough as most breasts are.  Well done.  The Ribs were very tasty and the sauce was great.  The salad that was served with it was ok, however the way to end it great was with the Oreo Madness.  Sooooooo good.   I have not been to TGIF in quite some time and this establishment gave me a reason to come back again.

We usually go to FRIDAYS at least once or twice a week. We always sit at the bar... The bartenders are always great. However, the manager that was on tonight was pathetic. There was a item on the menu that included Kale... well when the salad arrived it had no Kale in it.  Normally I would write this off as a mistake, but this makes the THIRD TIME THAT THIS HAS HAPPENED, at this RESTURANT.   The bar staff informed the manager and he said the best he could do was a 20 percent reduction on our total bill. He should have comped the salad... period. The fact that they have had no Kale in a salad they advertise is straight up bullshit. To be honest, I don't think they have ever served that item correctly.   I also happened to walk by the kitchen on the way to the FILTY BATHROOM. Fixtures on the sink was broken and someone had over flowed the toilet with SHIT. Passing back by the kitchen, was even worst, dirty serving tables, garbage cans near food waiting to be served, floors were filthy and slick, one young person was pulling back his hair, never stopping once to WASH HIS NASTY ASS HANDS. I am so disappointed on how management is letting FRIDAY's TURN INTO A DUMP. I plan to call the health department on Monday . Corporate needs to come in there and clean up this place and replace or retrain the management. The manager on Saturday night, should be managing a hot dog stand !!!

Service was alright, they didn't give us any napkins and we had to wait a bit for them to finally hand us some. Burgers are delicious especially the chicken strips. Ask for less ice in your drinks. A little pricey.

They do not honor happy hour advertised on the website.  If you carry the name, you should honor advertised happy hour.  No one cares who the owner is.  Happy hour on Monday is advertised as $3 mojitos and several other drinks, yet they don't honor any of them and want $10-12 per drink.
Fantastic food, fantastic service, very prompt severs. Great location. All of the managers are very friendly and always walk around asking how you are doing.
Food isn't that great and too expensive.  I called this place and ordered takeout and told me 20 minutes for pickup.  I got there and still waited a few minutes and my order was cold.  Won't be back!

I am in town for work and they were close. Came in for a glass of wine after work. When I arrived i told the host I was by myself so she suggested the bar. I sat myself at the bar and was actually greeted by the busser, in Spanish. Luckily I speak Spanish and we jokingly said hello and he asked how I was. I was waited on by 3 different bartenders. They were all very pleasant. The manager was bussing the dirty dishes next to me but never said anything to me. I would come back. Good energy.
Have not been here I like 5 years, and once again disappointed.  Hubby went into bathroom and water was pouring from the ceiling! Food was ehhh ok...
Was ok... we did appetizers and drinks... weak drinks and the boneless wings disgusting... the flat bread was good and pot stickers were good but I don't need to eat here ever again.

I can see why this place has low ratings. Slow service with basic food. The place wasn't even all that clean. I get this isn't fine dining, but this is a franchise and they need to step it up. I should have known it wasn't going to be a good experience from the beginning. The hostess asked how many and just stood there. She didn't write our names down or checked to see what the tables we could sit at. She just stood there looking at the ceiling. Was she high? How can you ask us how many and then stand there? Then a server came and said there were no more booths, only tables. Not that I had a problem, but there were so many booths still available. I felt like they were slow and didn't want to serve us.  That's fine. I won't be returning.

TGI's is one of my favorite late night place in the area. The appetizers are half off after 10PM which means that the nachos, spinach dip, and wings all come out to about $6-7 and the portions are really big. The drinks were also really cheap and the servers were extremely nice and attentive to when our drinks were dipping below half. I can't vouch for the entrees since i've only ever come here for the $1.50 fries and half off appetizers at night but this has slowly become one of my favorite late night spots to go with friends.

Normally, I'm not a fan of chain restaurants but this TGI Fridays is an exception. The service is stellar and the food is very consistent. I love the stripes reward program. We always try to come in on bartender Desiree's shift. She remembers what we drink and always has a smile. The manager Mike always seems to be present and engaged in what's going on in the restaurant. If all TGI Fridays were run this way, with the caliber of employees like this one, they'd take over the world! I feel a need to shout out to the most excellent servers who take care of us, Oliver is exceptional, he remembers what we like and is on top of any requests we might have. Jaidah (sp?) is another quality server who anticipates our needs and delivers some of the best service around. We are very bummed Desiree is no longer bartending but as good as she is I'm sure she will be snapped up!

I hate writing negative reviews, I hardly ever do, but I had to at least say something because their service was so ridiculous. We came in on a Tuesday night at 8pm. It looked like it might be busy, lots of cars in the parking lot. We were told to wait 5-10mins to be seated, so we thought ok thats not too bad. 15 mins go by and we looked at the seating area, and there were SO many open tables, pretty much everywhere it was empty except the bar area where they kept telling people they could sit. 8 men came in and they were directed to that area because of "lack of seating"....thats a large party, why would you want them crammed in the bar, where they might not order as much due to lack of table space? Loosing $$ for sure by doing this. One mom and daughter were ahead of us, they looked like they had been waiting a while and they finally got seated about 5 mins before us. We should have left after we saw them walk out about 5 mins later shaking their heads. After they left, they sat us at a dirty table (when there were TONS of clean tables already set next to us). The girl said your server will be here shortly...another almost 5 mins go by and no server so I press the "call server" button on the tablet at the table. We gave it another 5 mins and then my husband and I were so fed up we walked out too. We went to Chevy's near by and were immediately seated, given menus and food in the same amount of time that it took for us just to walk out of TGI Friday's. We have both worked in food service (for many many years) and this was just unacceptable. Its not like they were short staffed, there were 3 girls standing up front talking, and then occasionally a male server as well. Plus we saw about 6 other servers zipping about, but when you have 4 servers standing up front for 20 mins talking you have a management and staff problem. My recommendation to management (having management experience myself): Keep an eye on your FOH staff, they are not doing their jobs and you are loosing customers as a result. You lost my husband and I AND the mother and daughter before us. Plus the large group of men who went to the bar area instead of being seated right away at a large table - believe me it was empty enough to combine tables together.
Horrible Service! I called to place an order and was on hold 15 minutes. I ended up driving down here. The manager didn't care. I waited 30 minutes for my order to be ready. I will never come back.

While i was eating my food i noticed that there was a black rusty nail inside my burger. ( i open my burger because i was taking out the tomatoes. ) i was shocked and had a SCARED look in my face. My girlfriend was with me she was shocked also. Suddenly the store manager came and asked is everything okay? My girlfriend said "it's funny you're asking that, my boyfriend just found a nail in his food."  The nail was rusty, black and looked dirty. He immediately took the plate and did not allow us to take any pictures. We were also very shocked at the moment. We didn't react fast enough to take a picture which i completely regret. The man who took our burger (manager i believe) was very shocked and surprised.  A few other issues i had was that my food took more than one hour to be ready. The appetizer (mozzarella sticks took 25 minutes, These were very delicious). It wasn't a good day. I am sure not everyone will  have the same bad experience as me. I've tried to contact the restaurant already have no heard back.  - I have the receipt where they discounted the burger  - I can point out the manager that saw it,  - witness was my girlfriend

Y if I sit n the non bar area I can't get happy hour???? My drink order took a while, now let's see how long my dinner come I order pasta at 1040pm ok it's here 10:59pm what's that 19 minutes and my drink is empty and has not ask me for another. Ok no offer of another drink and wanted check !!!!its 1116pm he came by once to ask my husband was he streaked right! Nothing on me I guess u can't mess up pasta :(  I even paid on the little pc on the table he never returned.

Had lunch with the wife on a weekday afternoon. Service was satisfactory but he did forget to add the coupon we gave him the visit. We asked and after a bit of waiting he finally came back and said it was cleared up. Food was ok. I had a cheeseburger but the sauce made it too wet. Running all down my arm and pooling on the plate. Otherwise it was ok. Can remember what the wife had; writing this about two months after the visit, sorry. I can't possibly fathom why TGI's currently averages 2.5 stars on Yelp.  It's a restaurant chain that easily outclasses its other competitors within its league of similar price range and food type, you know...Applebees, Chili's, etc.  Based on that comparison, I'll be reviewing under that pretext. Allow me to tip the scale a bit. For your typical run of the mill, All-American, fast, sit-down restaurant, TGI's is splendid.  On numerous occasions, I enjoyed the New York steak, ribeye, full rack of pork ribs, shrimp, Bourbon Barrel Mahi Mahi, top sirloin steak, all coupled with potatoes, sweet potato fries (real good!), fresh vegetables, and spinach/garlic.  Veggies are cooked well (nothing special though), and steaks are actually served medium rare like I asked, every time.  And honestly, I think their Jack Daniel's Signature BBQ sauce delicious and goes with just about everything.   They even have calories listed on the menu for each meal for the calorie conscious, and frankly, I think the portions are just fine since I can finish it comfortably.  I can eat a ton more, but the typical American diet has average meals easily in the caloric surplus.  Of course, I'm not one to judge anyone's gluttony, but I'm digressing.  I guess one can argue the price point, but this goes back to other restaurants within the same league that are of similar price.  The difference?  The food quality of TGI's is easily in the upper band; it just tastes better.  Also, service has been attentive every time and the cocktail selection is numerous. What else is there to judge for a restaurant of this caliber?  Despite the welcoming name to come on Fridays, don't.  Especially on a Friday evening -- place is packed.

Great accompaniment to meat or fish for the rice fanatics. My only issue is not receiving my Caesar dressing on the side, despite the confirmation. I didn't bother saying anything cuz I didn't want to waste food. Soft pretzels with cheese & bacon dip are always good here! Perfect size for 4. Shrimp cocktail tasted like the typical frozen kind. Drinks all around! I swear, after my sis turned 21 I'm pretty sure we're becoming an alcoholic fam haha! JK. Tried the Mandrin Mule-- tasted like soda with a hint of orange! I really liked this. Sis got a sweet Mixed Berry Mojito, good as well. Mom got a Prosecco bottle and Dad a glass of red wine. Might try the blended Frose next time. The Zoosk pay machine had a broken receipt slot issue but we still paid using it after redeeming our coupon personally. All in all, great place to have drinks and a comforting meal. Happy hour sounds like a good deal to unwind any day of the week! They're open until 1am weekdays and 2am weekends. Sunday has HH prices all day, and also stretches to the dining room, unlike the other days where it's just at the bar area.

Totally disappointed.  You don't come to TGIFridays expecting a great meal but when the wings are dry, the potstickers are burnt, and the server is too preoccupied with chapping with coworkers.  This lunch is time out of my life that I'll never get back. Beyond disappointed.

This is the 2nd time that we visited this TGIF's and we had the same exact experience upon entrance. Weeks back, my boyfriend and I walked in and the first time around we got a group of employees chit chatting, not greeting us, and all made eye contact with us and proceeded to walk away. Then this second time around on Friday around 7 or so on November 24th, 2017, we got one female, whom also did not greet us, instead made eye contact with us for a couple seconds without saying a single word, until I said Hello?! and still got nothing, so I said "just two" and even then she walked away to check which table was available and then came back and told us to follow her with the most least enthusiasm and just gave us the menu, no silverware. Then our waiter literally told us that he SAW our appetizer sitting there ready to be taken to us but walked away and came back and it was gone?! So therefore we got our appetizer until way after our meal, not to mention we had to wait for our silverware then we had asked for extra ranch and jack daniels sauce which also took long. Seriously unfortunate that we love the food but the service is just so terrible. Looking through the yelp reviews, clearly management is not taking action.  Sucks to go to a restaurant but have these mishaps happen because it truly ruins the experience.

Tonight. Sunday night. Looking for some food. Head to T.G.I. Friday's. Friday's on a Sunday? Weird. I know. Walk inside. Nice and slow. Good sign. Unfortunately, the last good sign of the night. Hostess gave us no smile and barely a greeting. Not sure what her deal was. Maybe a bad night. Maybe something else. Or maybe, simply, rude. Get seated. Booth seats. Normally you'd find this to be of some comfort. Not tonight. It was as cold and unwelcoming as a baby on an airplane. We couldn't even stay to eat. We waited. Tried to flag someone down. Then waited some more. Nothing. Patience wore thin. As thin as a wet tissue.  Bye T.G.I. Friday's. I'll see next Friday, but not you.

Cheap ingredients and tasteless food. There's really only one vegan option here after heavy modifications - the veggie burger with no cheese and mayo and lettuce wrap. The menu has zero indication of dietary constraints and the dishes are clearly made with the cheapest ingredients possible. Extremely vegan unfriendly.  The burger and obligatory fries were edible, but pretty low in terms quality. I felt ill after. I don't know if from the food or just the experience.

Soooo glad I came here for dinner! They have 'Beyond Meat Burgers' People! I had to show my server what I was talking about on my phone and he went to go check because it's not on the menu YET but it was beyond good! It truly tasted like a beef burger, (probably same grill didn't think to ask) but without the grease and at times grislely fat as you eat it. Also got the Pretzel sticks with dipping sauce. Man oh Man they were huge! I could have just eaten that for dinner if they didn't have the burger that I made the trip out for. Very nice server and for a Friday night only a 10 minute wait to be seated. All n' all will be back again soon!

I used to like coming here because it's local and easily accessible for all of my friends to meet at. However, the food portions are smaller and more expensive. We only come here as a last minute option for drinks. One good thing that hasn't changed is the kind staff which helps.

Pretty busy for a Sunday night! It seems like they didn't have enough waiters for the tables they were serving. We waited about 30 mins or so for our food. My jack Daniel burger tasted good. The jack Daniel sauce is amazing for dipping the burger or fries!!! Pretty good for a chain restaurant!  Our server was nice and attentive!

Went there for lunch on Friday. Good friendly service and a nice polite lady and was seated right away by hostess.  I'd say this chain and Applebee's are one and two. I've always liked the food served here and today I had a good burger and it tasted nice and fresh. Had French onion soup that was a tad disappointing but it's my go to when I go out to eat. I'll be back but not ordering that soup anymore.

Having the frozen Mozarella sticks for years from Target or Costco, I have never once stepped foot in a TGI.  Our recent trip to TGI was both interest and gift card based- I mean, a meal on someone else- why not? :) We came on Thursday and there was a bit of a busy lobby. The hostess told us it would be a 25 minute wait, and took our contact information to text us when our table was ready. The ease of contact was so convenient and made it easy for us to wait in the car without having an obnoxious vibrating buzzer interrupting. Or, the germs those carry! At about 21 minutes through, we received a text message and were ready to eat! Our waitress was beautiful and fun, her name was Marjorie and she was very attentive and friendly. Within 2 minutes of ordering drinks, she brought it our way, and was very quick on her feet.  For our appetizer we ordered the mozarella sticks which were sold out! My dream of fresh ones was foiled, but next time I will plan to come at an earlier time in the day. In substitution we ordered potato skins and requested the bacon to be excluded from the recipe. Marjorie put in our order and ten minutes after, we're munching on our potato skins telling her things were great between a mouthful of cheese!  The potato skins were very good, I preferred them with ketchup to the sour cream, but they were the only dish lacking presentation. The cheese used is a kraft or packaged sliced cheese, making it look a bit 'at home' like, but nonetheless, very tasty! Next time, we will order mozarella sticks though, the potatoes weren't much to write home about. Our main entree was burger themed! According to Yelp reviews here, there was no consistency with what to order , so we gambled on burgers.  My boyfriend ordered the BBQ Bacon Cheeseburger, and I ordered the Black Bean Chipotle Burger! I totally appreciated that being a quality vegetarian option, since the pasta dishes were covered in chicken or meat, making it a bit difficult to find some good options with protein. Not even fifteen minutes after our appetizer, we receive our entrees - which was surprisingly fast! The staff really makes sure the customers are fed and not irritable, which was completely appreciated.  My boyfriend's seal of approval was cleaning his plate and nodding with a smile! I couldn't believe it! My burger was very well made. The bun used is a sweet roll similar to Hawaiian bread, with a mild chipotle mayo sauce combination, lettuce, avocado, tomato, onion, on the black bean burger. The combination was both flavorful, and satisfying, taking into account that many vegetarian options are blander or very unseasoned. :) I was pleasantly surprised! For anyone looking to order this meal, it tastes like black beans and a soft bean veggie mix- so if you're looking for a meat alternative TASTING like meat, this wouldn't be a good substitute but it's just as tasty! For dessert we ordered the fudge brownie with vanilla bean icecream! I imagined a more structured foundation of brownie, but it was more pudding/molten lava fudge mixed with brownie pieces so it's very very soft. Less cakey! The vanilla icecream was mildly sweet staying true to vanilla flavor, not overwhelmingly sweet like artificial icecream. What's great is all desserts are similarly priced so there's no loss in money or choices. Overall we give TGI four stars for amazing service, and food. We both agreed upon leaving we would definitely return, which was a big plus! Marjorie is super sweet and friendly, she's like a total gal pal that has the hookup with great food!
I am in LOVE with this restaurant and the service is amazing. We got a seat where we wanted it and every time our server saw that my glass was empty she filled it back up with my red wine.

Like how long does it take to get a beer?! The server was great...when he actually came to the table! Waited forever for some mozzarella sticks! Took damn near half an hour! Service was garbage, never coming back!!!!

One Star because there was ONE helpful hostess and One start because my families food was enjoyed. That's it though.   Why TGI ?!? Whyyyyyy!!!! I can't with this place.  Over priced food and underwhelming service this evening.  Thankfully I was too busy enjoying family time and squishing babies to pay too much attention to the service.   I think our waitress was having an off day.  She seemed sad.  If I'm ever asked to meet friends here, I'll return but it won't ever be my idea.

HORRIBLE MANAGEMENT! STAFF HAS NO ACCOUNTABILITY!  Boyfriend and I went here for dinner on last Saturday night. Service was extremely slow for no freaking reason! When we were finally greeted we ordered: Appetizer: Potstickers. They were black on one side and undercooked on the other side.   Entree: He had a slider and some wings. No issues. I ordered the sizzling chicken and shrimp. It comes on a hot plate and should come out "sizzling" hence the name. Supposed to have chicken breast, 2 kinds of melted cheese, sautéed peppers and onions, and Cajun shrimp. I substituted the Cajun shrimp for fried jack Daniels shrimp. 2 sides. This BULLSHIT hit the table and I thought I was being PUNKED!!!! The chicken came out lukewarm. The fucking cheese was still cold (I.e. I could see a square slice of American cheese just slapped on top of the damn chicken). The white shredded cheese was still in shreds and cold. Shrimp cold. I ordered a side of mixed veggies, it looked like they were all raw!!! It was embarrassing!!! And not to mention they gave me the wrong damn shrimp.  The cold part is, is we waited nearly 30 mins for that crap. The guy who brought our food (not our server) didn't seem to give a rats ass about how my food looked, and simply said "uh, do you want me to take it back for you?" I wanted to scream. He should've never brought it out like that! It should have never left the kitchen this way.  Told him it was ok, could he just grab our server. He rolls his eyes a little and says ok. WELL IT TAKES DAMN NEAT 10 MORE MINS FOR THE SERVER TO COME OVER. HE SAYS THE GUY NEVER TOLD HIM THAT THERE WAS AN ISSUE. So I proceed to tell the server, he half listens to what I was saying and says he'll have them re-do it with a half assed sentiment. He didn't give a f--k either. I said nah I'm good. I don't want anything else. He walks off.  I ask another person for the manager. The manager finally comes, and PLOPS HIS ASS DOWN IN OUR BOOTH LAUGHING AND SMILING LIKE WE WERE ALL ABOIT TO SIT DOWN AND HAVE DINNER TOGETHER. JUST A COMPLETE JOKE and unprofessional. I told him my issue...........drumroll please.......... he didn't give a shit either!! We ended up leaving without eating anything. Our dinner was ruined and we had a movie to get to. He then says, "LOOK, MY NAMES MATT (or James or whatever) THE NEXT TIME YOU COME, ASK FOR ME ILL TAKE CARE OF YOU!  Yeah thank you, but NO THANK YOU. THAT was your time to take care of us. Fridays management is a joke and it all trickles down to the staff. Management sets the tone      No wonder why they have a 2 star rating. The only reason they have so much business is because they are the only Fridays in the local East Bay Area. They should take more pride in their service. Shame on them!!

My daughter wanted some potato skins on Christmas Eve. I called in my phone order and 15 minutes later I wanted to add to my order, but she told me it was last call due to closing early, which I completely understood. I got there and waited about 10 minutes, no big deal it was Christmas Eve and the employees wanted to get home to their families too. Lala was so sweet, she kept telling me just a few more minutes and checked on me. When I got my order she said it's on the house Merry Christmas! So sweet and wasn't expecting it, and the potato skins were yummy. A+ service and 5 stars for lala and her excellent customer service

Wow...what terrible service. Oh wait, you would have to even be seen by a waiter to say that. Waited for 10 minutes at our table for service and no one even came to our table. From the number of workers that were chatting with each other I would gather that it was a slow Sunday night.  Note to management: Employees need to have more customer awareness and have more friendly attitudes.

I don't know where to start. I haven't been to TGI Friday's since 2007, and it was the location that used to be in Cupertino, and I do not remember it being like this. I suppose this may be a franchise location, or the quality of food and service has diminished for this establishment over the last decade. I brought my mom here for dinner, as she has never been to a Fridays and I remember them being ok (well, was about to look like a fool for suggesting this place...) We walked in, and no one in sight,except for customers. We waited about three minutes to be seated to a table with fresh drink rings left on the table as well as someones leftover dessert on my moms side.They didnt bother to wipe it down until she asked about halfway through our dinner. Strangely enough, we were given different menus. Apparently,there is an old one and a revised one, which is shorter. We noticed when half of the pages were missing from hers. We asked the waiter about it and that is what he told us, before switching out the old one. I ordered a burger with a side of mayo as well as a salad and a side of loaded mashed potatoes. The food would come out all together.The salad came out with the food (WTF) The burger came with no mayo, which was the only thing that I had asked for on it. And the mashed potatoes, were not loaded, they were not mashed really. They were INSTANT potatoes? At a restaurant? For an additional $3? Really? They couldn't get anything right on this visit and I refuse to go back due to the quality of food. Check out this picture that I couldn't help but take of the loaded mashed potatoes that I was given,what a joke, just like TGI Fridays in Union City

Actually enjoyed my dinner here.  Table was not sticky (like the last few times I've been here) and the service was impeccable--server was friendly and fast (unlike before).  Very glad this place changed for the better--will come back. Lots of tvs around the bar area, so a good place to catch a game.   Got the rib-eye, ribs and added lobster and shrimp.  Rib-eye was as expected--decent with A1 sauce.  Ribs were not great.  However the lobster tail was good and the shrimp was crunchy.

Place is a joke. We got seated at one of the tables next to the bar. The waitress came over and took our order. Two Jameson's and two appetizers. She disappears for 15 minutes. No signs of our drinks. We get ready to leave. The waitress walks up to us and asks to see some IDs? Uh isn't it waitressing 101 to ID prior to putting in the drink order to the bartender? So I asked if our drinks were even made up. She said they weren't. I tell her she's too slow and to just forget about it. While my buddy and I are walking away she yells to me "look we have your drinks"  some other waiter was bringing them with our appetizers. At that point it was too late, we kept walking. Hopefully the waitress learned her lesson. YOU ID PRIOR TO PLACING THE ORDER WITH THE BARTENDER TO AVOID CONFUSION.

Because I live in Union City, this spot is an easy go-to especially for late night eats and dranks. I usually just go to the bar area (seat yourself) so my review is generally about my multiple experience from here. Here's what keeps me coming back: Happy Hour 3pm-7pm and 10pm-close and all day on Sundays. Half price apps and pretty good drink deals too. The service is pretty awesome, the staff and friendly and attentive.

I'm still quite baffled by how much quality has gone down over the years at this particular Friday's restaurant. I used to be such a big fan of T.G.I. Friday's, I might even have called it my favorite restaurant. Unfortunately from my past visits, I have slowly watched the quality slowly die.  Last night (Sunday), Friday's was crowded, but it wasn't exceptionally crowded. We were able to be seated within 10-15 minutes vs. the 30-40 min wait we were used to. Which is good. Except -- after we were seated, we had to wait another 15 minute before a waiter came by and introduced himself and asked us if we wanted anything to drink, by then all four of us had already decided what we wanted to eat for dinner. Meanwhile, we watched 4-5 different waiters/waitresses walk past our table serving everyone else food. - 1 5 min later, he brought us our drinks, there was something in my drink. But he noticed it as soon as he put it down on the table, which is good. Except after he brought me a new drink, there was still something inside... -1 Another 10-15 min went by and we all got our orders. Reasonable amount of wait time at a Friday's restaurant, so I figured what the heck, no complaints here. Except my sirloin that I ordered medium well was super well done, dry, and difficult to chew/swallow. My mom's, on the other hand, was ordered well done but her's was juicy and semi-bloody. Either the chef/waiter got it mixed up, or they have consistency issues. Either way, -1. Also my GRILLED shrimp was cold and flavorless, and my sweet potato fries amounted to barely a small handful.  Waiter overall polite enough, not especially friendly or memorable. It really used to be whenever my parents asked where I wanted to go for dinner, I would by default answer "Fridays!" But now, I have several choices, and it's usually not Friday's anymore.  Verdict: Would go, but only rarely.

I came here with my family.  Justin was our server he did a great job! He remembered our order and checked on us frequently. Mike  is the manager here. He helped us get a table where we can sit comfortably. The food was really good I had the sizzling chicken and shrimp.  If you want to come eat here with your family be prepared to Waite for a table at least 20 minits. Definitely worth the waite!!

Everything was fine till our server Michael (mike) has taken over 15 minutes just to come back with our card and receipt. We just want to leave and get home already. Should never take this long to get our shit back.

Me and my hubby went here for happy hour. Jerry our server was amazing and he was always asking us if we needed anything and he was always there to accommodate us! Highly recommend this place and ask for Jerry! Good server
I like hanging around night. TG Friday is one my choice. Unfortunately the kitchen is closed earlier than other place, but we always enjoy dessert! Pls try Oreo Madness $6.29.

The reviews are horrible for service here which is kinda sad. I've been here many times over the years and I always have a good experience on my visits.    Today was no different as we were greeted then shortly after seated by shareen. Shareen was our server and has amazing customer service skills. Once we were seated she asked if we already had an idea of what we wanted to drink. Shareen told us to take our time and let her know when we were ready to order...she walked by several times making sure she was visible.    As soon as we were ready to order, shareen was available. She took our order and made sure it was manicured to our liking(no sesame seeds please).    I ordered my usual sesame jack chicken strips with extra sauce and no sesame seeds, my friend got the Parmesan crusted chicken with mac n cheese, and the Parmesan crusted meat balls. The food came 15 minutes after we ordered. The food was fresh and tasty as always. We ordered another drink(non alcoholic) when we were finished eating with to go boxes...our waitress shareen asked if we wanted to go cups for our drinks and I thought that was pretty cool as I didn't know there were to go cups there. That was never offered before and we have left many barely touched drinks before :) Cheers to another good experience. The full 5 is for Shareen and her service.
Although my portion came out small, my steak tasted great! Service was friendly and place is good for happy hour, their variety of drinks was awesome !!

Food was good, just felt like they should have put more on the plate for the price. I like the atmosphere when I came to eat here. One thing I would for sure get here again and that's it is the Beer and burgers that's mostly it if I wanna get my money's worth.

Happy Hour wasn't correctly advertised so getting there and finding that out was not the greatest surprise. The Jack Daniel's chicken was very good it was the first item on the top left corner of the Jack Daniel's items page. Garlic fries were sitting in a base of oil which made all of the fries on the bottom very oily and inedible. Not worth it for the regular prices but for happy hour I would come back.

I started off with a very pleasant experience with one of the gentleman working there opening the door for me. That was very kind of him to do so...so after the extreme pain of getting my back waxed, I had to reward myself...that I did..one thing before I forge..I think it was the one that got TGIfriday's started was the PERSON THAT CAME UP WITH HAPPY HOUR- how cool is that? Way cool!!! So..let's get to it!!!  I had to order the Turkey sandwich which came with some fries, everything tasted great so far, then I knew that I had to order desert--what should I get??Well, that Oreo cookie ice cream thing--yummmmmmmmmmmyyyy!! Yes, I enjoyed that. The restroom was clean to my standards. ONE PROBLEM IS THAT WHEN I LEFT THIS EATING PLACE I WAS STILL HUNGRY...they won't get five stars from me ever.

The female bartenders are too busy talking to each other and forgot about the food we ordered. The male bartender did apologize and said he wish have known earlier.  Probably will go somewhere else to enjoy the game next time.

Came here recently just to try their Unlimited Appetizers promo going on, and was like "I got my group of friends, why not?" Strike 1: Each person could only order 1 unlimited appetizer, and it was $10 each, for only unlimited refills of that one appetizer.  What's with the fine print, Felicia?  Dang.. Strike 2: The appetizers took very long to come out.  It didn't help that there was a birthday party RIGHT next to our table, so we couldn't hear each other talk or flag down someone easily to ask about the wait. Strike 3: They weren't even good!  We got the bruschetta, potato skins, cheese sticks, and wings.  Of all those, I only liked the wings, so I guess that's safe..   As for the others, the bruschetta was nasty, the potato skins were hella skimpy (don't recall potato skins being potato wedge with a tiny bit of cheese and 1 tiny piece of bacon).  The cheese skins were only okay.  Not coming back if I were the hungriest person alive.  Because I would die before getting my food!

Decent food and drinks. Service the last two times was bad. First time waiter never checked on us during our meal. This last visit no one came for 10 minutes when we arrived. . Then through out the meal the big party next to us was checked on at least 5 times and we were only visited at the end of our meal. Never even has a chance to order anything else. Unfortunately we will not be coming back :(

Awful food that's all. If u do do not care about ur grilled chicken to be dry and test like it was made a week go, if u do not care about ur bill be so much for nothing, and if u do not care about the waitress makes u wait almost 15 min for ur refill, then this is your place.

Havent been here in ages and i totally know why. This was the worst restaurant experience that I've had in my 28 years of life. I did not can not remember the name of the waitress that was supposed to be takimg care of us as she left a horrible impression as she visit our table twice during the hour that we were there. She got our order wrong and brought us cold coffee which took 5 minutes for us to get it back. Our order started to come out come staggered. Nothing arrived at the table at the dame time. Does it make any sense that our appetizers came during the meal rather than prior to? We ordered plain pasta but it came with peppers. We ordered fish and chips and the coleslaw was very weird looking so we switched it for mac and cheese (which never arrived to our table). We also ordered a sizzling cheese and srimp plate, which never arrived either. Typically refills are brought out in new glasses but not here, my coffee xup was clearly stained with my lipstick however the waitress still look the cup into the back and brought it back out refilled with coffee but no additional creamer. Our table was loaded with menus that were never taken away and dirty dishea that we had to lift onto the window seal to sit comfortably. Our waitress did not come back to our table to check on us or to see if we needed anything, she just came for drink orders and food orders. The resturant was very empty when we had arrived so it cant be that they were packed. For the hour that we were there, just about 8 other tables were filled; so the lack of service surely couldnt have been due to being over packed. I would have hated to come in at a peak time to recieve this service. Its pretty clear that I will not be back to this location.
Stay away the food is so lousy should have went to Denny's or IHOP instead the worse food ever

Swung by before heading to the movies on 9/9/14 - we had the options to sit either at the bar or the high tables. We chose the bar because I wanted to watch the game and get my drinks faster. We ordered some buffalo wings and a couple budweisers from the HH menu. Thinking we'd make the movies on time ..  For a first time EVER at a TGIF's .. this place proved EVERYTHING anybody has ever said in regards to the chain to be true. Food is bland and overpriced .. that's about it. It has a bar and the ambiance looks a little higher quality than applebee's but .. that's about it.  Buffalo Wings - I looked at it a good minute before eating it .. and that's a good minute on top of already being late for the movies. So it's from some scrawny chicken - that's fine. I think they oven roast it then twirl it around in some buffalo sauce .. because the drumsticks and wings weren't just small, they were pretty much dehydrated and on their way to being burnt, too.  Service - The girls were nice. They didn't seem to care for being at work, though. Smiled and everything but it was late and they were working - it just makes sense.  Left the place leaving a 20something % tip because our bartender/server was really nice and did her best to smile every time she asked us if we were okay. I wouldn't come back for the food though .. ever. I made the choice of ordering buffalo wings saying " you can't go wrong with buffalo wings. no matter where you go. " - I now stand corrected.

We have been coming to this location for years. Food and service used to be a lot better, but it's going downhill.  My husband and I came here after a long work day and ordered our usual appetizer, Jack Daniel's chicken strips.  When our order came, my husband and I looked at each other like "wtf?" Did they drop the other half on the way to the table or something?  When our server came back, we asked why our order was so skimpy. She replied "I'm sorry, I know... they rip you off here" and then asked what else we needed. Ummm okay.  Not very professional. I was starving so I started eating the sad looking appetizer.  Fast forward to the bill.... damn chicken was $11.  My husband handed the bill and his card to the server and I asked to speak to the manager... I'm not one to complain or make a huge deal about things but the appetizer was almost the price of my entrée, which would be fine if I had gotten the whole order.  The "manager" walks over to the table already looking irritated. I explain to him why I was disappointed in the meal and how they need to be consistent with their portions. I told him we are regulars and have never received a portion so small.  He says portions are always the same and blah blah... but he says he will take them off the bill pretty much rolling his eyes and walks off. Our server came seconds later handing my husband the original check for him to sign. My husband notices that the price on the check is more then the one she had given him before he put his card. I believe it was a $4 difference. So when the manager comes back with the new tab.. I show him the two different checks from the server and he pretty much snatches them from my hand and tells me to forget that tab because he brought a new one. This passes me off because he's not even trying to explain how she was gonna show me one total and then charge my husband another. He tries to get an attitude, and my husband had to tell him to not come at me like that. I never raised my voice or came at him crazy.  He finally apologized and says he doesn't know how why she did that. Half a**. Worst service ever.  Pay attention to your tabs when coming here. Oh, and your portions. If your in doubt, search IG.  #JackDanielsChickenStrips reassured me that I was not trippen and I was getting played. Lol

Can you give less than one star? I've been sitting at the bar for almost 20 minutes. There are three people tending it. They've walked past me literally over a dozen times and not once have either of them say "what can I get you. I'm going to sit here another  5 minutes and walk out... Do I look horrible? Maybe I smell... I can emphatically say no to either... This crew really sucks...I wish I could get their names but they don't wear name tags... It's now 6:42 and this kid just asked me "can I get you anything?" Hmmmm. I sat down at 6:15 Also WiFi sucks, the waitress I stopped to ask about it says so...

Username: Three Hundred And Fifty Degrees A.
review: Just like any big corporate restaurant. Food was decent, service was no different then the rest. If you enjoy the company you are with then it's worth it. Just don't come in with high expectations and the disappoint isn't as bad. Just remember, they are a corporate company, so we aren't talking 5 star chefs, we are talking just out of culinary school (if that, that's giving them a little ego boost, with the hopes of branching off into something of their own) with recipes and how too instructions from people sitting in an office believing they know what EVERYONE likes. So when expectations of GREAT food and service isn't met, just remember where u r. Overall, the servers do what they can with what they have. It's not fully their fault the "chefs" don't have an idea of when a small steak should be off the grill. In the end, you just have to tolerate the fact it's nothing special except a last minute idea when your first idea falls through.
Came here the other night and service was too slow. It was not busy, and my husband and I were there for 2 hours just for an appetizer and dinner. Don't think I'll be coming back here.

I'm actually surprised at the ratings this location has, I will admit the hostess up front aren't the friendliest nor do I think they do a very good job of greeting but my experience wasn't all too bad.  My waiter was great, consistently checked up and made sure everything was to our liking. Mind you it was a crowded Friday night in the patio area. He made suggestions and assurance of our choices.  Ordered the sampler plate and for appetizers it was filling and big enough to share with everyone. The crab cakes were not up to standard though. Over seasoned and mushy. The bbq chicken was sweet and tangy just the way it was meant to be.  The blended margaritas were on hit and happy hour is always the best time.

I have come here multiple times over the years. Not sure what I can tell you. This is TGIF. Ok food, ok service, lot of TVs playing sports. They have a decent happy hour where appetizers are half off. On the recent outing, we got the sliders, fried string beans, mozzarella sticks, fries and wings and they were...OK. That's it. Over and out.

The managers at this place should all be canned. Forget the WiFi, it has been useless for YEARS and its a cell phone dead zone for T-mobile at least. Get service soon as step outside the building though.

Worst customer service!!!! It took forever to get our drinks and appetizers. Of course the server didn't know what all we ordered and messed up our bill. Non of the managers were helpful and didn't offer any discounts or complimentary item for incorrectly charging us. I think this location needs to hire qualified Managers who can actually speak English and understand customers!

If I could give TGIF zero stars I would. The only positive thing I have to say is the waiter was great very friendly and attentive. My husband and I ordered a steak and lobster. My son ordered a child's cheese burger. We asked for our steaks to be cooked medium well and when we got our steaks they were well done, the lobsters were salty and the baked potato was bland. My son said his burger tasted like his schools cafeteria lunch and my margarita tasted watered down more ice than any alcohol. Definitely not our money worth we will not be coming back.

Came here on a Sunday evening and was able to find quick seating in the bar. Sat at the bar tables and was never greeted by a server for 15+ minutes. Flagged a hostess down in which she brought menus over. Sat again for another 5 minutes waiting for a server. The table next to myself cleared out and a group of guys sat down. Within 2 minutes, they were quickly greeted by a server. It's upsetting that I sat there for now 20 min and I still haven't gotten greeted my a server. I ended up leaving upset and now a restaurant to avoid because of the horrible customer service.

Went here yesterday with friends after work. We waited 45 mins for our appetizers, which was our main meal. Thats a ridiculous amount of time waiting for our food. Also, the miso wings were still missing. It took over 1hr for the wings to come out. Paid for the bill and left. We wanted dessert, but didn't want to wait another hour for a vanilla bean cheesecake.

We were worried about service because of all the bad reviews. But our experience was great! We arrived at 6:45pm on a Friday and were seated within 10mins. Our server, Deseree (spelling?), promptly brought drinks, then hot appetizers. Our entrees were ready and waiting for us before we finished the apps. Deseree let us eat in peace and discretely placed new drinks on the table as needed. When done, she showed up with a to-go box and the bill. Very happy with service and food.

One of my friends and I were catching up and were celebrating my belated 30th with some drinks and apps. I had never been before last week, but had seen commercials about their amazing appetizers, so I thought what the heck.  The bar was bustling and busy. There were a few sports games going on. We sat in the bar surrounded by several televisions. Too bad I'm not a sports fan because it would have been a dream come true.  It was happy hour, so my friend and I got two margaritas. I got the Mango Berry blended and loved it. I do highly recommend that drink. Got me pretty buzzed as well. Pretty generous in alcohol.  For apps, we tried the mozzarella sticks, ahi tuna chip bites, and the sesame chicken tenders.  - the mozzarella sticks were fine. Nothing special.  - the ahi tuna was a mess. It wasn't seared properly, and ended up getting the chip soggy. The fish was grisly and you couldn't take a clean bite without struggling with the fish. Good flavor but technically a flop.  - the chicken was great. Good flavor and crispy on the outside. However, they were on the border of being burnt they were so dark.  I also ordered the clam chowder. Not pleased. It had a weird flavor and color. I could barely taste the clams either.  I would return for drinks a few of the apps (after carefully reading reviews next time), but I will most likely not order from the meal menu considering my friend did not like her pasta dish and I really disliked the clam chowder.

I was so excited to go here, but was disappointed. Their online menu (which we checked out before going) does not match up with what they have at the restaurant, so we didn't get to order what we had our hearts set on ordering in the first place. I was still stoked to order my chicken burger, which ended up tasting like the inside of an overused BBQ. Nothing impressive about either of our meals.  TGIFriday's is an overpriced Red Robin, except Red Robin is way better.

TGI Friday's is on of the better chain restaurants out of Applebee's, Chili's, etc. Their food is decent and I love their happy hour. I usually get their wings and some beers.  Service is a hit or miss. I've had excellent service even when it was super busy and I've had shitty service when it was slow and vice versa. It seems to always be busy and packed here.

We were able to get a table in the bar pretty easily for a Friday night, which was about the only positive thing that happened. The service was INCREDIBLY slow, the food was pretty unimpressive for the price we were being charged, and the parking was a nightmare.

I usually have a good dining experience... Great appetizers... the BEST mixed drinks... my fav is the Long Island... the Mojitos are delish too!... The Happy Hour choices are the best in the area... Today's lunch was very filling...

I forgot the last time I came here for dinner but just recently I came here for their Happy Hour which was at 10pm til closing for my friend's 21st Birthday. At first it was really packed even on a Tuesday night and we thought we weren't going to get seats but luckily we found two tables that we could put together with a party of about 9 people.  Their Happy Hour selection is pretty good. Drinks are good and fairly priced and food is delicious and pretty cheap. Depending on the time you get there and what day you go on, it is usually packed near the area near the bar because of Happy Hour.  I would say my two favorite drinks on the Happy Hour menu is the Strawberry Margarita and the Mango Margarita. Both are fruity drinks and don't have much alcohol in them. They usually serve them with fruits as well. The food that I always get during Happy Hour because it is worth it because it is only $1.50 is the basket of fries. Had their loaded potato skins too and I have to say it wasn't that bad either for the amount they give you and the price of $4.50 because it was half off. I also have to say that the Jack Daniels sauce is the bomb! I will come back to this place for Happy Hour again and try more of their drinks and food! Cheap and good! NOTE: Happy Hour is 3-7pm and 10-close :)

I love this place we would usually go to the one in Cupertino but they closed it. We drove this far for a special day my birthday. And Luis the manager was extremely attentive with us best service food was great. It was worth the drive. Definitely coming back hope there was one closer tho. Thank you Luis for making it a great birthday dinner for us. :)

Went there with friends for a dinner. The seating was very crammed. We were sitting in the isle close to the kitchen and there wasn't enough room to seat comfortable and for waiters and guests to walk by easily. Music was very loud and it was very hard to talk. But that not as important. What really ticked me off is the food.  I remembered there mozzarella sticks from back in the day. When we got those cheese sticks, they were nothing what they used to be. They tasted very stale. Moving on to entrees. I ordered some ribs (thankfully only 1/2 rack) and they were overly done. There wasn't much meat and whatever meat was there was very dry. My friends got steaks and those steaks were also horrible.  I think that for a $45 bill per person that is completely unacceptable. It's not OK to have bad food period, but when you're getting robbed while at it... The only thing that made that whole experience better was the full bar I don't think I'll be going back there anytime soon.

My boyfriend and I usually come here because it's the closest location to us. Our first visits weren't short of what was expected. We came in, got seated, server took our order, we ate, and we left. Typical restaurant visit.  On our last visit to TGIF, we had the most awful experience. As soon as we walked in, we were greeted. I didn't think anything of that. It took the host a while to seat us and I had no idea why. There were so many tables open. We didn't feel welcomed. It was BLAH to say the least.  Our server, Ericka, paid absolutely no attention to us. She walked really fast past our table a few times. No smile. No greetings. Nothing. Just "what can I get for you?" I was thankful that the food came out fast, but after two bites of my food, she came by with our check. My boyfriend and I felt rushed. We wanted to enjoy our dinner. We never order dessert at restaurants and that night was one of the rare nights that we wanted dessert. After about five minutes, she came back and asked if we wanted anything else, as if she didn't just put the check on our table. We didn't feel like getting dessert anymore. My philosophy is, if you don't like your job, GET A NEW ONE!!

Went here to grab some $10 ribs like I saw on tv, but of course they said their franchise wasn't participating.  I would like a list of which TGIF offers $10 ribs.  Service was not much better, waiter never came to refill any drinks which TGIF made us buy to get the chicken/fish for $10.  I decided to get the ribs anyways (WRONG CHOICE)!!! Only one side of the ribs was covered with sauce and the ribs were dry and had no flavor.   Huge disappointment!
Got our food to go and it was just gross and didnt look nice. Giving it 2 stars for location
We were here for a late dinner last week and it was refreshingly great! We will definitely be back!  Don't forget to tip your great server at least 20 percent! They work hard for it!
Been here a few times and the food is always good, but the service is horrible and the food always takes long. On a plus side they do have good size TVs.

Came here for lunch about a week or so ago and this place has TERRIBLE customer service. We waited at least 5 minutes at the front door before anyone even came to seat us. I saw an employee and we even made eye contact, and she just walked away, which is sad in the restaurant business. The food was subpar. Burger was greasy, appetizers were greasy. Almost everything was greasy! And our server was hardly anywhere to be found. She'd come around every 30 minutes or whatever to go put in another order for our appetizer (which was unlimited by the way).  This place is terrible with terrible customer service. Sorry T.G.I., don't expect me to come back. Don't send me free food coupons either. I've seen and tasted your food, and I do NOT want to have my stomach pumped after. Deuces.

Ordered Jack Daniels ribeye medium rare.  No jack sauce on it AT ALL and it was raw in parts.  Gristle and marbling are not the same thing and this was gristly and chewy piece of meat with huge chunks of chewy fat.  Part of dinner was baked potato where I asked for all toppings on the side.  No sour cream??! That's weird. Also ordered hot wings as an appetizer and it all came out together.  Seriously?  Tough tough tough to get good service in Newark, Fremont, Union City, Milpitas, Hayward.  I'm so disappointed because, done right, the Jack Daniels dishes are great.
