I'd pass

Desiree the bartender RUDE!!!!! This review is strickly about her. Sat at the bar with my sister in law to celebrate our birthdays. I said, I hope we get good service because I will YELP about my experience. Well Ms. Desiree said "No one pays attention to that shit!". Then she threw the napkins on the bar and walked away. No problem Desiree, I got better service from Jaz & he got your tip. I made a complaint with your manager Mike. YOU ARE RUDE!!!!!!

I went here with a friend and I ordered a plate (I forgot the name) that had shrimp, chicken, and mashed potato. It was mediocre. The shrimp was a bit dry on the inside.  This place is expensive in my opinion. Especially for the food you get, which I heard can sometimes be really good and sometimes not that great.  Again, my experience was mediocre. It wasn't bad but it definitely wasn't worth the 18 dollars I paid for that one dish.

Leon was the server. He can not follow directions.  Then the kitchen has an issue with cross contamination.  I ordered no butter on the steak.  The steak arrived with butter.  Back it went.  Then it arrived back.  There was a fried shrimp in the bottom of the fries.  They claimed it fell off another plate.  It was under the fries.  Then the bill was wrong.  Over charged.  I told him I should have been comped for the terrible meal, he said "Why."  Talking to him got me nowhere.  I spoke to the manager.  All he could say was, "It wasn't brought to my attention."  I brought it, he did nothing to solve the problem.  So, avoid the restaurant.  I am not returning anytime soon.

Came here for unlimited appetizers. Food was pretty good. We ordered the boneless wings, potato wedges, and mozzarella sticks. We ordered the $10 deal but didn't realize that you couldn't change your appetizers with the $10 deal and that there was a $12 deal on the back of that menu that allowed you to change your appetizers. (Our mistake). Our initial waiter just seemed extremely inpatient with us. He was the type of waiter that while you're ordering is kinda walking away and talking to you behind his back. Made us feel super rushed and angsty. it also always took us forever to flag him down. Which made us really annoyed. The last straw was when we asked him to change our $10 deal to the $12 deal. He was so apathetic to our mistake saying no no no, you cannot do that in an extremely condescending tone. So we'd had enough! We called the manager and luckily the manager was so kind and sympathetic to our mistake and changed our deal. He also frequently checked up on us. What a great guy :) made it worth coming here. Cheers to great management!

Food was bland and dry.  Table was never cleared of appetizer plates or salad bowls. Soda was only refilled once. Had to ask.  Over priced Denny's food.  Our server was "Hector" P.S. Took over 15 minutes to pay for the meal. The card was in the check holder waiting to go for 15 minutes...

Great experience! It was a Tuesday so there was no waiting. We had a quick very polite waiter. The burger was the best I've eaten in a long time. Luis the manager introduced himself making sure we were enjoying ourselves. I will definitely return.

Can I put down no stars? This is incredible - the food is basically the half frozen/barely cooked stuff that is apparently marketed as being suitable for consumption. Even browned out drunk people would spit this stuff out. I was tolerant about the service for some off reason (although that should've been my first cue that what was to follow was not going to be any better) - took 10+ minutes to get a server to distribute menus and about a solid 35 minutes to get my appetizer sample.  If that was a plan to somehow coax me into buying alcohol in the lull, it sure didn't work because all I wanted was to satisfy my hunger. Imagine my dismay and disgust when I received half cooked items that appeared to be edible but were repulsive upon biting and chewing.  It's a mystery to me how they stay in business - hopefully something changes but I'm absolutely never going back.

So after we left an escapade at the bar, we decided to grab a bite to eat. Well we had a waitress by the name of "Tamana" Well Tamana has horrible customer service. I don't know if her dude broke up with her, she wasn't feeling good or whattt!So we place our order and she clearly didn't write our order in right. With that being said we told her to take the wings back. My salad looked like it was the last of the lettuce with a lil dirt on top of it. I asked for balsamic and they decided to put the ranch on my sad lil house salad. I asked her to bring me some balsamic and I guess she didn't hear me because she never brought it to me. So as we received our bill, I noticed she hadn't taken some things off the receipt. I asked her about it and she responded very rude.So I responded and said, I'm going to ask you to respond to my question in a different manner because you are being rude.Oh and that is when Tamana decided to expose how she really felt. She called us cheap, she went on to say that we should've went McDonald's and continued yelling obscenities as she walked away. I was furious and she made me wanna sit and wait for tale to get off work. She is lucky, I'm not the same person I was back in the day. The manager came over and apologized and stated he'd have a word with her. We just had one interesting night!!!! Goodness! Tamana, customer service clearly isn't your calling!!!!

The food was cold when it was brought out. I confronted the manager about the food and that is was cold; he did nothing.  I wouldn't recommend this place to my worst enemy.  Oh, the drinks was watered down too;while you can!

Free wifi in Union Landing! I sometimes need to get work done around here and I don't like the vibe at that little coffee shop downtown, so I was really pleased to find out that this place has wifi. Super nice service. How's the food? Sysco processed junk, but you know that already.
If you get Leon as a server, consider yourself blessed. Leave that guy a fat tip, he deserves it!

First time here and it was busy at 10p. Luckily there was seating in the bar area, otherwise there was a long wait for 2 ppl. Friendly wait staff, nice bar, good food selections. I had a build your own burger. It was just alright. The sweet potatoes were the best I've had so far, but wish they had an aioli or sauce to go with it other than ranch, bbq or ketchup. It took a little long to get the food (20 mins). Overall, good experience.
Had dinner here with my hubby and the food was on point! Jaidah was our server and she was so sweet and went above & beyond:) definitely gonna be going here more often.

It's been a while since having dinner at a TGIF's and what a disappointment! The portions are a lot smaller than the last time I remember ever coming too a TGIF. The half rack of ribs looked like a child's serving and the salmon was so small it wouldn't cover at least a McDonald's bun. For a $50 dinner, I would expect more than this. We should've had dinner at either Texas Roadhouse or Claim Jumpers...at least we would've gotten what we paid for. The only thing that was "normal" size was the 9 oz wine. Would I come back? Absolutely not!
Loved it. Everything you come to expect for a TGI Fridays anywhere else in the country.

Honestly I come here a lot and the past few days that I've went they sucked I always order the nachos for me and my friends and today their food was cold and first of all I had to wait about 10-15 minutes for the waiter to come by to ask us what we wanted to drink. Afterwards when our nachos came to our table it was cold and chips were stale... And the chicken was super cold I don't know why but I think when the food comes out they wait for it to sit there and get cold then serves it to us...   After we ordered our main courses I noticed everyone was getting their damn food except for me and my friends and it was over 30 minutes and I didn't not want to wait their and eat cold food. I walled up to an employee and told her to cancel our order and honestly I wasn't gonna pay for the nachos and sodas it wasn't worth it and on top of it they are over priced I get it happy hour is happy hour but just because the food was half the price doesn't mean you give us half a meal.... And when we did order our food the waiter was telling us that they didn't half the stuff so I was limited to decide on what I wanted to eat.. And when I needed the waiter and asked someone else to get our waiter for us he went to him told him we were calling for him, he was just chit chatting with his coworkers... I don't know if I am going back their or not but these past few days they sucked at service and the food was crap! If they don't have much to serve ... Then better off staying closed!!!

First of all the front hostess is an idiot, i ask for a booth and they gave me a middle table, then i told the girl  i saw an empty booth then she said ohh i did not see it, then she seat us down and for more than 10 minutes nobody came to ask if we need it somothing  to drink or eat took for ever service sucks in here. Honestly  i probably will think twice to come over to this crappie place...

What a horrible experience, first the bartender/ supervisor yells at us for moving from the bar with our drinks to a empty table that was next to the bar and adjacent (nobody left), mind you we asked them first before moving, the only reason we moved was because more friends had arrived. We ordered drinks, 1 beer and a martini arrived after 10mins and we continued waiting for the rest of our drinks 30mins for the rest of our drinks???? I had already finished my drink, my girl had finished hers and our guests drinks took forever to arrive? Wtf? I told the lady that we were leaving because of the delay. Without apologizing she rudely started going on about how we weren't the only people in the bar. Honestly idk about your job duties, that's your job. I have a job and I don't chastise a client if i messed up. If she'd of just walked over to let us know there were a lot of orders and there was a delay that would of been acceptable. The 2 people that ruined our experience at your business caused you to lose 5customers in 1 shot. Great job you 2, our visit was on Saturday between 6-645pm. 1 happy customer would share there experience with 10people but 1 unhappy customer would tell 100. Now times that by 5 unhappy customers.

Horrible service in the bar area especially the Latina bar tender with the 1990's hair style. Her attitude and hair style had me taken back. The manager is extremely nice, but has no control of his staff.  I probably wouldn't come back.

When it's happy hour and appetizers are half off is the best and only time I like to go here. Regular meals are over priced for the quality. Service has always been slow no matter what time I go - busy or not. They allowed me to have my dog join my dinner in the outside seating area - but then a week later dogs weren't allowed anymore and they tried to tell me because management changed - and when I said "in a week?!!" The lady goes oh well then no. I wish I had remembered the name of the server when they allowed my dog. He was awesome, brought my pup water, was friendly and kind and wasn't even suppose to serve us (the outdoor seating wasn't open at the time and we were at first told we would have to walk in to the bar to order which we were fine with but to our surprise this awesome guy decided to come out to serve us anyways - kudos to you: you need a raise.) He was a tall, dark hair white male. Hair was shaved, he was goofy and friendly. That experience was a 5 star. Every other has been disappointing.
It's so horrible that I have been waiting 15-25 minutes at a time everytime we order something.  Ive asked for the check for 3 times already within 30 fucking minutes.

I want to give them a 3.5 stars but since I can't do half star so I am giving them 4. My fiance brought me here because he loves their chicken wings in the Jack Daniel Sauce. We came here on a Sunday right when they open at 11:00am; the hostess looked sleepy when she "welcome" us without a smile; we sat down and was immediate served by a waitress, she was very friendly and helpful.  We ordered an order of chicken wings and an order of steak in J.D. sauce. The chicken was amazingly good! I don't know how they did it but it was very flavorful, crispy on the outside and tender in the inside! I would love to order one more if we had the time to dine longer. Not to mention it was half off; Happy hour on the appetizer menu all day on Sunday! The rib eye steak though, I wasn't too impressed because the beef was not a good quality of beef, it was like something I can get from Denny's but in J.D. sauce.  We also ordered their Bloody Marry with Grey Goose, it was in a huge glass cup that only costed $8; we will definitely coming back here but I will probably only order their chicken wings and some drinks to go along with it.
These guys need to replace the menu  for cocktails(happy to make it for you)..worst cocktails ever had good customer service food not bad

Best happy hour food! Even better with the selection of hh drinks. Seriously, we always go overboard ordering food straight from memory here. Happy hour apps that's half off,  regular (big!) portions and extremely tasty? I'm so there. My regular menu: -chicken wings, sauce on the side. Always crispy and juicy! -beer cheese pretzels. Always comes out with crispy edges and piping hot. A fave. -$1.50 cheeseburger sliders. Love the char grilled taste, with cartelized onions. Makes it seem gourmet. -fries basket- simple, extremely cheap and good. - chicken quesadilla - large portion, pretty good. Can get a variety of good drinks for $3-5. Tip: try their Wednesday special. Rack of jack Daniels ribs for only $10.99 I think. Plus, add on a gigantic beer for $3. Love their fall off the bone ribs! Service isn't always prompt, but food and drinks never disappoint.

After a busy morning at the office, I wanted to get out for lunch instead of the usual nuke the frozen meal for lunch at my desk routine. I drove up the road a couple of miles to the TGI Friday's at Union Landing for lunch -- overall, not the best choice. When I arrived, the two girls at the front seemed a little confused but seated me promptly at a booth and presented me with the menu and walked away ... no drink order??  She came back about five minutes later and asked if I wanted something to drink and I ordered an iced tea.  She brought me an "iced" tea -- sans ice and room temperature.  Another 10 minutes passed before my server, Devon, came by to take my order. I mentioned that it had been 10 minutes, and all Devon could seem to manage was an "I appologize" and a weak excuse that he had been taking care of a large party.. I could see his large party.. all of six people!! Hmmm??? I had the Dragonfire Chicken with jasmine rice and broccoli.  The meal came out in about l4 minutes (yes, I timed it).  The meal was just OK, not a lot of flavor but at least the chicken was fully cooked and still moist. I was never asked if I wanted a refill on the "iced" tea as my empty glass sat at the edge of the table for the last half of my meal. Devon eventually came by and asked if I had finished and wanted the check.  Still no offer to refill the drink. The food was OK but the service stank like last week's fish.

Horrible, I originally ordered to eat at the bar, but had to leave early and asked for it to go.  What i got when i got to the house and looked at it , was a freaking joke.  Two thin chicken dry chicken breasts, 5 freakin shrimp covered in mediocre marinara sauce and a slice of semi melted american cheese.  $16 for less food that I could have from a hungry man dinner?

I hate to write a bad review, but the service here is terrible.. I'm giving this place a 1 star for the service that is provided. It shouldn't take 10 minutes to order a drink at the bar when there's only 3 people sitting at the time. The server should really get off her phone and pay attention on what's going on around her. The place was empty while I'm there, so it shouldn't take 30 minutes to get cheese sticks.. Place is terrible and won't be coming back again.
Garlic breadsticks had no garlic. Lemonade had ice all the way to top of glass. Salad has watered down ranch. Plates were never cleared.

So I have been coming here for 10 years now! The staff has changed over the years but has stayed pretty consistent. The food has been up and down over the years. There happy hours are OK. The entertainment (TVs) are better than most. I think this place can use a little better management skills. The costumer service department needs season vets to teach these young workers how to serve a little better. This place is roomy and has an outdoor patio. I will continue to come here on principle and the fact that I live right by the place. Ha

If you read one review of TGI Friday's, you've read them all.  I came here to watch game 7 of the NLCS and this place was wild. Everyone was cheering and it was the perfect environment to watch the game. The female bartenders were pretty quiet and timid but the guy bartender who came right at game time was awesome. He was hyping up the bar and was super nice.  There was however one sleazy guy cracking really vulgar jokes and was annoying me. It was weird that the staff knew who he was and encouraged him! I wouldn't keep pumping him up since it didn't look like he was ordering a whole bunch of stuff and just annoying customers (or me at least). Anyways, this location is pretty nice with lots of televisions and the food was decent.  P.S. that Jack Danial's sauce is addicting. Its the only reason I go to TGI Fridays.

Walked in. A waitress walked past. No eye contact. . Actually looked away. The hostess was absent. After an embarrassingly long time, We waived down some guy that looked like he worked there. He sat us next to a table of kids.  Left. Won't be back.

Was waiting in line for seating, waited for about 20, but we decided not to go since the wait. Never even got to talk a employee. OK is you are able to wait. Not for kids, because most people are drunk

I love this place because of the customer service! It was a pleasure coming because the lady was really nice and helpful with what to get. Overall good place, clean and nice. Although at the end waiter went MIA

I've never had a server roller eyes at me after they forgot my order. My table of 9 waited 40 minutes for their food and my order was forgotten as well as the birthday girls. There was no apology and no further service from this waitress after asking why my steak was overlooked. Terrible service. A lot of the servers sat a few tables down from us texting on their phones the entire time.
Whenever I hit Fridays in Union Landing u have to head to the Bar to a Bartender Name Mike Greatest Bartender in the World Hands down ! In a packed bar he made me feel rite at Home !

I don't frequent TGIF but saw a commercial for their new burgers and had to try one. The burger was excellent. I ordered seasoned fries. There's an extra charge for them but they look exactly like regular fries and they tasted like only salt and pepper was added. They're supposed to be bottomless but the waiter charged for them as a separate item.  I have to say that service was lacking all around. The entrance is odd in that there isn't room to check in and step aside so everyone stands around and it's just a cluster.... no one is ever at the front when I arrive. This last visit the host showed up, he never welcomed us.  He didn't even say hi. He just asked for the number in our party, said, "hold on, let me see if there's a table" and walked away, then returned with,  "over here" and proceeded to walk away. I'm smart so I figured out I was supposed to follow. The server had too much to drink the night before and said he was recovering so he wasn't on point. It was more than between five and 10 minutes before he arrived to take drink orders. Besides the fries, there were delays in getting drink refills, and long delays between checking in on us.

The day before Valentines, I took my wife out to dinner, since 2/14 is always crowded wherever you go.  But on this day, Friday's wasn't that busy, so we were seated right away.   We started with the Crab Cake appetizer, which came out very quickly.  The two cakes were very large and mostly crab with very little filler.  They didn't have much of a taste on their own, but the dipping sauce provided a must-needed kicked. Both my wife & I ordered a steak and shrimp meal, though with different sides.  My wife got the Jack Daniels Sirloin and fried shrimp with a side of Parmesan Garlic Fries and a Tomato Mozzarella Salad.  Her steak and shrimp tasted fine, but the fries were drenched in a really heavy sauce, and she barely touched it.  I ordered a Rib-eye steak and added some scampi shrimp, along with a baked potato and the salad.  I ordered my steak medium rare, but it came out of the kitchen very rare.  It tasted fine, but was a lot more chewier than I prefer.  Next time, I'll order my steak medium to get the right texture. Overall, the meal was just fine.  Not bad, but not fantastic, either.  Our service was exceptional, though, with our server refilling our drinks frequently.

Service sucks!!! I waited 45 minutes for my check! Our waitress didn't even check if we needed anything! Ridiculous! I called the manager who didn't even bothered to come to our table! I'm only giving this place 1 star cause it won't allow me to do ZERO

I came here for the endless appetizer deal, but they discontinued it! So sad. I was just here a month ago when they had it.  I sat at the bar area yesterday and the waitress was super nice and attentive. I wish I remembered her name!! But I definitely come here for their happy hour. Half off appetizers. Woot woot! Anything else on their food menu is pretty pricy for the quality.

Today was one of the worst experiences that I have had a TGI Fridays in Union City. My server's name was Tatiana she got both orders wrong and we has to wait 15 minutes for silverware and condiments. Then it didn't get any better because the food was gross.

So we get there and the place is packed. Hostess says at least 45minutes for a table of 7. Drunks walking out of the place and literally belching on there way out (barf). We get called in 15mins and as soon as you walk in place is dirty noisy and rowdy. I see the happy hour menu that is all day Sunday and understand why the crowd is how it is, ghetto in all its glory.  The waitress was nice but has no clue about the food or menu. Starters were good and got there quick. Nachos were small for a chain restaurant but were tasty, great boneless buffalo wings, potato skins and mozzarella sticks. The artichoke dip was also good but not enough chips which after asking they brought more. The new jack sampler is generous, the new jack sliders yummy, We asked about vegetarian options for my daughter and dumbly the waitress said we don't have anything vegetarian. We only have a black bean hamburger  lol, #clueless. I also asked her if the dish I was asking for had "caprese salad" because I couldn't make it out from the picture in the menu and she said no "its basil, tomatoes and mozzarella" once again  lol!!! The chips the show on the menu didn't come with the dip and the portion of my plate was smaller than what you saw on the menu. The rice and the steak with the langostino lobster was delicious just small. My kids enjoyed their burgers as well and my husband. Drink wise the margaritas were big and made correctly as well as the mai thai. All in all I gave it 3 stars because of the annoying crowd and un-informed waitress. Good place to drink and have appetizers if your on a budget and don't have kids with you (they were cussing left and right to us).
Great customer service and we were served quickly. Lizbeth was wonderful!

This place was pretty bad. When we first got here the hostess was sitting outside on the phone. So we stood inside for a few minutes before she came to ask us where we wanted to sit. We sat at a booth and ordered some appetizers before our friends arrived. When they arrived we realized that the booth wasn't big enough for all of us so we told our waitress we were going to switch tables. She said it was fine but we were going to have a new server.  So we moved tables and no one let anyone know that we had moved so we sat around waiting for about half an hour before asking the hostess if she could find out waitress. Another 15 minutes and we asked one of the other waitresses if we could order who also told us just to wait a minute to find her. Once we found her she promptly apologized for not coming since she saw our appetizers and thought we had been served already.  She was great and nice. But after already waiting almost an hour just to be served the food took way too long. Then for some reason they decided to turn up the volume on the music so loud that we had to yell at each other.  None of the other waitresses seemed to be doing anything that didn't involved their own tables. When we left they were all standing in a circle by the front door just chit chatting and no one greeted or said bye to anyone in our group.

Edgar made this visit today without him this place gets  -4 stars. Edgar was the only person who even acknowledged our existence. He sat us down and took the time to customize our experience.  Service other then him is in need of major overhaul.

Came in here for brunch with 2 friends. I hdnt seen them in awhile and chose this place since I've never eaten at it. It was pretty empty but is was 11AM. We weren't expecting it to be busy. It was pretty clean. No messy tables. Our waitress was pleasant. It took us about an hour to order. We hadn''t spoken to each other for so long that we were catching up and had no time to look at the menu. Our waitress was kind enough to wait and she frequently checked on us to see if we were ready. I ordered the korean wraps, my friend got the salmon and my other friend got the fettuccine. We all had some mozzarella sticks for the appetizer. They were good but i wish they offered more sauce. korean wraps were BOMB!!! I'd order them again. It doesn't come with hot sauce and I had requested some. She said they only had tabasco and wing sauce. she said the wingsauce was pretty hot and I told her I don't mind as long as its okay for me to have some. she brought both of them and i ended up just using the wing sauce. it sure was hot and i only used it sparingly. but it didn't add that kick it needed. if you like spicy i recommend you requesting the sauce its so good!!! i was very happy that the accommodated to my needs. the beef was cooked well it wasn't tough. it came iwth a side of rice and had some cilantro in it. i was kinda confused about it since it was on the side. i guess you can add some in your wrap or eat it on the side. i did both. and it both worked. Its a pretty healthy meal. not friend or drenched in cheese. i was very content with the portion too. DEFINITELY WILL ORDER AGAIN. I had a bit of my friends salmon and shrimp. It was pretty watery. The fettuccine was alright. For the most part my friends didn't finish their food. They thought theirs was okay.

Came to the restaurant for it's famous Jack Daniel sauce and guess what, they didn't have any. Pretty disappointing since I drove all the way from Oakland, CA. So I guess for future reference I'll have to call to ask what dishes and sauces are available before driving over here.
Very good service and nice food as I spent one dinner with my colleague. Traditional TGI menu available - we like drinks and foods. Good for hangout.

I went here recently with a couple friends to grab some all-you-can-eat appetizers. We went in pretty late, proabably between 10pm and 11pm. Almost no wait to get seated, which was cool - and not always the case at this location. Everyone in the restaurant was just hanging out it seemed. Not much energy in the air, though. The hostess was nice enough to let us wait for a booth seat, and then take it once her busser was done cleaning it up. That got some brownie points, for sure :). However, we already knew what we wanted and we had no clue who our server was. We inquired with the hostess, who wasn't much help, then I asked another server to help us out and he said he'd let our server know. After a bit of waiting, I finally saw our server approach the booth next to ours, so we finally flagged her down...but then we had to wait while she prepped for a birthday at the table across from us. It took a really long time for her to get things ready and finally come out for the really short birthday song - quite unenethusiastic as those go by the way. Then she FINALLY come and took our order. At this point, we had been waiting about 20 minutes already... The fried mozzarella sticks were very good in my opinion, the buffalo wings were slightly above average. Better with the scorching hot sauce plus the buffalo sauce! The potato skins, however, were terrible. The three of us all started reminiscing about Elephant Bar's potato skins ON THE SPOT! Pass on the potato skins - they're  HUGE let-down! After the huge disappointment, our server was nice enough to let us get the Bruschetta, which was SURPRISINGLY GOOD!!! I usually hate bruschetta, especially from places like this. It's usually too stale with not enough good toppings. The bread was just right, and the toppings were very good, especially the tomatoes. The server stepped it up for sure after the long wait, and a couple of the items were quite good, so this balanced out to 3 stars for me.

I've never liked coming to this place. Pros: ~ The service is nice. NOT GOOD. Just nice. The servers are very friendly. Crafty people trying to make me feel bad about giving one star but I'm going to do it anyway. ~ Clean.  ~ They have good taste in music. One time I came here and they had The White Stripes playing. Awwww yeah. That's about it. Several things I have to complain about: SLOW. SLOW SLOW. I came here with my family the last time and I wasn't very hungry so I just ordered a side of mashed potatoes. Just a little side of it. Tell me why it took 25 minutes to arrive. Slowest service I have EVER experienced. 25 minutes would be fine for a big plate, but a small cup of mashed potatoes? It wasn't even that good either... Very microwaved, powdery, and tasteless. I tried to make up for it by ordering a red velvet cake.  ... How can you mess up red velvet cake? Why did it taste like dark chocolate and not red velvet light delicious spongey? Why am I eating in your shitty establishment? So many questions.  I'm sorry, the servers are awesome. But TGIF, how many damn chefs do you have?

Came here at 945 and they close at 11pm. They told us the kitchen was already closed last call was at 930pm. That's still an hour and a half before they close. Are you kidding me? We ended up going across the street where the restaurants kitchen closes the same time the entire restaurant does. Horrible!

50% appetizer happy hour lured me in.... what was I thinking? The food was disgusting and I felt sick the next day. The service was crap. It took forever to order food, drinks, and get the bill. The waiter we had never once checked on us and we had to grab him and ask for more drinks on two occasions. Never again.  TGIY - Thanks God I Yelp!

I don't normally give 1 star but in this case I was being generous. Worst server ever. 20 minutes just to get drinks and then he breaks the drinks as he is bringing them. 30 minutes to get kids drinks. Asked for a manager and one never came. The order was completely wrong, had to ask for it to be corrected and it was still wrong. Cucumbers when we asked for none, no cheese on salad when we asked for goat cheese, sides missing, salads came after the meal. While I was looking for a unique dining experience, this level of unique should best be avoided. Food was great, service, however, left a lot to be desired.
Best customer service from Greg, Alexis and Tammy! My favorite waiters! One of my favorite places to go to and their happy hour is actually reasonable! A cool place to chill and drink with friends!

Jack's chicken strips have always been the best thing on the menu in my opinion, but the new recipe for the potato skins is freaking AMAZING! Nice & crispy, cheesy, bacony bits with sour cream on the side to dip them in. MMMM! I also enjoy the mango berry margaritas on the rocks with sugar instead of salt. My boyfriend introduced me to the firecracker shrimp which is very yummy. Happy hour is awesome but I wish they would add Jack's strips to the endless apps menu & the firecracker shrimp to the happy hour menu!!!

Outdoor patio which is perfect for my debacherous crazy friends when we're having happy hour. I like the service - as getting drinks is really easy, except on extremely rushed times - even then the bartenders do a really good job of making sure they attend to everyone.  Typical bar food - which is fine with me, don't go expect a 5 course meal though!

I was there tonight 2-27-15...I sat in the entrance for 20 minutes, waiting for service...during that time, I watched the 'host', talk bad about the customers, give away shots to employees, and be a complete juvenile punk bitch...when I asked for management, she was quick to defend him, without even hearing my side...the red tie dude was a prick...I offer a zero star rating...especially against the dope fiend manager who obviously didn't care.
The service is extremely painstakingly slow!  We waited 10 min for our waiter, then another 15 just for our drinks.
Fast service.  Didn't wait for a table.   Why three stars? Food was cold.  We had burgers and fries. Fries were soggy and cold . Not coming back .

Damn this really sucks cause I used to love this place. I would come here often because I loved how they treated us. Now the service is pretty much the same they are nice people but the wait makes me give this review a one star. We got here around 9:16 checked in 9:19 and got a table by 9:29. Which was a small wait to be seated. Once we got in is say about 20 minutes to get our orders took. Not complaining about that but what happens next made it go down hill. A table of five we ordered two Cajun pasta one jack Daniels Ribbs and shrimp one turkey burger and last one sirloin we waited about 40 minutes or maybe I'm just being nice felt like and hour. We got our food and started eating when my nephew said his sirloin was cold  I normally say they complain to much but I tried it and it was true his food was cold. I told them and they said they will bring him one out as fast as they could.  We finished our food but his food was not out yet. We don't eat slow we are not the type of people that go eat and talk for hours just taking up space. We go eat pay and leave. We waited a bit longer till they finally brought it out. We just left its 11:00 I mean it might not sound too long but we usually get our stuff quick. They offer some desert but if I would of said yes they probably would have took another 30 mins. My review is my experience yes it might be negative but that don't mean I won't return and give it another try. Maybe next time they will be quicker.

Went out for dessert at almost 21:00... A ten-minute wait regardless. Out of Oreo Madness. The Ultimate Strawberry Shortcake had the flavored sauce but no strawberries; the pound cake was refrigerated and hard. Vanilla Bean Cheesecake was not too sweet. Service was friendly.

Everything we order here was so damn good. I had a rib eye steak cooked medium with grilled shrimp, mashed potatoes and some fresh vegetables. Even though I could not finish all of my meal,  it was delish. I also had some wings and a wedge salad with blue cheese dressing, loved it!!  Plus the service was great!!

Lately their service has been pretty bad. The last 2 times I've been here, they've messed up my orders. Today, it took them over 10 minutes to come over and ask me about what I wanted to drink. They didn't have the wine I wanted (Robert Mondavi Private Selection), they screwed up my drink and the way things are going, I'm sure they will also mess up my order. This place used to be a nice place with geat service, but quality of service has significantly gone down.  At least the new booths and chairs make the place look better.

Today was my first time ever eating at TGI Fridays. And i have to say I was really disappointed. The table we were put at was filthy, the silverware wasn't clean, the bathrooms were dirty (no tp in a few of the stalls!) and the waiter was horrible... we asked him for refills and it took 15 minutes to get a refill and we saw him standing around talking to other employees but he made eye contact with my bf 3 times. I also got really sick after i left. I don't recommend this place to anyone due to their lack of customer service skills, and the cleanliness of the establishment. I wish i could put down 0 stars but i couldn't post a review with out choosing atleast 1.

Went here once with my mom and had chicken tenders and fries and she had a salad I believe. Service was slow, whatever no biggie.  Went again with my husband a few months ago and everything was awful! Both of our knives and forks were filthy, posted pictures already.  We sat in the front where severs go to get drinks and we were annoyed that the severs used that as a hangout spot to sit and gossip. There was always a crowd of severs over there. One girl was off the clock, I'm assuming, and was grabbing herself and her friends drinks. No one seemed to know how to close the door to the ice, which was right below the soda dispenser and there was a lot of crap falling into it.  We got a sampler platter as an appetizer with mozzarella cheese sticks, potato skins, and boneless buffalo things. The ABSOLUTE WORST I've ever had in my life. The cheese sticks weren't ooey gooey, the potato skins were over cooked and bland and the buffalo things were just as bad. The food was even hot.  I ordered steak and lobster tail, there was no flavor to the steak and it was grey(????). the lobster tail wasn't terrible, but not that great. My husband had a steak and mashed potatoes, same problem. Our waiter checked on us a few times and didn't bother checking to see that we needed more water. We watched him socialize the entire time while we were eating with the rest of his coworkers.  Now I see why so many of these restaurants closed.

This is a horrible place to eat. We waited 35 minutes for our food. The food was cold, tasteless and overly greasy. The staff stood around talking instead of checking on their customers.. This visit was the worst restaurant experience ever!!!

Totally recommend this place for Happy Hour if you love being ignored! - 40 minute wait for 2 iced drinks. Watered down and LUKEWARM. - Greasy, rubbery, food. With a pissed off face as the cherry on top. But I get it.  Not much to do in this area, and everyone gets thirsty eventually. But you DON'T even get what you paid for here. Invest the few extra bucks and avoid this place unless you want to start off your weekend with a bad taste in your mouth!

great service. real clean place. a good happy hour menu. you can tell the management is involved with their staff and i on top of things. the day i went the downfall was finding a table and it did take a while but after that all was well. if the one in san mateo was set up like this they would still be around and busy.

Giving it even one star is pushing it. We sat in the bar area (not the stools) and had at least 6 different staff pass us. Finally after at least 10 minutes someone comes up to us to tell us we can't sit there so we moved to the bar. Understandable, but why wait to tell us for so long? Keep in mind it's not even busy- there was plenty of bar space available. We waited more than 5 minutes AND STILL NO SERVICE! Don't even waste your time at this location. We took our business elsewhere and suggest you do the same.

We thought we'd try Friday's since we hadn't been to one in years.  Now i know why....this place sucks. Extremely slow service. ..waited 40 minutes for our order. During the wait our waiter never came to check on us or update us on our status. Only after asking another waiter what's up did he come over and say it would be another 5 minutes. He looked like he had been eating while we were here hungry because his teeth were filled with food. And the restaurant wasn't even very busy.  After 20 years in the business myself i can be patient if they are busy but the weren't.  When  we finally got our food it was hot but nothing special.  Silly me for attempting to eat here. Don't recommend this plac e unless you want a loud place with slow service and okay happy hour  prices.

Food was ok....services was terrible! It took our waitress 15 minutes to bring a child's drink! Utensils were not given to us until we asked for them and again it them 10-15 to bring them. We are really disappointed the place was not busy at all,  and we were there for like 2 hours!

If your vegetarian, there is limited selection.  There's hardly any vegetarian entrees. Only a couple of items from the appetizers can be made vegetarian. I've tried the spinach dip, loaded potato skins  (comes with bacon on it and I had to remove it myself) . Both are decent.  TGI Fridays- its time you get your act together and come to the 21st century by putting vegetarian offerings on your menu! On a positive note, TGIF is a cool spot to meet up with friends. I do like the atmosphere but unfortunately, the atmosphere I cannot eat. I won't be back anytime soon.
I love this place because it reminds me of my favorite song, Rebecca Black's "Friday"

I'd say the rating here is a pretty accurate representation of the place, went here for happy hour and it was packed. However there were a good number of tables that were unoccupied but had not been cleaned. After claiming a table I had to go find a waitress to clean the table and she clearly saw me waiting to talk to her after she was done talking to a table and purposely walked the opposite direction, I had to chase her ass down to ask her to clean the table. So there's how i feel about their service, sub-par to say the least. The happy hour prices are pretty good though and the foods pretty decent, I wouldn't go here for their regular menu. My best advice for you is to call ahead of time, find out when the happy hour is and go (happy hour is bar area only) and don't be afraid to fight for your table! Appetizers are half off during happy hour too!

Tryed this place on a Saturday night so I guess they were busy. It took 20 minutes to get our drinks, then our appetizer arrived and it took another 10 minutes to get utincels. To make matters worst our food got to us after 50 minutes. It's was only 3 of us dinning. Service was terrible, waitress just making excuses for everything. Even said mayo and mustard did not come with the burger and it was extra ans waited another 10 minutes for that. Will never come here again.!!!! Awful
Nachos grande great.

Place is okay. Always clean. Food quality was better at one time. Now it is of cheap quality. Example the "Jack Daniels burger". Burger size has shrunk and is not as tasty. My favorite waiter is Angel. He already knows who we are and knows what beverages we like. Worst waitress (without mentioning any names) is L. One time I paid with a gift card and went 15 cents over. She had the nerve to ask for the .15 cents. A good waitress would of taken care of it and since we were regular customers. I was expecting that she would of taken care of it. Anyway the laugh is on L. Every time I go there I always request Angel.

This place needs intervention by Chef Ramsey. Or probably divine intervention by Jesus. I'm really sad that my experience there wasn't an episode of Kitchen Nightmares, because God knows I felt like that's what I was experiencing.  Biggest rule for anyone eating anything: IF YOUR BODY WANTS IT OUT IMMEDIATELY, THERE IS SOMETHING WRONG WITH IT. First you meet the horribly unprofessional and ill-mannered hosts/hostesses. That is, after you go seek them out to put you on a list, where the hell are they anyway?! They don't greet anyone! Wtf! Most of the time they were arguing with other hosts and servers. ARGUING LOUDLY. And there's no way to distinguish who is waiting, who has their name on a list, or anything because you're supposed to wait for your seat in the tiny doorway, so people are coming in asking us, "How do we get on the list?" Dear god. Then, as they are calling names, half of the people on there have already left anyway. But instead of going down the list, they cross the name off and walk away. Wtf? Empty tables, 15 people waiting. So we finally get seated and meet the only nice person there, our waitress. But then the food comes (not quickly). Oh noooooo... First, you have to pay for bread, which is the first indication of a horrible restaurant. The "garlic parmesan breadsticks" have NO seasoning, let alone cheese on them. I got better breadsticks at the pizza place outside of my high school. Then, my lemonade comes and it is MINUTE MAID. Ewww!! My date and I both ordered burgers. These weren't just ordinary burgers. THIS WAS BURGER SOUP! WOW. The bottom of the bun on both of our burgers were COMPLETELY soaked through, sopping pieces of bun that ripped as soon as we picked it up for the first bite.  Now, I'm not one of those people who is afraid of any kind of food, or afraid of certain textures or anything. And I DON'T have a queasy stomach. I eat Mexican and Indian food with no problem. So believe me when I say this food was DISGUSTING. ABSOLUTELY DISGUSTING. I tried to eat it, I really did especially because they charge $12 for a damn burger. But less than halfway through, I had to go to the bathroom because my stomach wanted it out out out! Looking in the toilet I found that my shit looked just like the sopping mess that was on my plate. Lol. So instead of going back to my table, I had to get straight out the door of this terrible place. Even Denny's has burgers that are better and cheaper and more liable to stay intact than this shit was. I would rather eat Burger King than a burger from here.

Wow! The teenagers that run this joint really don't give a rats ass!! Our server looked like she hated her job. We were in a great mood when we sat down. Ready to spend some money and drink some silly drinks. Sadly we didn't get to order any because she never came by to get our drink order. When we went to the bar instead, we got told that they don't like to serve people who have tables. Really? You just lost $35 bucks +tips. Look, I am not the one to leave bad reviews but COME ON! People come here to spend money, eat food and drink silly cocktails so treat them with some respect. Don't ruin people's experience. I am sorry I came here tonight. Do yourself a favor: if you hate your job so much then Quit or try harder to be better at it. I wish I can give no starts.

The food is usually pretty good but the service sometimes leaves something to be desired. I encountered a hostess and a waiter to determine which my friend had asked for a bag for our leftovers 5 minutes prior. Both acted irritated to answer my simple question. I wasn't really offended until they both proceeded with other duties, neither offering me a bag. After a minute I just left. That put a bad taste in my mouth about T.G.I.F. Never ignore a customer. Never.

This experience was awful. The waitress ignored us on many occasions while the guests beside us got all the attention.  It took 20 mins between unlimited appetizers and then the waitress didn't want to put in the next series of appetizers. We asked for more napkins but never got them. We ordered kids pasta but got pizza instead. It took 30 mins to get a kids meal. Maybe short staffed. But clearly not a place i would come back to. Finally we got our paper towels out of the bathroom. Would love to hear from the owner regarding this place.

It's been years since I ate at TGIF.  I used to like it when it first opened... Maybe it's just this one site now, but my lunch experience was very bland. Lite lunch. I just had the French Onion soup. The broth was like a weak tea with no flavor. Not many onions, and flavorless white cheese made it perfectly forgettable. I almost  sent it back. But my companion had the Caesar Salad which consisted of a small amount of Romaine with some grated (not fresh) cheese and no dressing. The waitress brought a side of bottled Italian dressing when asked and was apologetic that it wasn't pre-dressed.  For the price? and the soup? I would have done better at the IHOP next door.  Next time I will.  It's stale and old. Originally they had some fun things on the menu. Now it felt like a low-end Denny's.

The servers seem to dislike their jobs ( in my opinion). It was lunchtime and not very crowded and the food still took forever to come out. Forget about someone checking up on you, I had to hunt down an employee so I could pay my bill and leave.

Went to this location for lunch and the hostess was visibly yawning and looked like she didn't want to be there. Was with my wife and 2 kids, so a booth is pretty much mandatory for us whenever possible. She brought us to a table with chairs, so we asked if we could get a booth. She quickly responded that she has no booths and walked away. That's it. No "sorry, we don't but if you don't mind waiting we can get one for you" or something along those lines. We looked at each other and decided to go eat at Chili's instead.  The one star was for the hostess, not the food. Not sure if we'll be back anytime soon since that left a bad taste in our mouths...

If i could give it zero stars i would. Very unprofessional waiters, i was their on Thursday 2-18-16 had worse service ever. Waitress serves us our food i ask for additional JD sauce , she walk away with the appetizer plate and stands 2 tables behind us and starts talking to the customer which looked like they were TGIF employees dinning their. She stays their for about 10-15 min arguing with them about her sexuality couldn't decide if she was bisexual or just plain Lesbian. Then they start talking about spit and saliva, im sorry but this is not the conversation i want to listen to while im having dinner and its not like i can ignore it because they were talking really loud. She comes back when im half way threw my dinner with the sauce and return to conversation about going to buffalo wild wing and getting drunk. Worse experience ever very unprofessional waiters several of them would stop by that table and take a drink or have chats with the two guys on the table. Last time i set foot in that location... and i thought San Mateo had bad service. smh

I don't know what else to say but absolutely slow service on a very busy Sunday noon. They need more servers period and it didn't help that our server had no sense of urgency (I think he's new). I also had the pleasure of seeing a couple walk in and walk out within 10 min cause no one greeted them. There were 3 servers in the bar and each had about 6 tables (poor servers). How would they make good tips when their service sucked (unless they're playing the numbers game lol). Even saw buss boys serve drinks lol. Where is the manager? Shouldn't he be walking around greeting tables? We did see him on our way out running food, how convenient. This lunch experience just was unacceptable probably won't come back here for lunch.
If I could give negative stars I would, 30 minutes waiting and the waiter never came to take our order!!! Very very disappointed

Where do  begin ???  Poor service , waitress walked by at least 4 times before we were acknowledged. Then when our food arrived the waitress handed me my HOT plate without warning.  Her reply " im use to it as I did'nt notice cuz I just handled drinks" WTF , I dont work here and I'm not use to hadling hot plate. Thanks for the warning. It will be reflected in your tip.  The food  was just as bad as the service, dry tasteles chicken. Maybe it was overcooked beacuse it came from " Foster Farms"  I wont be coming back any time soon.

Excellent customer service! Great specials going on. Try their unlimited appetizers, $10 for unlimited of one choice or $12 for multiple unlimited appetizers. Great deal. Awesome staff. I read previous reviews I have always had an awesome experience here. Come on Down and give TGIFRIDAYS a chance, Great staff!!!!!

This review is about Edgar for his unwelcoming and poor service.  I arrived at this location for a quick late night meal. It was 2 hours before closing on a weekday, it was not busy at all. The place itself was clean and the environment was welcoming.  My friend and I were immediately seated and given menus by Edgar. He returned shortly with our orders of water and while we were still obviously looking at our menus, rushed us by asking what we wanted. After politely explaining to him that more time was needed, he left us alone for a full 15 minutes (yes I timed this) and by the time he returned I was starving. Again, keep in mind that this was not a busy night. I ordered my sirloin medium and was returned with a well-done tough piece of meat that had obviously been sitting out. The reasons I have for this is that 1) the jack Daniels burger my friend ordered was beyond soggy, room temperature, and falling apart when he received his and 2) my sirloin was room temperature and felt like it had just been warmed up. The lack of quick execution of our meal was no big deal to me at first because hey, everyone has a bad day right? Again, Edgar proved his incompetence by leaving us alone for the rest of the night, walking past our table several times and being unaware that we were ready for our check. After we finally received the bill did I see any pleasantries from this gentleman, which made me feel as if he were happy we were finally leaving or happy that he was about to receive his tip.  It takes a lot to bother me and I still provided  Edgar with a tip that I soon realized should not have been given to him at all. Edgar with his hand inappropriately groping his girlfriends ass while watching the basketball game.
