This place is sucks no service at all and food is pathetic pls guys go some where else

This was my first time at TGIF and the food was decent... Appetizers were MUCH better than the burgers but decent nonetheless. (MAKE SURE YOU TRY THE TUSCAN SPINACH DIP!) Our waiter was very friendly and food came out fairly quickly considering it being dinner time and such.  Thanks Devin for being awesome!  Took off a star because of the table next to me.. Ugh! Super annoying!! Came in towards the end of our meal but that didn't matter - they were drunk in minutes and hitting on the other waitresses. Glad I didn't have her because she probably wouldn't have visited our table since all her time was with them!

Waited almost a half an hour for an waiter, Received my drink with a dead fruit fly, and most importantly, waited almost a hour my check .... Not going there again Jack Daniel burger was good, too bad it had poor service to come with it..

Went to TGIF for my birthday on a Friday night. The waitor/server was very friendly. The staff was also friendly too. The food was good. But the prices are a little to expensive. They sing very loud & joyfull when they sing you happy birthday!

Came on a Friday to meet up with friends and celebrate. We went directly into the bar area and into a booth that was empty. Bar area = open seating .. right? WRONG. So tell me why we were seated for a good 15-20 minutes, servers and busboys passing by our booth taking glances, yet no one ever acknowledged us. Then finally a server asks if we've been helped and when we replied no, she says, ''Oh ok, I'll be back'' (she was on her way into the kitchen after clearing a table) So we think alright, cool. WRONG. Insert Mr. Douchebag stage left: "Hey guys these booths are actually not part of the bar/open seating today so I'm gonna have to ask you guys to wait on the list to get a table." (Note he didn't apologize) Apparently the booths INSIDE the bar area are NOT part of Happy Hour and/or Open Seating when they are 'busy' And don't even try to argue with him because he'll just talk over you like a real douchebag would. The manager of this place really should look into whether or not these kids they're hiring for a customer service oriented position knows ANYTHING about customer service. The apathy we witnessed was really pitiful.

Food is pretty good. My bf loves string beans and the string beans fries (appetizer) were good, his fav! He also got a bacon burger. It was delicious he said. I didn't get anything because I wasn't hungry. Our waitress was nice. She made our visit enjoyable. Bf made me tip her $6 for his $18 lunch! I guess she deserves it :)
Went for Happy Hour. Ultimate margaritas 1/2 off. Appetizers 1/2 off.  my appetizer was potato skins... it wasn't flavorful like the ones I've had in the past.

Went there last night the people who ordered less expensive food was absolutely unsatisfactory, took over 45 minutes to get our food. the waitress told me and I ordered it wrong, when I am clear and specific about everything I want. I had to go get her to be able to get the things we needed, which I don't mind either. I'm a polite person and I will eat just about anything but I didn't eat this.

I had the worst waitress everrrr. So bad and slow I had to order my food to go. I hope it was just my waitress. Totally oblivious and unhelpful. Despite her walking by doing idk what, it took 25 min to just get water! I had no idea about endless apps (cuz I've never been) and when I was asking about apps she never mentioned it until after I ordered a platter she says, oh did u want to see that menu? Really? After that we ordered our dinner to go. I was there for an hour and a half. I'm not a complainer or I would have played the manager card. Hire better staff.  Enjoyed the food at home tho.

This review is only for their endless appetizers deal. It's the only reason to visit TGI Friday's other than for their booze because otherwise you'd spend too much for mediocre food that you can just get in the frozen food section of any grocery store. Endless choice apps for 12 bucks a person. They really are endless, and the servers don't judge you, and they make sure to keep the apps coming quickly. It's very nice for a fattie like me. I mean, foodie. Yeah, foodie. The downside is that not all of their appetizers are available on the endless apps menu, it seems like the best appetizers are left out (pretzel sticks, sliders, bone-in wings).  Good apps: Any of the boneless wings, mozzarella sticks, potato skins. Bad apps: Chicken tostada (really terrible) and potstickers (overly salted mystery meat).

We did it to ourselves, really. But who am I to argue when the phrases "unlimited appetizers" and "gift card" are combined? That's how Boyfriend, myself, and a mutual friend of ours ended up here on a Monday night for dinner. We ordered the baked potato skins unlimited appetizer and then, sadly, each of us also ordered an entree as well. The potato skins were over-fried to the point that they were beyond crispy -- they were essentially burnt. We only got 2 plates (though we could've had unlimited plates) of them because they were so hard to eat. Our friend's Jack Daniel's burger wasn't cooked enough to her taste (she asked for medium-well, I believe) so she only ate about half of it. My parmesan-crusted chicken was stiff and dry. The mac and cheese was okay, so I ate that, but I was pretty weirded out by the "fresh tomato and mozzarella salad." I didn't think it would literally be little cherry tomatos and globs of mozzarella cheese (looked like they had used the cold insides of their mozzarella sticks). I think Boyfriend ordered the Jack Daniel's chicken sandwich and he was disappointed by the lack of chicken in the sandwich (there was so much more bread than there was meat). I used to come here for late-night drinks and appetizers to share with groups when I was younger (see: freshly 21) and they seemed alright then. Maybe I've just grown up and my tastes have changed. We had the gift card, so we had to use it. But I don't think I'll be back unless it's on someone else's dime (and even then I'd probably think about it pretty hard first).

I met up with an old friend here last night an it was my first time at TGI Friday's. The service was prompt and efficient--our waitress was so nice and made sure our drinks were always filled. We ended up ordering two appetizers and one entree and a dessert and splitting all of that; needless to say, we were stuffed by the time we stumbled out of the restaurant. It's your typical American chain restaurant--dark, loud, noisy, and mediocre food but something about this place charms me. You HAVE to try their potato skins. So good!

My friends wanted to run in for a quick bite and beverage...so I am like, "ok."  We get to Friday's and it is so crowded, like always, but we show ID and make our way through.  Found a spot at the bar, ordered drinks, food and got ready to watch SNF. I do not really eat the food here, but I do like the people who work here.  The atmosphere is friendly, busy, loud and welcoming.   I have played dominoes here with my friends Tony and Juan many nights at the bar, and the people who work here have always treated us well. Stephani Smiles for TGIF ;)
Came to eat on a Monday night. They had no lobster, no French fries, and no mashed potatoes. I thought this was a restaurant? Waiter had an attitude. Won't be coming back to this location again.

we went during the summer and did the $10 all y9u eat appetizers. I am still in shock on how downhill the food went. UI used to LOVE TGI Fridays. That food tasted like the store bought freezer food. it was horrible. We didn't even do any refills. Very disappointed.

My husband stopped here for dinner after an A's game on a Saturday. We arrived about 6:15pm. When we walked in the resturant was appropriately busy for a Saturday evening at that time, about a 30 min wait. We proceeded to seat ourselves on the bar area which had 2-3 open tables that were dirty, but available.  Within moments of sitting a busser came over to our table. Apologized for the dirty table and promptly wiped it down and got us silverware. Unfortunately it took another 15 mins to get acknowledged by a server. Another few more mins for OUR server to come to our table (no apology for the wait) to give us menus and take a drink order. The food seemed to take a long time coming out. Our server was very slow to round back around for refills.  The food was good, one of the very few highlights of our visit. Lastly, the music was very, almost ridiculously loud for a resturant!

Okay soooo my experience was great. Perfect server he was on top of everything! He was refilling our drinks, constantly asking us how The food was... It was great. Half off appetizers, come on people don't expect this place to be super fancy it's TGIF, expect what you know to expect then rate from that... The appetizers were cooked amazingly surprisingly!!! It was a great night to go. Happy hour of course. I wouldn't come another time. For 6 drinks (non happy hour) and 6 apps happy hour it came out to 100$ for 3 people. Not bad.
Food was okay for the amount you spend , but there will be long waiting period .. better you not be too hungry before getting into this place
The food was cold and took about 20 minutes to get my beer. Waiting area very small inside and outside uncovered so don't go when its cold or raining on a weekend.

Worst Experience ever!!!! Got there at about 4pm on Saturday evening. My friend and I walk in and see about 15 ppl standing around and three workers no one is taking names, I ask the people in front if the checked in they say no. Then two more workers come up and ask if anyones been checked in we all say no the hostess says ok then walks away. Then a guy walks up and is seated right away WTF. Finally get sat 35 min later our server was nice enough, but the food was mediocre we ordered two pineapple sunrises which were horrible. They cost 10.00 each and we could not even drink them. First off If i knew they were  10.00 each I wouldn't have ordered them. Just a bad experience all around

We came to have dinner to this restaurant on a busy New Year's Eve night. Since regular table was going to take awhile , we decided to sit in the bar area. We sat patiently for 25 minutes and not once did we had any waitress/ waiter acknowledge us or even giving us the menu. After another few minutes of waiting did my husband finally got up to the bar tender to ask him if anyone was going to attend to us. Five minutes later bar tender comes to us and attempted to get our order . That's when we had to tell him..we haven't even receive menu. Now by that time we were regretting coming to the restaurant. Sitting there watching more people arriving and NO waiter/ waitress to be seen was a RED FLAG. If it was a well managed place manager would have the right planning to put better staffing on a very busy evening. It's called MANAGEMENT 101 !! This place needs immediate management training. When a waiter finally came to our table to take our order, he looked like it was his first day on the job. After another 30 minutes more of waiting our food finally came, without utensils available. My husband had to track down the waiter to give us utensils. Food came which really just made us so regretful of why we drove to this place.  The food we ordered was to have vegetables that looked and tasted like a child was told to take it out of the bag and throw it on the plate . Absolute NO taste and flavor. What a horrible experienced !!!

I would give them a 0 star but that doesn't exist. First they got my order wrong and then it took the waiter to another 20 min to figure out that he never put in the the correct order. I placed my order around 7:26 and dint get my correct order till 8:16. I was keeping tabs. I will never eat there again.  Waisted my time. Please don't go.

I WOULD GIVE THIS PLACE NO STARS!! Hostess was no where in site when we arrived. My daughter had to ask a waiter if we should seat ourselves. Finally a girl came and never apologized. The waiter was worse, he didn't care how long we waited. Oh and we were the only guests at the door. So it's not like we went during a busy time. This staff is awful. We will never spend money at TGIF.

Sigh I understand it's late, but there shouldn't be a reason we should have to  1) wait 20 minutes for water 2) practically be unassisted the whole time we were here 3) have to wait days for a refill on apps especially when it's not busy. I'm only upset cause I work in a restaurant that's much more understaffed and hectic. I'd get my ass CHEWED for not dropping off water within 2 minutes. I'd be in even more shit if I didn't pay attention to my guests and didn't give them refills especially when they're hella obviously looking at everyone for refills.  Wow soooo originally I was going for 2 stars but now I'm gonna go with NO STARS. Sorry Edgar. It's not cool to be rude to guests and not listen to what we have to say. I understand it's late but dude. Trust me. It's still not acceptable. I never really make these typa posts but hey. Upset guests gotta say something for the world to know. Also Edgar. Please tell us that the sliders aren't unlimited. I mean cmon we did walk in and asked the first time around. So please TGIF. Listen to us. Lol  NO STARS.
Happy hour 3-7
#friday's is a can't lose place for great Food, & a great time, any night of the week, but especially on Friday's....

I came here a while back and order the Shrimp Cocktail.  Was expecting 12 shrimp, but got 11 instead.  I told the waitress there was 1 missing and then replied, "Oh, that's because you already ate one".  WTF man!!!

I used to frequent this Friday's A LOT as a high schooler. Coming back, the memories of looking forward to those sweet sweet margaritas are long gone. I used to eat some of their items with pleasure as at that time maybe Friday's paid their workers better. After my experience today, it's safe to assume their quality has plummeted.  Came in here right after a movie for lunch, and boy, I thought working fast food was crap but to express it on your face is worse. Walked in to two workers, maybe hosts (?) and I felt bad for how empty her face was. It was a Sunday morning, so I guess the church rush ended but to have no life in your eyes when you greet customers? Damn. Must really hate working here.  Anyway, me and the boyfriend were seated promptly and greeted enthusiastically by Tatiana. She was sweet. Placed our drink orders and waited no more than 10 mins. Mind you, it was dead. We got the drinks and I ordered a frozen strawberry margarita. I tasted ice slush and strawberry flavorings.  Yeesh. I'm not one to complain; I grin and bear it. But either way, wow. That's bad. Boyfriend got a beer, can't review because, come on, how do you ruin what's on tap? I had the 6 oz. Sirloin, medium, cut it open and grimaced. It was like I cooked it. Clearly the chef didn't watch enough Food Network or even read his menu because medium has a pink center. I saw none of the sort. I thought it was the lighting so I took a bite. Nope, tasted well done. So much for flavor.  I had the side of cheddar mac and cheese with mashed potatoes. How could you ruin either? Taters were fine, but the mac and cheese was dry. I felt like I was eating a lunchables equivalent. Blegh.  Tatiana was attentive and with her customer service she deserves better than to represent a failing franchise. Don't go here.

Both of the time that I was here, I've always left satisfied. The food itself is great, first time i got the afredo, forgot what its called but it was the one with "fav" next to it. It was okay, nothing really special about it. Second time I got the rib eye with a side of sautéed shrimp with fries and mash potato. It was great but mainly because of the fries. I don't know why but I'm just in love with their fries. It's so tasty and different. My boyfriend thought it was okay but i'm fuckin in love with it. Service was alright, could be better. Barely check up on us and it was quite slow. The Long Island tasted different, don't really like it but every bartender has a different way of making it so I'm sure someone else will probably like it. Other than that this place is not bad and I'm sure i will come back, mainly for the fries.

Man, TGIFridays are becoming a dying breed, good thing they have a store near a guy I am dating in Union City. Anyway I remember why I fell in love with them all those years ago plus I've fallen in love with a new item too. The following summarizes my latest adventure here: PLUSES: Great vibe Cool new decor (dark woods and adult fixtures) Delicious food (Sizzling chicken and cheese, ALWAYS a favorite) Friendly staff My date likes so much he keeps talking about it MINUSES: Ummmmmmm Uhhhhhhhhhhh Hmmmmmmm ORGASMIC: Whiskey Cake (the word favorite is so understated!) See you next week perhaps?

Just, No. Our server was clearly new to serving altogether or just high on something psychedelic because he was absolutely horrible and ruined every part of this experience with any potential to be at least somewhat enjoyable! Got rib eye and lobster tail with side of jasmine rice and broccoli and received rib eye lobster and fries -.- other friend ordered jack Daniels steak and received steak and shrimp, he forgot to take it off, other friend had shrimp but was missing mashed potatoes, other friend returned her drink and barely touched her food because it just wasn't good or prepared well. We waited just as long for our drinks as food. Our server blamed the bar, the expo line, didn't write anything down, apologized 25 too many times, forgot to bring me my debit card back so I couldn't sign out and leave foorrrevvvvaaaa....Need I keep typing? Artemo was the guy. I sincerely hope he improves at being a fast paced and more quick witted server immediately. TGInFriday's food just honestly isn't even good enough quality to carry the weight of bad service. You get what you pay for.
Great Service ! Me and my date went in a hour before closing it was still packed but our server " Maurice " was great ! He made me and my date feel like VIP @ TGI Friday's # T & F

Literally just left this place without being served. Waited like 10 minutes to be seated in an empty restaurant. Sat down and waited 20 min and still no one came to service us. A couple came and sat a few tables down from us and got served right away. Right then and there we got up and left. Told the host that spent the 10 min setting up our table that we hadn't been served. We're a group of 6. more money to made with us but they lost us for horrible service or lack there of.  If you don't wanna serve close up shop!

Poor service, poor food quality and quantity. Ordered a pasta meal and was shocked at the amount I got for the price I paid. Server never came around to refill glasses or check on our party. I had to finally waive her over. Also took a very long time for our food to come out and it was not busy. Won't be coming back here ever.

The bartenders are so nice, but when I order a sizzling platter and it is borderline warm, no pop no steamy smell.. Cmon guys. That's why you order that entree, for the sizzle. I took it home and threw it in the microwave. Total buzz kill.

We were on our way to City Bistro and drove by TGIF and saw the BIG $10.99 Wednesday Full Rack of Ribs special so we decide to pull in.  It's been years possibly even a decade had passed since I stepped inside a Fridays. When I was still in school, I used to think the food here was bomb (most likely influenced by alcohol). The absence of alcohol, my family in front of me and years of developing a more sophisticated palette has led me to the conclusion that this place is no Bueno. (at least when it comes to the entrees).  I hope this Friday's nothing but the best. Every time I check the news you hear about a Friday's closing down. With very limited choices of places to enjoy a cocktail or some brews and take in a game in Union City, this place is sure to stay open for a while.

This place sucks ass!!! How is it even still open?? Waiters seem to be hiding from you whenever you need them. No one is walking around helping. Not sure if it's because we sat at the bar area, but the waiters don't come back to you until 50 minutes later. The people who bring out the items send the food to wrong tables... I put 1 star because I am being generous.

Worst Ever! First and last time ever there. Ordered Nachos and for all plates to come out at same time and they forgot about my dish, asked for water a refill on coke and ranch also never got those, sad thing is they weren't busy. So they just ruined my Saturday lunch with the family. I usually never yelp but this pissed me off , this would have been NO STARS but had to at least put 1 to post

Stopped by TGIFs last night. The folks at the bar took great care of me, especially Desiree! I definitely appreciate it since it was getting so busy with the Warriors game and she was ending her shift. Thanks and l will definitely be back!

horrible. We went there for late happy hour and arrived to an empty restaurant...awesome! We were greeted by an extremely unenthusiastic hostess who told us we couldnt sit at any of the empty booths in the bar, only the high top tables that hurt your back or the bar......okay... we chose to just skip happy hour and sit in the main dining area and that's where our problems began... We were given another server, who seemed to be in a bad mood....but I gave her the benefit of the doubt and was very polite when I placed my order....I ordered the stacked philly burger which features roast beef, peppers, and pickled vegetables on top of the burger.... we then went on about our business for the next 15 minutes waiting for our food to arrive.......  My girlfriend's food was fine, everything was cooked perfectly....but when i got my burger, I noticed it had bleu cheese, mushrooms, and onions and none of the toppings from the stacked philly...... they had given me the bleu cheese burger instead....  I was totally cool about it and just politely sent it back, when the manager came out to make sure everything was okay with me... I explained the situation, and  she offered me a salad while my new burger came out....i took the salad since my girlfriend's food was ready, so she wouldnt have to eat alone.... When they brought my burger back......to my shock....IT WAS THE SAME EXACT BURGER! Bleu cheese, mushrooms and all!! I immediately got the manager again, and she bends down next to me like I'm some kind of child, and explains that this was the burger I ordered, and often times customers wrongly send it back, but she was positive that this was how it came on the menu..... I had to have this manager bring me the menu, Break it down for her ingredient by ingredient including having to explain to her what giardiniera was (essentially explaining the ingredients to her own menu to her) I had to point out that there were green peppers on the philly, and mushrooms and bleu cheese in the other, and waste my breath arguing with the manager that I must have been wrong!! The manager then flipped her switch and started profusely apologizing and offered to remake my food herself (I'm sure so she could spit in it). I politely chose to leave without eating. Thanks, friday's!

Manager Mike salvaged our evening. My wife and I were having one of those days where everything went wrong. We went to dinner at TGI Fridays to cheer up. My favorite is their baby back ribs. We ordered and waited. A half hour later we were told our order had been lost, and now they were out of ribs. This could have been the fitting end to a terrible day, but manager Mike salvaged it. He stepped up, apologized, took our order, and picked up the check. Mistakes and bad days happen, but then you meet Mike.

My husband and I went to Friday's in spite of the fact that their appetizers have gone totally down hill.  We decided to forgo the 1/2 price appetizers and just have cocktails.  We ordered margaritas regular flavored.  When they arrived, there was a random piece of an orange and a dried up slice of lime thrown on top.  Who puts old limes and oranges on a lime flavored margarita?  When I took a sip, it tasted like the bartender put water and a slice of lime in the blender, poured it into a glass and put crappy fruit on top.   We decided that this was the last straw.  We politely called over one of the waiters and advised him that the margaritas tasted like ice water slushes.  We also advised him that there was no way that the bartender could fix these drinks, and that we were leaving.  He didn't seem very surprised and just as politely said okay.   Mind you, these margaritas were going to be $6:00 each at the happy hour price.  For a good margarita this would have been a bargain, for the crap that Friday's served, it would have been highway robbery, had we paid.   We left and went to Chaplains, and had $4:00 house margaritas (3:30 - 6:30 happy hour), that were a 1000% better than the mess that Friday's served us.   I don't like to leave negative reviews, but this establishment should be ashamed.  The bartender should have been too embarrassed to serve a drink of this caliber.   Hopefully enough people refuse to tolerate this type of service and they either close or improve.

This should have been 1 star.. But I gave them 2 stars because they are generally good.. Defiantly better than the kind of service I got..  I like tgif.. And I love the location of this place.. I generally come here on sat/Friday nights For food and drinks..Robbie always serve me... He is a nice guy and always does a good job.. But this time he wasn't there. I couldn't catch the names of the bartenders..one of them was  a very attractive girl and the other was a guy with a ghotti..But they were busy having their own conversation.. With a bunch of other employees.. The side that I sat by.. Was still dirty from the previous customers.. The lady eventually got to me after awhile.. Then she was gone.. After awhile she came back..I wasn't the only one in need of service... the people next to me were looking for someone to serve them too.. But the bartenders and the employees continued their conversation..  At the end they actually costed themselves the tip..I realized that I shouldn't be there on nights when Robbie is not there..

Ordered steak with spare ribs.   Ordered medium on the steak. I was given a steak which was 1/3 rare, 1/3 medium rare, and 1/3 medium. I wish I just went to Black Amgus.  Just wasted my $30. The meat tasted old.

I mean maybe today was just a good day lol but Greg gave us the BEST SERVICE we have ever received in a restaurant (too dramatic? lol really tho). We basically didn't have to ask for anything because he took care of everything! It's like he was reading my mind or maybe I was just lit LOL he was great. Thanks for making a good day better! =)

I remember coming to Union Landing a lot during high school, and even now, it's the to-go place for my friends back home in Hayward. It was close enough to my high school and now it's where all the food is. There's not really places to hang out in Hayward, and here, we get a movie theatre and several food options.  Choosing TGIF was kind of a spontaneous decision amongst my group of 10 and we came in at around 4. The wait was around 5 mins even though there was literally no one there... we were seated and served pretty well, until we ordered. Food took forever to arrive, around 30 minutes despite not being rush hour. I was a bit disappointed honestly. I expected food to be of somewhat decent quality, but their brocolli on my dragonfire shrimp wasn't fresh. Rice was of questionable quality too. My friend ordered the firecracker shrimp and her cole slaw just looked like someone pulled it from the bottom of the fridge. Needless to say, I probably won't be coming back due to severe quality issues. The food was a bit pricy for the poor quality as well.

For once,  my server wasn't slow. However,  she brought me the wrong drink then took forever to bring the correct one. It came after my food was brought out. Also, order just ice cream for my niece and that also came after our food. When we sat,  table was dirty with crumbs and under the table was hella smooshed food. The music was so dang loud...it's a family restaurant not a night club!!! And the bathroom...stall had no toilet paper and the garbage was over flowing with paper towels. This location is always busy so going out of business is probably not a concern but come on, get some better service and keep ur restaurant clean.

WARNING!!!!  DO NOT LEAVE ANYTHING ON THE SEATS OR FLOOR OF YOUR CAR.  I was there last night for a quick dinner, car was parked IN FRONT of the floor to ceiling window first set of stalls.  My window was broken and belongings stolen.  TGI could care less, I spoke with manager, they don't have outside cameras, just inside cameras.  Union Landing is getting to be a scary place so be safe.  The food...it was ok, salmon overcooked, service was slow.  I will find a better and safer place to eat.  I say this because this is a nightly occurrence in Union Landing.

Spending an evening with my friend Becca, we were in the mood for munchies 'n movies. We decided on a flick at @ Union City and had about 45 minutes to spare before the movie. Plenty of choices within the parking lot, we didn't feel the time crunch would be an issue. Even if we missed previews....an hour to spare? not bad at all.  This was during the week, not a weekend but still. It was 9ish pm & we first attempted to eat at pasta pomodoro, closed. Sushi place, closed. Fuddruckers, closed. TGI Fridays.... seated immediately.  That's when service took a nose dive. Did not even get greeted by any servers beyond the door person seating us for a good 10 minutes. Next, the server takes our drink orders (easy enough) 2 shirley temples. Ten more min. later he comes back with "Here's your two waters!" My reply- Ugh. Shirley Temples?  Oh yeah (haha, sorry) be right back. The overall order consisted of salad for me with a side of blue cheese crumbles. And an appetizer of pot stickers. In my opinion, easy enough to prepare and bring out. All of this took up nearly an hours worth. Even after bringing the food, the server forgot one LAST item. The silverware, no joke. I was so impatient I had practically eaten most of my salad finger-style before proper utensils arrived.  Very poor service. Not worth the efforts of being open later. We could've found more decent food options at the movie theatre itself.  I rate this chain restaurant with 3 stars because the food/drinks were good despite poor service with a lack of focus and unmotivated staff.

This was the second time we have visited this restaurant and I have to say it's not up to the standard I am accustomed to from a Friday's. When we walked in the hostess tried to push us into the bar for happy hour. When we refused, she rolled her eyes and seat3d us right next to a large group with a child's birthday party with a lot of empty tables other places in the place. Then it took our server over 15 minutes to acknowledge us and get our drink order. We received our drinks and then our soups. Still no silverware or napkins. Had to flag our server down to get utensils. No refills on drinks. Food was decent. Not sure if I'm willing to return here. We will see.

I like this Union City Location because the management take pride and operate it like a local business.  The staff is friendly and I like the happy hour times, because it gives you a decent price for happy hour food and drinks, not some sucker punch where the drinks are cheaper but the foods not.  I was there a bit during the football playoffs and the management decided to extend happy hours to all the 49er playoff games. I sure hope they continue to "bend" the happy hour times to tweak the crowd. I like the fact they have a lot of TVs and parking is not a major problem... I love to tall beers for $3.  Be sure to sign up for the stripes account
Just came back from here. Our server Kirsten was amazing. Had our table laughing the whole night. Great go-to place for drinks!

Wife and I wanted to enjoy a "fatty day" so we were headed to Lowes and saw this place and we both thought that this chain had closed down since we hadn't seen on in years. We were greeted immediately and sat down. Our server, I forgot his name (we were there on Sunday the 3rd of August around 11:45) was quick to offer advice, get drinks and other "server duties". We ordered a ton of items, as I said we were having a "cheat day, to last the month"! The food was fine, it wasn't great but it hit the spot in terms of what we were craving...greasy goodness!! Our server was great, he had a personality and wasn't a robot at all, which is always good to see at these big chains! I'm sure the wifey and I will be back, or at least find another reason to go to Lowes so we can stop by here.

My GF and I were staying at the Holiday Inn Express which was around the corner from this place. And so we went in here not once, but twice! We went back to TGIF by default because we pretty much were convinced this place wouldnt let us down since one of the local seafood place dropped the ball on us the day before. And when we went to TGIF both times, we sat down right away and this is during dinner time during the week.  Noticed the bar was always full tho, but Im stoned cold sober now and am on the wagon so no sauce for me tonight. LOL!  We like to share, so when we order the entree's we just split it in half and get to enjoy two different entree's in one sitting.  But first of all the appetizer : TUSCAN SPINACH DIP is pretty darned good. We ordered it both times on both visits. Its yummy.  I think we might have even ordered a double for that. So on both occasions we ordered off the Jack Daniels menu. She ordered the JACK DANIEL'S® RIBS & SHRIMP and I was hungry and ordered the JACK DANIEL'S® MIXED GRILL* Hella good on both! Very tasty. My GF is from Beijing and this menu is one of her favorites when she comes stateside. Its a treat for her so she doesnt mind doubling up on it. LOL!  And for dessert, we shared the SALTED CARAMEL CAKE, that was good. The previous night we shared VANILLA BEAN CHEESECAKE Made with real vanilla beans, layered with white chocolate mousse and baked in a graham cracker crust. Topped with white chocolate shavings.  A little too sweet but washed it down with lots of water and a cup of coffee! LOL! This is a good place. Very quick service and the food gets to you quicker than the other places in that mall. Maybe the only other one is Appleby's, which I think is a notch down from this place IMO.  no complaints from us and this is from two different visits in the same week. Will go back here for sure and will recommend to anyone in the area.

The food was good. My server was horrible though, her name is Tiffany. Like she seriously checked up on us three times while we were completely finished with our food and didn't offer us the check. Then when she gave us the check she just didn't do the whole "any desserts for you guys tonight". I got here at around 10, got seated around 10:15, then she took our orders. But then we didn't get our food until about 11. The food was already cold but I didn't complain because I just got off work and was starving. She wasn't tip worthy.

HORRIBLE HORRIBLE HORRIBLE! We had a server named Veronica. Worst server ever. We asked for JD sauce and she never brought it. Call me modern yet, I feel at a family friendly establishment the atmosphere is suppose to make you feel welcome; however to be seated at a table with the hurtful homophobic word F***ot scracthed into it was offensive and unprofessional and after we where seated some where else they seated another party to the same defaced table. My last visit at fridays was awesome! My waitress was halarious and she made us feel important. She also had this other waitress working in the bar area with her ... They were so funny together. Great service they love their jobs and they know how to have fun with it! Thank u Jalaine and tammy for a wonderful evening... They made this restaurant feel like it was our own private party!!:-)

The services sucks!!! Sat at the bar area for 1/2 hour NO ONe came up too us!!! I had to say something to a server before she can help us!!! She said oh I'm sorry no one told me I had new customers at the table!!! What the heckl it doesn't matter if we're new or old you should be coming around your area to check if we need anything!!! This place sucks!!

Food is decent and price is alright especially during happy hour. What I knocked 3 stars for was that I had to wait literally 45 long minutes AFTER being sat for the server to ask me if I would like to get started with a drink. After I ordered the food it took 45 minutes to get my food, which wouldn't have been so bad if I didn't already wait 45 minutes. I can also be more understanding if the restaurant was packed. This wasn't the case. It was nearly empty during happy hour (they have happy hour for a reason, to encourage more customers to come at late afternoon hours since it usually is slow). The problem was that they only had 1 server for possibly 8 tables or more. Shockingly understaffed. Also, this isn't the first time I've had terribly slow service. This happened at least 3 times already.

Let's be honest here, the food is really subpar. That being said, I enjoy coming here after work because it's a great place to just sit down a table with your friends, order some drinks and chat while watching whatever game is on the TV. The green bean fries and Jack Daniels wings are fantastic, and most of the waitresses are friendly and attentive.  The drinks vary in strength in that if you order two rum and cokes, it's entirely possible that one will be super rummy and the other will be mostly coke. If you're looking to get hammered, look elsewhere. That being said, I still like coming because of the appetizers and the drinks, and that's good enough. Manage your expectations -- the entrees are usually very subpar.

Normally the male Bartenders know what they're doing at this location and are tentative to the customers. For the rest, especially one Bartender  named Summer, should keep in mind that the job you're in is a Customer Service based job. If you don't want to deal with the public and want to have a chip on your shoulder and have the demeanor that you're doing the PAYING customer a favor by assisting them, well then reality check Summer! Maybe you should just apply for food stamps and worry about your fake eye contact lenses, tacky acrylic nails, take a seat and stay home! Employees like this ruin businesses! Useless waste of space!

Walked in and wasn't even properly greeted. I just stood there awkwardly while the 2 hostess girls and one hostess (hoster?) dude talked and ignored me. Like what the fuck man I'm not that short. So I had to ask the guy cause we made eye contact how long the wait was. Then one of the girls answered me and said 10-15 min so I said okay cool and then they went back to talking to each other so I had to ask him if I'm supposed to wait or stand in line (it's been like 5 years since I've been to TGIF) and he said I had to write my name down. I ordered the Brushetta Chicken off of the lunch menu and guess what????? It sucked!!  A Marie Callender frozen entree is way better and cheaper!  I just bought crap for lunch!!  ICK!
Steak and lobster: steak way over cooked. Lobster was ok. Service wasnt much better. Wouldnt go there again. If your waiting for wild wings or something just stick it out. Its worth it.
The food was mad good the air conditioning was too high but overall really good food just turn the ac down next time

I've never been a fan of American chain restaurants. Chili's, Outback, Applebees, Marie Calendars, BJ's etc..They are all the same to me.. BLAH!!! Howeverrrrrrr, I came  here for a birthday a few weeks ago and discovered their HAPPY HOUR MENU!!! Every weekday from 10- Close- Half off drinks & $5 margaritas!!!! They also have a prefix menu, where you can pick an appetizer, TWO entrees, a dessert and a margarita for only $22 dollars!!! Crazy, isn't it?  I felt like slapping myself for making any pass judgment about this place. My apologies.

LORRAINA SHOULD BE FIRED! I have never felt so unwanted and ignored by my server/bartender. We got a weak greeting, waited forever for her to pour our drinks because heaven forbid she not finish her conversation with friends first. Then had to bother someone else to get our food order in, she knew we wanted to order but never came back to us till it was time to give us the bill. She was fishing for a tip. Oh I definitely wrote her a note tip at the top of my bill.
This place is awful. The steak I ordered was cold and so was the appetizers. Never going back again.

This place sucks. Came here with a gift card and bought myself a 2 for $20 dinner including dessert with some friends. The food was okay. The only reason why i'm giving this place a low rating is because our server was a horrible waiter. Our total came out to be $33. We paid with our $25 gift card and $20 in cash.. the problem was that they gave us back 7 dollars back on the gift card. WHY would we get back a gift card with 7 dollars on it? What are we supposed to do with a $7 gift card for a restaurant with bland food??  We complained to the manager and finally got our cash back. Never coming back to this place.

We attended TGI Friday's last night for a birthday party and we got food poisoning from the cheeseburger that we ate off the same burger and we were both vomiting all day today I would never recommend going there again

was heading into Applebees but their happy hours ended at 6, did a quick Google and TGI's happy hours is until 7, I don't usually go into TGI cause it looks more expensive, but it wasn't. alcohol price is about the same, but the appetizers selection is double of chili's and applesbees. The waitresses were great, Alex and another girl working at the bar, even check up on me twice in 20 minutes. I get more cellphone signals in here, service was great, lighting is excellent, atmosphere is perfect what a bar should be. My sesame chicken did took over 15 minutes which was kinda long for an "appetizer" item, which is the only star deducted. overall very nice experience, will repeat for sure.

I only come here on Sundays because of their Special because everyone loves a deal!  My date and I each ordered the Jack Daniels glazed wings and split the Loaded Potato Wedges. Our total bill was 15.00 and we were more than full. I couldn't even finish the all the wings.

Went into celebrate my brothers birthday and we were disappointed in the food..all 4 of us all ordered the endless appetizers and were disappointed to find the food was (temperature) not hot enough potstickers...especially the spinach dip. It was warm and runny. Otherwise the service was great!

This place needs to have a chat with their staff...I ate here a few days a go with my husband and we were seated right away, but after the waiter came by to take our order things went down hill from there. We ordered the BBQ chicken pita bread something fairly simple and should be quick to make, it came out later than expected, but it was ok since sometimes food comes out a little late.  Our dinner however one being steak that was medium rare which was more like medium and very chewy and a burger that came out very dry all came way later than the appetizer! Forty minutes is way too long for what we ordered, that and never asked to refill our water, we had to wave them down.  I remind you this place was in no way busy! Next time going to go to Texas roadhouse instead...

If I could give it zero stars, I would. Worst service ever. "Bouncers" are rude and bartenders are unfriendly. I am so upset after just a 10 minute interaction with this establishment. I would not recommend this particular TGI Fridays to anyone!!!

***Happy hour review only*** All day happy hour on Sunday deserves a 5-star review alone, unfortunately the food was mediocre and their beer specials sucked. Our service was good. Alcoholic drinks were strong enough. Details of the review: Sunday All-day happy hour = Success in my book. We came during the World Cup Final and the bar was packed, nearly all the high tables were filled too. Our waiter was still attentive, friendly and funny. Great start! Sadly, the food was okay.  Crispy green bean fries - usually these are my favorites but the ones from this restaurant was over battered and didn't have the lightness that I am used to.  Nachos - Good but they held back on the chicken. It was just sprinkled on here and there. Buffalo wings - Good sauce but needs to be more crispy.  The drinks were good, strong but not disgusting. We ordered a second round. But they need a better beer selection on their happy hour menu.

This place can be hit-or-miss depending on when you go. Forget getting a table here at happy hour here on a Friday night (10pm to close). Going to happy hour on a Monday night (3 or is it 4pm? to 7pm and 10pm to close) , sure, pick a seat any seat. Sat in the bar area at the high top tables with a friend of mine for happy hour on my recent visit. TGI Friday's has a OK to decent happy hour here with half price appetizers, cheap beer, though I would have rated it a star higher if they actually included all their beers on tap with the happy hour prices (like they once used to), but instead they now only include all the mega brand, no-flavor beers (Bud, Budlight, Miller) - 16 oz beers are $2, 20 oz beers are $3.50 and all bottled beers are $3 - Ultimate Margaritas or Long Island Iced Teas are $5 if you aren't in the mood for beer Our waitress was friendly and helpful and gave us good service and was happy to split the bill for us at the end of the night. Be sure to sign up for their rewards program "Stripes" so you can earn free food and drinks if your a regular here. Speaking of being a regular here, not sure that I will become one since they made their recent decision to not include their "premium" beers in the happy hour prices. At least at the Owl (Hooters) in Fremont, all drinks including mixed drinks at the bar are half price at happy hour.

HORRIBLE! That about sums it up!  If I could give this place a negative, I would!  You must be asking why?  Well here you go.... 1. Service was "holy crap, how is this girl still employed" below standard.  I think everyone in there was right out of high school and didn't know the meaning of  "costumer service." It took forever before our little high school server (with no personality) took our order.  I believe I gave her an order for a cocktail.  Guess what?  Never came!  Was she deaf or stupid? Both? Not quite sure.  Either way, I settled for water.   2. Even though everyone else at the table seemed to like their food, mine...NOT so much.  My broccoli tasted like it was steamed in toilet water.  No joke! Being completely serious here.  It was brown not green.  Why would anyone even put something like that on a plate?  The salmon was good but that was about it.  And thanks for bringing the appetizers out without any plates or utensils.  I'll just eat this wilted salad with my fingers.  Thanks!    3.  The bathroom was disgustingly dirty!  I think someone had a paper towel fight in there.   This place sucks and yup, I won't be going back EVER!  Dang, and now that I think about it, I should have looked at Yelp before going here.  I have learned my lesson.  Anyone who rates this above a one star, you must have seriously lost your mind or have never seen food before and thought this place was the next best thing to white bread.

This Fridays has been remodeled recently, at least the bar area has been and it looks pretty good. I usually don't come here to eat lunch or dinner, me and my friends usually just hit the happy hour on weekends when we want to stay local. Can't beat half priced appetizers and cheap drinks. When it gets warmer they also serve outside in the patio area which is nice.

Came here for the first time! It was delicious! The server was very nice our food was spectacular. Was a party of 6 all our steaks were very flavorful and juicy, veggies and baked potatoes so good. We went during the week it was empty so maybe that had to do with it. I'd go again!
They have happy hour on drinks & appetizers. It's a long wait, but dining here is worth it if your w/ friends and/or family & if your in the area.

This place is my go-to place when hungry late in the night. I love the the ambiance, everyone is there to catch a game and just relax with some bar bites or have a drink with some friends. It most definitely gets packed when a huge sports game is being shown other than that its not too shabby. The happy hour menu is bar seating only and that is usually open bar so first come first serve. The bar bites on the happy hour menu are so reasonable. All the appetizers are half-off and the sliders are only $1.50. Drinks are not more than $5. (what a steal) I always get the $5 margaritas and they are huge!! The sliders, chicken tenders, nachos, and the chicken wings are a frequent for me. By the end of the night I am completely satisfied.

Personally I find TGI's are over hyped, it's just a sports bar themed restaurant, I do like to come here though simply because of their 2 for $10 menu. Granted there isn't a huge amount of choices within this option but it does include some of their staple dishes such as the spinach sirloin, bruschetta pasta, friday's shrimp, etc... Places like this either leave my wallet burning or my stomach empty so its nice to get a decent meal (appetizer and entree) for just under $13. And if you come for lunch there's rarely a wait at all. Dinner well that's another playing field, If you know you're going to be eating here and you're a group of more than for your best bets to avoid a wait that can go from 30 minutes to even an hour is to make reservations unless you guys are okay with taking over the bar and even than that's hard to do during happy hour.

Strawberry fields salad was amazing and jack daniels chicken strips are delicious.  But it seems every time I come here for drinks I am never happy. Ill stick to water from now on. Our server was cool so he made up for the crappy wrong drink.

Ate here this weekend, and it was the most disappointing meal I've ever had. We waited 40 minutes for nachos. When they arrived, they were cold, and the jalapenos were NOT on the side, like we had requested. 30 seconds later all of our food arrived. My husband got the wrong side, and his ribs were only warm. My crunchy parm crusted chicken had sat under the heat lamp and was neither crunchy nor hot. Room temp is being kind. The sauce on the side of tortellini was all glazed over, like it had been sitting for too long, and the tortellini was borderline cold. My daughter's mac and cheese was only just warm, and the broccoli was cold.  With an antsy one and two year old, who had been waiting for food for 40 minutes at this point, we opted to just eat it, but I complained. The server was apologetic, as was the manager, and he removed the nachos and ribs from the bill. That was nice of him, but still.... it was a waaaay disappointing meal. I was a waitress for many years, and I know "stuff" happens, but our server and food was was terrible. We will not be coming back.

When we first moved to Union City, I was excited to be near Fridays.  Unfortunately, this place has really gone downhill.  The service is just okay, but the food taste like they pulled it out of a can, freezer, bag, or some other sort of cheap grocery store purchase. Service - 3 stars Food - 1.5 stars

WHY DID YOU GUYS TAKE OFF CHAMPIONSHIP NEW YORK STEAK AND ANY NEW YORK STEAK CUTS!?  That was the ONLY thing I would eat here. Once those are gone, everything else is just average. This place lose track of their guests all the time. Waiting time is just crazy. They make you wait when there are many available seats. We've made a reservation for a graduation party of 20 one time and guess what? When we arrived, they said we never did. Even the phone shows we called their number but they've denied everything.
Updated: went there yesterday at midnight. According to Yelp, business closed at 12:30am. Boo to the rude old man for denying our service!

Still a good place to bring family and friends. Love the decor which can have a relaxing affect which is a good thing specailly during the mid-day.Service was great for drinks I had a rum and coke and the wife had the peach sangria. I must say the my drink was perfect youd be surprised how many bartenders there are that can't make a basic mainstay drink. This was on the money! The wife had cajun shrimp with chicken pasta, was delish! Daughter had ribs with shrimp. The ribs very very tasty,my daughter didn't offer me a shrimp. I had the ribeye steak medium with shrimp scampi. The shrimp were prawn size and flavourful, the ribeye was tasty but a tad on the chewy side.The wait staff , what can I say they were there for us!

The food is okay.  The buy 1 get 1 makes up for it (1 star up to 3). Service,like what others have stated, is not this place's forte. We got seated promptly since we got there around 5pm, still early and not quite dinner time yet. Our waitress didn't get to our table until literally after 5 minutes later (seemed much longer than that).  By that time, we were ready to order our food, she took them promptly. At this time, there were no utensils/napkins on the table... which we saw all set up on the table across from us. Drinks showed up and so did the appetizer... still no utensils/napkins. Finally our entrees were being delivered... still no utensils/napkins, my wife asked for them.  Now at this point, I thought that our waitress would make getting the utensils her first priority... no stopping at other tables, just really quick get the utensils.  Or grab the ones from the other table for us.  It could have been a really quick fix. After waiting for a short while, she decided to grab 2 sets from the table across from us.  And then the waitress showed up with 2 sets of utensils... a little too late. After that things got better.  I'm guessing she was busy?  But still, what I see here is a lack of time/customer's management. Observing the rest of the crew, I saw many of them walked pass our table without even a slight glance and maybe only 1-2 of them were smiling. I understand that each waiter/waitress has his/her own designated tables, but they all still work for the same restaurant.  A bit better team work would've made things go much smoother.  Maybe help keep an eye out for customers who are ready to order or need something... relay it to the designated waiter/waitress.  Be eyes and ears for each other, instead of everyone for him/herself. Or maybe designate a person or two to do this 'spotting' job, engage the customers. Look and smile to all restaurant's customers, even when they are not on your designated tables.  It might seem so small and simple, but it can add a lot to the overall service impressions and atmosphere. As I stated above, the service did get better toward the end, also the reason why it's a 3-star review. People will always come for great service.  Many would even tolerate the food a bit if the service is great.  Fix the service, I can see this place getting more or updates to 4 stars (at least).
Poor quality of food and poor customer service. Pricing is unreasonable for serving size. Basically paid for frozen-packaged food. I will never suggest anyone to come to this establishment.

I hadn't been here for year or so, but some things have changed. The most apparent one being, their prices seemed to have jumped from the average entree being around 12 dollars to around 18 now, and the food quality has stayed the same. I think their food is decent but if im having a 60 dollar dinner Id probably rather be at a nicer restaurant, not one that has a college bar vibe My drink (pomegranite cucumber cooler) tasted great but must have been pretty weak. I felt nothing from this drink and normally one drink is all I need for a nice buzz.  Speaking of the bar, our server really meant well when she apologized on the wait for our drinks and I appreciate her stopping by to apologize.  But next time you could leave it at: Sorry for the wait on those drinks. Not "Sorry for the wait on those drinks, one of our bartenders is really sick and had to leave early" um.... o_O do I need to take vitamin C after this drink?

I love TGI Fridays. It's always been great service. However last night.. our waitress was sooooo super slow...  Right when we were seated the waitress came back 3 different  times of which, everytime she came she said, I will be right back for ur order.. then our drinks took forever to come out but somehow she was politely rude, if that makes any sense.. lol.. anyhow, we 'll be back in hopes that we won't get the same waitress again!

Another chain review...    Sometimes I wish I lived or drove more to the city, because when you live in suburbia, you're kind of stuck with these types of restaurant chains.  On my most recent visit, I ordered the Cheeseburger (with bacon) and fries. The burger is dry and not worth the $10.  No hate, but I'd much rather get an Angus burger from Mcdonalds for half the price---and that includes a drink.

Every time I have been to this Fridays I have had terrible customer service. The waiters and waitresses never seem to check in on you or anything. A few friends and I had gone on a Sunday for their happy hour, which is one plus they offer on Sundays. All day happy hour with half off appetizers and fairly priced certain drinks. My friend ordered a plate of fries, when they came out they were cold and stale! We had to flag down another waitress and she replaced them. We all got various appetizers from the boneless wings to the nachos. It took forever for our food to come out, and when it did they too were cold and stale. The wings were hard and not fresh and the cheese on the nachos looked like it had been sitting there for a while. Definitely only coming back for happy hour drinks if that.

This rating is really for their drinks and happy hour. Love their drinks, the fruity drinks don't have a strong alcohol taste to it and their ultimate drinks for happy hour are made w/top shelf alcohol. If your in the mood for steak, know this isn't a place for great steaks, I order medium rare cus they usually are dry and over cooked. But when you get it don't sit there and complain because what did you expect from this type of place. The food is actually good, if you know what to choose. Think of this place as a fast food place, since the better choices are anything fried and burgers. Every time I come its always for drinks and always at happy hour. When hungry, the usual choices are fried green beans, fried mozorella, fried shrimp, or burgers.

It's hit or miss with the service here. Sometimes they are prompt and the food is piping hot, or sometimes you wait 30 minutes to see your server. The happy hour use to have a lot of beer options and great food choices, but they have narrowed the choices and now have narrowed the time. I will probably be trying the other neighboring loctions to see what they have to offer during Happy Hour.   The Bartenders are usually pretty nice and work fast but it is not always easy to get a seat at the bar or the bar area.

Got their Stripes Card and registered for a free appetizer. When I got there they said I didn't exist as a card member... And then they took about 45 minutes to bring out our appetizer...and another 15 till the food came out.... And my dessert was stale... And our waiter was ugly.

Typical chain restaurant. There was so many people there and the wait was so long, but the food was only so-so.  My sister and I's favorite appetizer is the fried green beans. Its so unhealthy, but you can't go wrong! The dipping sauce is good too!  The dishes are just normal, chain restaurant food; if you know what I mean. Not bad, but not good either.

Came in here for lunch with a friend after church to watch an nba playoff game. We normally go to BJs but decided to give Fridays a chance. There was a crew of employees that gathered at the table in front of ours, not sure if they were on shift yet, but they talked about everything that happened during the week and cussed like there was no tomorrow. They were so loud. Needless to say it didn't make the experience very memorable, but the food was good and there were lots of people watching the game so the atmosphere was manageable. We had a couple of orders of buffalo wings and the jack sampler. Not sure if this is the place for family if this is how the staff behaves normally. May try it again, but during a different time when there is a different staff on call.

Went here last minute with my bf, felt alittle bad because it was so late. But we got seated fast, and the service was awesome! Also the manager was still there that late and took the time to make sure our order was handled good and that we were happy. I haven't had great service like this in a restaurant in some time. So thanks to the TGI Friday's crew and we will be back!!

I agree with some of the other reviewers....  Horrible place.  The 1 star is for the service.  Waitress I had was nice, but not engaging and seemed like she didn't want to be at work.  The food is disgusting.  Instant mashed potatoes, stale meat and over cooked vegetables. Never coming back here again.  One time was once too many.

Went here as a nod to my wife's preferences.  Decent service, but probably the worst quality rib eye that I've ever seen.  Just awful food quality.  To top it off, ordered shrimp with the steak and got a nice bout of food poisoning.  First time ever!  Thanks TGIFs!

Food was decent but love their happy hour menu. Haven't been to many restaurants with happy hour on weekends. Love their half off appetizers: Nachos grande was good, baked potato skins lacked cheese, buffalo wings was bomb, and bbq chicken flatbread was okay. Brownie obsession for dessert, omg amazing!! Friendly service and had a a good time with friends.

i came here with my coworkers meeting up with a vendor for a lunch meeting. it was pretty empty on a wednesday afternoon. we were seated immediately. our waitress took our drinks order but was bad at refilling our cups. it was here's your drinks and never really checked if we needed refills. bad bad. i ordered the korean tacos -- i don't know why would i order korean tacos at an American chain restaurant... but the picture in the menu looked delicious. When our food came it was looked delicious, but when i took a bite.. the beef was super dry. flavor wasn't consistent. i took a bite of the rice -- omg.. it looked moist but it was SUPER DRY! YUCK overall, the service wasn't great. no refills, didn't make sure everyone had utensil, we weren't checked up upon.  come back? eh i'll rethink about it.

THE WORST SERVICE IN THE WHOLE WIDE WORLD! Don't go here if you actually want to eat a good meal and pay a good reasonable price for what you getting. If you like waiting then this is the restaurant for you!

The service is soooo bad. Their food is not all that good either but the dessert is good. The service really got to me, it seems like the employees don't want any customers to walk in and kill the "free time" they have. What I don't understand is who the hell is the manager here? I walked in Tuesday afternoon and there was no host to seat me. A few employees were just chatting up in the corner staring at me while I was tryna figure out if I should just seat myself, walk out??? Or just go to the bar area?, or are they even open for service???? The manager should put in some effort to fix this issue.

THANK YOU FOR MAKING US FEEL EMBARRASSED The food was excellent but really the experience trying to use your coupon is a joke. I don't think I will be coming back in a while.

Worst customer service ever. The host has the worst time of voice and attitude. A lot of tables were open and would not sit the 6 of us who all fit in one booth and we were ahead of everyone else. They would not sit us and made us wait while they sit everyone who came in 10 mins after us. And still did sit us down.

The place should be Thank. God. It's. Cold Inside. Why does a place like this has to be so cold during the winter time. It just don't make any sense. I feel for the person who waited on us.  But the food is so overrated here. Granted a lot of chain restaurants use pre-cooked foods.  My baked potato should have been hot not luke warm. Even though I ordered steak on the mid-rare. It came out to be rare and chewy. It was not the right cut for a rib eye. I'm a steak professional. I know my steaks. They need to do their veggies better. Instead of steaming them. They should saute it with olive oil and garlic. Then maybe people will eat more healthier it if was done like that. My mom's dish was overcooked. Her steak was too dry hard to chew. Her lobster tail was way over cooked by a couple of minutes. It looked like a goofball not a lobster tail.  The air in the place made my food cold. A lot of customers still had their jackets on. I was not comfortable in that place because of it.  This place still needs to be improved so does their food. I don't mind the service at all.

Ridiculous service!!! Within the last year, we've probably came to here a handful of 15 times and each time, we've become even more disappointed, therefore this place is not on our go-to list anymore. It's happened a couple times where we walk in, I go up to put my name on the list and the hosts are either chit-chatting with each other or they just aren't paying attention and I literally have to stand there until I'm noticed. I shouldn't have to get up and chase down someone to find my waiter for a refill. I have no idea what the mangers are thinking hiring such unprofessional staff. I'm extremely disappointed and won't be spending my money on bad service.

Not a big fan... The food all tastes the same. Watch a movie like office space and you want to like this place. Center bar, lots of flair, giant menu.  How can you go wrong... By making the good all taste the same. I'm assuming the executive chef is the same one from Applebee's who specializes in bland.  After thoroughly dunking all menu items in ranch dressing I found they still taste the same but at least it's masked like a fabreeze shower before a date.

HORRIBLE HORRIBLE HORRIBLE! This is my friend and I first time at Friday's and the service is just SAD , it took over a hour for hour apps to come then a worker that was not even on the clock game in with some donuts and all the servers , the host and even my server went and ate donuts, licked there fingers and went right back to work .... I visited TGIF's tonight on my weekly get together with some family and my initial feeling from looking at the other Yelp reviews was caveat emptor.  In the end I can't say I agree with them.  The food was very good, and our server, a young gal named Dez was a superb hostess and handled our party of 6 with ease.  I think I'll be coming back here again.

I enjoy coming here most of all we makes friends with the employees we always come back cuz of Lala she's nice sweet and friendly she's always quick multi tasking she was was not in a good mood cuz her manager kept poking her buttons but she kept her cool and kept us costumers happy not rude or mean but her manager... Plus food and prices are awesome

This place has gone way downhill. I used to really like it. I got the chicken fingers and they were extremely dry. Even my side salad wasn't that great. It was probably one of the worst restaurants meals I've had in awhile. The prices have gone up but the quality has gone down. Overall disappointment.

Food was great! My daughter & I ordered the steak & lobster. Steak was perfectly cooked. Lobster was steamed just right. I'm not sure why this restaurant received such bad reviews. It was my first time eating at this restaurant but my daughter has eaten there before and has not had a bad experience. We had absolutely no wait when we arrived. The waiter was a little slow bringing my son his milkshake after asking him for it a few times but other than that, we had a great overall experience.

One of the last stop on the Union City Bar Crawl. This place has an awesome happy hours. Probably the best around. Seriously the drinks specials here are unrivaled. The food is something disgusting though. You don't want to touch this crap. It's all out of a package and deep fried. Everything tastes pretty much the same. Like poop. If you're really getting the drunk munchies after hours of destroying your liver; keep your eye on the prize. Your taste buds should not be wasted on this junk.

Let me start off with that I like TGI Friday's. I just had a bad visit here - got the lobster tail & steak and chips & spinach dip. Lobster tail tasted burned. Steak was fine. Chips tasted stale and old. Service is slow, despite it not being busy.

Crappy Food combined with an equally crappy service. For Instance I ask the server "What kind of chicken dishes u got" Her Reply "I don't know U have to look into the menu yourself" with an attitude. We were 6 people and all that we ordered was stale and dry the one that stood out as the worst ever was Jack Daniel's chicken something worth $18.99 a plate which had a piece of stale rubbery chicken. Seriously TGIF u really got to look into something called "Quality and Value".

WOW!!!  After 45 minutes of waiting for our order we wave our waiter down.  It so happens that MIKE (tall, bald guy) FORGOT TO PUT OUR ORDER IN. WTH?  It wasn't even busy when we got there!  At this point, I'm already irritated and hungry.  We asked him if he can do something about it, like comp us an appetizer, anything.  He said, "No, it'll come out of my paycheck."  I don't give a F about your paycheck.   ONE star for MIKE Service is obviously inconsistent here.  Meh.

Came on valentine's day after a movie, about 10 pm. Expected a mad rush and weren't disappointed. We're fine with servers being busy, but not slow. The female bartender moved a glacial pace. It took at least 10 minutes for her to take our drink order and another 10 to get them. We ordered 3 appetizers which took at least a half hour to get to us; two were overcooked and had clearly been sitting under heat lamps for at least 15-20 minutes and one was undercooked. Couldn't finish the food; I guess it's lucky we weren't that hungry. Got the inedible food taken off the tab but it still took 10 minutes for the bartender to look our way and see we were ready to leave. There has to be somewhere better than this to go after a movie!

Went in October 2013 on a Saturday it was packed but we were seated in 25 minutes.  Myself and husband and 10 year old son.  We sat in a huge wooden booth near the Bar.  The music was old school and jamming and very loud.  I had the rib eye steak it was so good with shrimp.  My husband had the jack Daniels ribs as always he loved his meal.  My son was adventitious he had the kids chicken tenders and he hated them. Our waitress kept the soda's coming and was surprising attentive.  We live in Emeryville, CA but my husband and I can't wait to go back.  We wish it was closer but we will go back again and again.

Benjamin the waiter is the best!  We had a party of 16 and he remained calm and extremely attentive. I will always ask to have him as our waiter.  Good food and he made our experience beyond awesome.  We were still taking about him when we left.  VOGUE

When you walk in, prepare to be ignored. No smiles, no greeting.. If you DO get noticed at the front, you get blank stares.  Yes, from all 3 employees (2 girls and 1 guy) standing there. Umm hello, arent you supposed to ask me how many are in my party, or are you just really stoned right now?  Don't you realize there are many people who are unemployed and would love to have your job?  Sorry, I didn't realize it was THAT hard to be a hostess..!

This place gets pretty crowded since it's in Union Landing. I guess it's worth coming here but I'd much rather go elsewhere. I just feel that the atmosphere here isn't as great as other places like BJ's or somewhere along those lines. They card you if you're going to chill in the bar area. There's bouncers inside--that was different. The happy hour is pretty legit although I still would rather go elsewhere. I don't know, there's just something about TGIF that's really generic and I don't feel like TGIF can hold its on. The appetizers are alright, I'd prefer elsewhere. On the bright side, this can be a last resort place. Two stars because the bartender was good.

Came here for Happy Hour...the service was great, our waiter is very patient and nice. The only thing I'm disappointed with was my Santa Fe salad, little cubes of chicken and one piece of avocado wow! never again.  The three stars is for the waiter and $3 beer. Yay!

I LOVE this place. Awesome Happy Hour and awesome staff. I usually sit at the bar area and enjoy a game. Last night they had a bartender competition and it was AMAZING. I thought I was in Vegas for a second there. Next time you are in, ask when the next bartender comp is going down. You will be  entertained for free! A+ service on price and location. Cons-Finding a parking spot and a seat can be a challenge but it's worth the wait.

My coworkers and I come here all the time because they have a good happy hour and they are open later than us. The happy hour deals are great, $3 beers, $4 sangrias, and $5 "ultimate drinks", among other deals. The appetizer deals used to be half off, now they're all $6, which, for many of their apps is only a dollar or so off the regular price.  The drinks are ok, and the appetizers are the usual chain restaurant fare: wings, potato skins, mozzarella sticks, etc. Their potstickers are pretty good, but they're a little pricey. Holly always takes great care of us, when we get another server its sort of hit or miss. You kind of get the feeling that they know we work in a restaurant as well, so they know they're gonna get a good tip. Holly, however, is a total sweetheart and has always given us great service. The bar is reeeaaaally packed on most nights, so order a water along with your cocktail, because it WILL take at least 10 minutes to get your drink if you're sitting at a table on a friday night.

Okay. My grandpa and I came here only because we recieved a gift card from my friend. First problem# the parking. A Saturday night and the parking lot and parking all around it was full with cars crowding and surrounding the area. An empty parking space was un-imaginable. Second problem# Maybe I'm a bit pickey, but there was so much screaming and yelling with all the crazy drinking teenagers and adults. Thirs problem# the prices. Over 10$ for a cheeseburger and a tiny side of fries? Not worth it. I had the sirlion and shrimp which was over 20 bucks and the meat was really red even though I asked for well. I did have a blue raspberry slush which was actually pretty good though lol. Fourth problem# Okay please note that I came here with my grandpa and not my brother or sister. So my grandpa doesn't really know everything and can be a little you know...at times. SO: We used the gift card and had to pay an extra 15 bucks. Was that the problem? No it wasn't. My grandpa thought their would be a cashier at the front (which I think is not a crazy thing to do) and so here's what happens: Grandpa: I would like to pay for my order. Where's the cashier? Waitress: (not ours by the way) WHAT DO YOU MEAN? YOUR WAITER/WAITRESS IS THE CASHIER Grandpa: Fine!  I was really dissapointed by how this lady treated us this evening. I wish she was fired, but this will hopefully be the last time I come here because hey, there are so many places that are so much better to eat at. For corn sake, In-N-Out is better haha!

Sarah Was our waitress great service even when it got slammed in the bar. Drinks and apps on time and great waitress. She kept full attention on us and made sure our drinks and stomachs where never empty. Keep it up!

I don't like giving bad reviews but seriously,  This place doesn't even deserve the 1 star I'm giving.. Poor Jessica (my fiancé) got food poisoning from her broccoli and cheddar soup...  Our server Jesse was about the only this that was decent.  The food was microwaved, and cold.. And when i confronted the manager about it, i told him, "if I wanted a  cold microwaved dinner, i would have stayed home." This is about the time when he decided to comp the bill..  Whatever happend to "cooking" I guess chain restaraunts don't do this anymore.. Very dissapointed T.G.I Fridays.. From the tie i walked in the door, you failed miserably, you sat us at a table that was missing a chair, next to the computer kiosk that all the servers hover around to snicker and bs... Who are all too busy watching the game(s) to notice anything or anyone else in the restaraunt. You guys couldn't even give us clean silverware & glassware.. :(  Needless to say I won't be visiting a fridays again.

I understand some employees have off days... But when u come to work leave all the drama outside the door.First they want us to stand for 15mins while there's a table available right in front of  us.Then we order drinks and they tasted like water downed kool aid. Instead of offering us a different drink this mF just takes um off the table n don't say nothing. Smh wtf is that. We're paying customers.we ain't trying get nothing for FREE.Do not go here.This place is Officially  INVALID!!!!!!!!

I haven't been to a TGI Friday's in a long time, mostly because there are other options however I had a "Buy one entree and 2 drinks get the second entree for free" coupon so my friend and I went there for dinner. I am beyond confused as to how they stay in business, let alone are always jam packed full of people. Hostess: says hello then stars at us blankly. I had to say "um.. two please.' Upon which she walked as slow as possible to our table. Waiter: I think speedy here had about 500 cups of coffee because he spoke so fast I could barely understand him. I even mentioned that he was speaking fast and he said it was because he knew I was going to say something so he wanted to get it out... but he talked this way all night. Service: Slow as heck. There were a lot of people in here, but being it was a Tuesday it wasn't packed. It look us over 30 minutes to get our very simple order. Food: I guess the bun was bigger than the burger patty so they cut the burger patty in half to make it look like it took up the whole bun. They forgot my bacon and the green bean fries were cold. We split a piece of the red velvet cake... very little flavor and super dense. I have had better from a grocery store. I give it 2 stars because it wasn't horrendous but I will not be going back here.  Ever.
Rude servers and hosts. Food is ok, best thing is drinks.

Been here a handful of times and I usually don't review chains but today was terrible. Only come here because my boyfriend loves the jack Daniels sauce more than the actual steak. Five o'clock on a Wednesday you think it wouldn't be bad... We were wrong. It wasn't full and there was no wait. Took 15 minutes for a server to acknowledge us, another ten to get our drinks, and our food came out half an hour. That's almost an hour to see food from time of arrival.
