Bf ordered steak medium rare and it came out well done. We asked for it to be replaced and it took another 20 minutes. I won't go into details about what I ordered, but my Mac and cheese side was f$&@!n penne with bread crumbs!!! There were more pieces of penne noodles than shreds of cheese! The cheese was basically sprinkled on to penne noodles and melted... So once the cheese was gone it was plain old penne noodles again, what the fork?! To get a to go box for our potato skin leftovers- the only things decent took forever and so did the check and getting the card back. I know chains can't hire some world class experienced servers but I'm sick of these kids foolin around with my meal time! FYI I've served In a restaurant before and I know the hard labor it takes to keep one running but these kids man, I would never not tip but they are pushin it!

Reading the reviews I can tell that TGI is consistent with one thing, horrible quality and quanity. I chose to dine in tonight because it was open late. I ordered a flounder, they didn't have any left I then asked to substitute for salmon but couldn't because " We cant subsitute because the flounder is sent to us like that" ok??? I thought we had moved on to salmon, guess I was wrong. Finally we were able to agree on a plate. When I received it I couldn't believe my eyes.  That price for THAT portion I think not. The chef's choice of vegetables was brocoli, and my plate had about three spoonfuls of rice. The salmon didn't have much flavor. Overall we left still hungry and unsatisfied and are now waiting on our IN N OUT order after agreeing we will never return. The management could of also done a better job, working at a restaurant myself I know for a fact my manager would of came to speak to an unhappy guest and gone out of their way to fix it. Keep your free dessert.

Went here with coworkers last night after a long day at the office. We all rushed over, worried they closed at 10pm. Too our surprise they were open...and until midnight! Things kept getting better when we realized happy hour started at 9:30pm M-Th. Our table ordered 2 of the Jack Daniels Tenders (always a GREAT choice,) a Chicken Quesadilla (a little on the soggy side ,) Thai Pork Tacos (good, but didn't look anything like they do in the advertisement...3 VERY small tacos, and not half off on the happy hour menu.) and the BBQ chicken flatbread (on the low cal menu...only 340 calories!!) Our table was drinking LITs and Guinness...drinks were great for the price!! Ended up getting out of there with a $20 tap/pp. Not too bad!! Will certainly return in the future

Yay for TGI Friday's! My review will be on the bar, and not the restaurant. Never had experience with any of the hostess' or waiters. Everytime I come here, I walk straight to the bar. Usually come during happy hour (3-7) and appetizers are 50% off! yay! Beer is still 3.50 (typical price). Came here Saturday night with my friend, and since appetizers were 50% off, we ordered more appetizers than we could eat. $4 for a big plate of fried green beans? Common, who can beat THAT?!  Same bartenders everytime I come here. Really friendly, curteous, and professional. Everytime I come, I eyeball (mean mug) the mexican bartender, because my first drink at turning 21, I came to Friday's, and he didn't card me.. aww, NO FUN! Haha, but he's a friendly guy. The patio area is right outside the bar too, so you can go out there and chill and smoke too. My favvvvvorite place, and I'm a regularrrr!(:

Our server really did a lousy job. We were really close to having the manager come to our table, before we paid our bill. I really wanted to argue with the $1 tip my friend left, but i couldn't. I did have a talk with the manager before leaving, to explain our dissatisfaction. She was understanding and apologetic and really wanted to make it up to us. As a server, Maria did a lousy job of representing the business... as a manager, Teresa did a good job of trying to salvage the situation. I'll probably give them a chance to get a better rating from me.

I am SO GLAD, I'm not the only one who thinks the service here sucks! I've been here many times for a beer but lately I've tried to have food here and each time its been a disaster. Including MAKING ME SICK! Honestly, This is such a long horror story I don't have time to write it all down. It would be pages and pages. Let me sum it up. Trip #1 *it took my substitute waiter 30+ minutes to take my order. I had to go to the waiter's station and get him to come take our order. *He gets my order wrong and then complains that he has to take it back.  *the food arrived and looked like S**T. I've complained about food twice in my life, and this was one. I tell him and he says "Well...don't shoot the messenger" WTF?! act like an adult and at least attempt to take care of it. *I point to the $4 beer special on the menu. My tab says its $8. I ask what happened? "Oh, the $4 one was the 16oz. you had a different one."   Yeah I stiffed the waiter and I've never EVER done that before, but he had it coming. I even wrote WHY I did it on the back of the bill. Trip #2 Same waiter arrives (whoopee) *everyone's food arrives. Theirs is fine. - 5 hours later I'm throwing up and thats the only thing I had eaten all day.  COINCIDENCE? I've only given Two, 1 star reviews. Congratulations on being one of them.

This tgifs IS better than the one in Pleasanton but its not as amazing as a few others I've been to. They do make reservations for parties more than 8. I went here for my 21st birthday with a group of 16. It took me so long to make the reservation though, they passed me off to 3 or 4 people and none of them seemed to know what tgey were doing. When I got there at my reserved time, they told me they wouldn't seat me unless half my party was there, and shuffled us aside. Its not my fault if some people in my group were late, and they should have let us know beforehand that they wouldn't seat us until half the party was there. I arrived with 7 and they still wouldn't seat us, not to mention they didn't even have a table set up. Even when they did set the table up they wouldn't seat us, even though wer had an oder lady with us with a broken foot who couldn't stand for long. Once everyone did get there, we must have waited maybe an hour and a half for the food. I didn't time it, but it was at least an hour. That said, the food here is pretty good. Not as good as some but certainly better than pleasanton. The 4 stars is for the jack daniels chicken and shrimp and they nice wait staff who have always been attentive

Our food took awhile to make its way to us. However, our waiter and the rest of the employees were all very friendly and extremely hardworking. A baby at a nearby table knocked over several glasses of water & a bus boy came around to clean it up and couldn't have been more pleasant about it.  I don't fault any of the employees for the amount of time it took us to get our food. Friendliness and hardworking attitudes count for a lot in my book. ;) Clearly, this place needs to hire more people.

So so shabby. Tables are super sticky, and the waitress that brought out that apple/ice cream heap put on a fake show of "MmMMm.. it looks soooo gooood!"---it wasn't.  You wouldn't eat ice cream with hot apple sauce sloshing around a skillet would you? You would?? You're disgusting.

Called to order something to go. Had me stay on hold for the length of two songs only to tell me that the items featured on the FRONT of their official site was not available. Not because they ran out, but because they just don't offer it.

Compared with Chili's, their 3 for $20 and 2 for $10 are comparable in value but gives me more versatility. The atmosphere is definitely more active and service a bit better than Chili's. And there was a bit more options here.   Maybe it is a Wednesday but, there were no real crowds and it was very safe without any rowdy bar crowds. To me however, I liked the Chili's steak dinner (2 for $20) than here (3 for $20) because Chili's steak was more tender and the mash potato more flavorful (maybe it was the bacon). However the dessert and service made up for that gap. I believe there eagerness for the grill marks or the way the steak was cut, ruined the steak for me. If you are really picky about the steak, at this price I would recommend Chili's (the nachos and guacamole was also good). However the flexibility and offerings is your thing, then this is a better place for the price. Because of the steak I wanted to give this place 3 stars, but the other aspects earn them an extra star. If the steak was better they might have even gotten the last star due to the price and value.

typical fast-food-sit-down joint with a bunch of teens running the place.   nothing stands out. nothing worth complaining about.   had the jack daniels sampler and korean tacos.  not enough meat. it was more like a veggie taco.  it was made with lettuce, and minimal cabbage.  MY BAD.  i wasn't at a korean place...  i will say this: i LOVE, LOVE, LOVE the jack daniels coconut shrimp. it may be worth the slow service ... maybe.

Two stars is generous, it should really be one and a half. The food is decent and they have a good happy hour, that's about it though. The service sucks overall and the staff doesn't make you feel welcome at all. It seems like they are more interested in socializing and goofing off with their friends than doing their job well. There are also bouncers or whatever for the bar who check your id who are really rude, unprofessional and unpleasant....unless you're a friend of theirs or a chick dressed like a skank. The bar is the only good part of this place. They have good happy hour deals and the bartenders are always pretty friendly. It can get real busy at times, and once when it took forever to get my beer the bartender gave me a free one after I finished. I like coming to the bar for happy hour, It just sucks having to deal with those guys at the door. The one time I have sat down at a table the service was unimpressive. Our server looked bored and she would ignore us/disappear for long periods of time after saying our food was "almost ready." It doesn't matter if our food is taking longer than usual, JUST TELL US instead of leaving us hanging like that. She also forgot to give my boyfriend his credit card back after he paid and we had to return the next day. There are tons of other places at Union Landing that has employees that can actually communicate with people, you're better off going to one of those. Unless you dress like a skank, then your experience will probably be awesome.

I usually come to Fridays after work and order appetizers. Service is ok the staff is friendly but last time I came two of them were arguing about some personal stuff. It was unprofessional and kind of annoying trying to get their attention. Jack Daniel chicken strips is a hit for me. Cheeseburger sliders not so much. Made me sick twice. Always check for happy hour. Appetizers are half off. Don't order the steak its obviously not a steakhouse... It's dry and has no flavor. Bad experience with the entrees. Perfect place for cocktails and appetizers

Avoid this place unless its the last place left on earth!! Been going to this place for more than 10 years and were decently satisfied with employees and food/drinks quality. However, we were turned into scapegoats thru conspiracy by the security guard and hostess' on our last visit. All seemed to be fine on this last night that we were there, the bar was closing around 2am, we were asked to close our tab, which we did and paid with a debit card. Meaning that funds had to be available for the damn thing to even go thru. FYI - about 15 mins before we paid and left, a group of patrons (also a party of 4) was asked to leave the restaurant as they were arguing and being rowdy in the restaurant. The security guard quickly escorted them out and let them go. Tons of people saw them leaving. 2 mins after we exited the parking lot of TGI's, Union City police stopped us for not paying our bill. We're like: "is this a joke?", but apparently it wasn't, the security guard and maybe other staff gave the cops our license plate number as the guilty party, when clearly everyone saw the other group of 4 create a ruckus and leave. We explained to the police exactly what happened, but management was unable to clarify this for almost 1 - 1.5 hours, we got home @ 4am that morning. How hard is it for cops to call a restaurant and ask the manager to go thru the last 5 - 10 merchant copies of signed receipts and clear up the matter. My inclination: the security guard was trying to make sure his friends could get as far away as possible while cops could harass an innocent party. SO, just in case your planning to be disrupted by rowdy crowds, harassed by cops and be conspired on by security guards employed here, feel free ! Otherwise, there's tons, literally tons of places, 100 times better in food quality and options and much more decent client base in the area.....

Gave this two stars because it wasn't that horrible. It was a rainy day in union city, and the boyfriend chose to eat at TGIFridays. We ate here once before. Once we walked through the door , there was no hostess to greet us and I think I said "table for 2" to a person who didnt even work there. Come to find out the hostess was sitting her ass on the customer  waiting benches. Gave her a dirty look, like are you serious, this is your job. She was kind enough to recognize that and freely changed her direction to the booth section instead of the regular tables. I can't complain about our waitress, she was cute and on top of her shit.  The restaurant itself was ehhh..and the bathroom was gross. Didnt even want to sit my ass on that seat. So disgusting.

let's keep this short and sweet(well salty in this case) this is for dinner: (we had a huge party) half the table was helped then the other half was helped 15 minutes later. thus resulting the other half gettin their food 15 minutes later. wtf. come on. like relaly? and they just dont really care everything is very salty. the price was not all that. parking sucks too. and we had to wait like 30 minutes before gettin seated.  just, not good. lol. BLAH.  not coming back thats for sure. probaly not even for their happy hour. lol.

The bar tender mike is really nice and friendly. We bought drinks from him all night because he had great customer service and always had a smile on his face. As of the other workers they looked miserable. I definitely would come back to the bar at least

Apparently Fridays is the place to be for the Union City crowd on Friday and Saturday nights! Ive come here both nights and it is PACKED. During happy hour, they card at the door, so I guess you can't grab a food unless you're 21+.  Since it's so crowded, it's hard to find seats at the bar. Fortunately, they have a lot of tables off to the side considered part of the "bar" for happy hr. Seating isn't the big problem, it's getting served. After the first round of drinks came out, one of my friends was still missing his. 15 min later, we asked again about it and the waitress tried to play it off like it was still coming out, but it was clear she had forgotten to put his in. A crown&sour can't take 20 more min to make than margaritas! Our food and later rounds of drinks also took a long time to come out. It got to the point where my friend ordered 2 drinks right after receiving one, knowing he wouldn't actually get them until he was way past done with the first. In the end, that didn't even work and we just hauled our asses to the bar to order them for ourselves.  BUT I do have to give 1 star for $5 large margaritas, $4.50 spinach dip for which they'll gladly give you more chips, and green bean fries, buffalo wings, potato skins, etc. all for hella cheap!
Happy Hour all Day Sunday at the Bar. Thats all that needs to be said.

Well I obviously did not read the reviews before coming here, otherwise I wouldn't have even bothered coming. We ordered the cheeseburger sliders, which were ok.  We also ordered the Jack Daniel's burgers, very well done, no pink, and they came out like a lump of coal.  Our buns were toasted, and obviously kind of old because they were hard.   Mango Margarita didn't taste like alcohol at all, BUT the worst part of this is the HORRIBLE service.  Our food took forever, it was gross, and the waiter hardly came to our table.  We saw him high fiving his friends, we saw him on his cell texting someone, we saw him walking around goofing off with his fellow waiters.  He was doing all except serving his tables.   We waited for the check for so long, when he brought it out they charged us the appetizer twice. It was pretty dead in here. Bad food plus Horrible service = Not coming back.

I've only come to Friday's a few times, as a matter of fact I could probably count the times using one hand. I've heard they have a good Happy Hour(and I'm ALL about happy hours, lol) BUT I have yet to try it.  Each time I've come in the food and service has been okay, but definitely not exceptional.  The last time I came here our server, I forget her name(probably because I didnt HEAR her name), was suuper quiet. I could barely tell if she was mumbling to herself or if she was talking to us. Friday's should invest in getting that girl a microphone or something! We settled on eating the 2 for $20 which INCLUDES dessert and is a pretty great deal because some other restaurants 2 for $20 deal doesnt include dessert. The experience was just okay, and the service wasnt exceptional. Nothing spectacular of memorable about the evening.

One word. AWFUL. Awful food, Awful Service. I came here on Friday with a few friends to enjoy a dinner out. By the end of the meal, the service was so horrible and we were so hungry, we were almost not even friends anymore lol. When we arrived, we put our name down on the waitlist. I stood outside the front doors for us to get called. About 15 minutes later, I walked in again to check on our table, the host gave me mad attitude and told me he had already called our table and next time I should stand closer to the restaurant. Excuse me? I was right outside the front door, maybe you should use your legs and go check. Wtf? I actually mentioned out loud that I had been right outside, and he gave me a death stare. Then he proceeds to seat us at the back most table next to the bathrooms and the kitchen. Again, WTF? Next, our waiter was "on a break" so we got another waitress taking our order. She put in our order (we ordered nachos) and almost 40 minutes later, they came... that too COLD. I ordered a drink, which she never brought, and then after I asked our REAL waiter to cancel my drink, it magically had already been made and given to me. Then we ordered a salad, again, it took another 30 minutes for a simple SALAD to arrive. We didn't even eat it, we had to box it up and leave. Our waiter was not at all apologetic, and he barely came by to check on us. He pretty much ignored us everytime he went to the kitchen... hmm maybe it had something to do with the crappy seating. Overall, I am not cool with this place. I don't like spending my money on a useless meal with terrible service. I could cook better food and be happy eating in. This place is a terrible chain, and for the price of their food, I expect some better service. Needless to say, I will never be going back here again. And a note to the host with a terrible attitude, you suck at your day job.

It happens on occasion.  I end up eating at a chain.  I'm not a fan of chains, but sometimes you just don't have a lot of options and Friday's was by far the best choice.   Me and two of my girlfriends (one VERY pregnant with twins) and I entered and waited for-ev-er to be seated.  The place was not busy at all, in fact pretty empty and we stood there as employees passed us by.  A good 5-6 people ignored us until finally we were seated.  I was somewhat annoyed. Our server was sweet and took our order when we were ready.  It took (again) for-ev-er for us to get our food.  The place was pretty empty so I have no idea why it too so long.  All of us ordered sandwiches as well, so I was slowly becoming annoyed again by having to wait so long. My club sandwich was good and I ordered for a few buck extra sweet potato fries (yum).  Imagine my disappointment when I hardly got any.  I mean the fries were so scarce you could see most of the plate.  I really was (again) annoyed that I paid extra for this side only to hardly get any.   So the theme of my visit is obviously "annoyed".  My visit reminded me (once again) why I detest chains and the lack of decent food and portions.  At least we had a very sweet waitress that gave us good customer service.

Food: 8/10 - I'm a meat lover, so I always order something with steak! Music: 6/10 - I rated 6 because sometimes it's too loud and you can hardly hear your friends speak! But their selection is good. Service: 9/10, very friendly staff! Haven't been here for their Happy Hour, but I will soon! LOL I just have to try it, I really do! I'll keep you posted on that!

I go here mostly for happy hour. I like it cuz they have afternoon happy hour and night happy hour so it's a chill place to go at nights. Half off appetizers, cheap margarita's/long islands.. They have that $4 blue moon special (not sure how long they'll have it for) but i LOVE blue moon now ever since i started getting it here. Service is not always consistent, they have their good days and their weak days. I also like the Jack daniels food.. especially the Jack Daniels Pasta.. it's not on the menu anymore, but sometimes they'll still make it if you ask. =)

I don't go here to eat, and I wouldn't recommend that you do. The food is just as you expect at many chains--unappealing and not worth the money! I don't know if every TGIF has a full bar, but this particular one does. I'll stop in whenever I want to grab a drink with friends and feel like mingling with Logan alumni. There is always at least one group of Logan alumni in the bar area! Which is cool. My older brother's friend bartends here and I'm grateful that he sometimes sends me drinks I've never even heard of. For example, a Shit on the Grass, which is Bailey's over green creme de menthe. Lol. Ask for Mike. He is a cool dude.

Came here on a Saturday night and the experience is horrible. Service was terrible. I understand that the restaurant was packed, but after being seated, the waitress/waiter did not approach our table for a good 15-20 minutes or so. They got our drinks, and left us there. We were sitting at the table waiting for someone to take our order, no one bothered to stop by. We kept waiting. Finally someone came and took our order, appetizers came out within 10 minutes, after we finished, no one came and cleared the table. Entrees took over 30 minutes to come out. Once the entrees came out, my colleague had requested sweet potato fries instead of french fries, they gave her french fries. After being able to get the attention of the waiter, he brought out a dinky plate of sweet potato fries. Really now? The portion of the sweet potatoes was half of the portion of the french fries. Such a disappointment. The tables near us had the same experience. The waitress/waiters were not constant, we had other waitresses and waiters from other sections of the place to serve us. By the time we left the restaurant, we spent a good an hour and a half in there.  Disappointment. Will not be going here again.

Having read some of the reviews about customer service at TGI Friday's I have to say I am a bit surprised. We had Ottilia as our server and this was one of my, "Food Always Taste Better When You Have A Great Server" moment.  My daughter and I were impressed at how attentive Ottilia was, recommending her favorite soup,  and stopping by our table several times to make sure we had everything we needed. I overheard her getting compliments from the booth next to us so this girl is doing something right . Management, PLEASE acknowledge this employee for having a great attitude and above average customer service!
Don't go here. Go to the Texas Roadhouse, see Mario and Ozzy. At least they have common server manners.

I love Fridays and was seriously depressed when they closed all 3 locations near me in the north bay.  So we took a mini road trip to Union City just so we could get our Fridays fix. Drinks and food were delicious, as delicious as my past Fridays experiences in San Mateo and Cupertino.  Unfortunately they took the tostada nachos off the appetizer menu. Very sad about that but everything else was yummy.  Service was not bad either.

This place is only good for the happy hour.  Came here to eat on sunday. Took 25 minutes to a table even though it wasn't even busy. Our waiter was nice he got all the orders correct but when all the food came out it was all cold even the appitizers. When we got our fries it was cold and soggy and the burger was over cooked and super oily. If it wasnt for the all day happy hour on sunday i would rate this place a 1 star.

This place has THE most terrible service I have ever experienced. Came here with a party of 12 for a friend's birthday dinner. I ordered the Honey Salmon Pecan with side order of the basket of fries. The waiters waited about half an hour before they took our orders. It took them about 45 minutes more for us to get our food, after we complained twice! On top of that, three of us didn't even get our order (not even side dishes)! So we had to complain yet again, and it took them 15-20 minutes longer to get the food out. My salmon was stiff and flavorless., and didn't even come with pecans... I had a better time eating my fries. On top of that, the bill was ridiculously high! Given, there were a few incompetent people on the other side of the table playing pink lemonade pong and "jerk the straw in the water to make it splash everywhere", but seriously?! The service charge+tip+high prices of meals=ugh. Never coming back.

This is a shout out to the bar staff.  They're friendly and they've made me tons of mixed drinks without messing anything up over the years.  I've been here a billion times and I've never sat in the dining area (bar or patio only) but I'm sure it's fine.  And this isn't to say that I've never eaten here.  Anything with Jack Daniel's sauce works, even though they get fry happy sometimes and you can no longer tell what's under the batter.  My current favorite is the Fiery Chicken Popper Sandwich-cream cheese, jalapeno habanero jelly, jalapenos, oh yeah, and chicken.  Unfortunately, I can't forget I'm eating at Friday's, hence the 3 stars.

I debated a two star vs a three star but settled with a three since my overall experiences coming here are A-Ok. I debated the two because they are never consistent with their food and service. My food was brought cold on one occasion (my "sizzling chicken and shrimp was def. not sizzlin'!) and on another, our waitress was clearly busting too many tables and couldn't focus on happy customers. However, sometimes we get great waiters and other times the food comes out amazing. This place is NEVER consistent and I'm always a little anxious walking through the door - how will tonight's experience go?? Overall though, I really love their food. I just wish they could bring it out fresh EVERY time.

Before I say anything more, TGIFriday's in Cupertino has always been a pleasant experience for me, so this review is strictly for this location. I've had 3 experiences here, and only the first was passable (hence one star). The last two times I stopped in here I had to leave before even being seated and/or served. That's how ridiculous it was. They seem to have a sufficient number of staff on hand, but for whatever reason they like to flock around the servers station playing grab ass or whatever it is back there that makes customer service not a priority. My most recent visit was just last week. They had some construction work taking place in the doorway, but that wasn't the problem. The problem was just standing there. There was no host ready to seat us (even though it was obvious to them we were there), and nearly vacant but for a few people @ the bar. Once seated, we were completely ignored once again. Throw in the fact that it was freezing cold in there and I could take no more. I finally walked out and have NO plans of coming back here. If you're looking for good service, and a respectable meal within a reasonable amount of time, this isn't the place to go.

I don't know what happend to their service, it was never like this. Just horrible, the waiters ignore you. It takes 20 minutes just to get a drink, I remember when the jack Daniel chicken was so good, it's not the same anymore. They should have no stars. The only reason they got 2 is because 2 things. Mashed potato with jack Daniels sauce and strawberry shortcake with 4 pieces of bread....umm umm umm luv it.

I love this place for a quick dinner... quick and cheap.. seriously, this place has the best 2 for 20 special around the UC area, also for a few more bucks you can pick from the more hearty options, always a plus in my book. They make some pretty good sweet potato fries that you can get as a side with just about any meal :) no extra charge like at other places. Friendly staff, great happy hour menu, good drinks that won't brake the bank, I like this place. Oh and it is never super full, except maybe on Friday nights but at that time you should be home sleeping :)
The bar happy hours ahhhh and great bartenders

Usually have a pretty good experience whenever I come here. Prices are nice and the food is good too. The portions are nice for the price you pay too. I am usually here with a group of friends because the atmosphere caters to that. I don't drink so the noise from the bar can be irritable at times but not insufferable.

I come in for drinks sometimes. Try the Roscato (red moscato) and the sangrias. The staff is friendly and quick and it's other patrons mind their own conversations even while they're next to you at the bar.

I normally don't curse but... F--k this TGIF location, F--k why did I even leave a tip after waiting 1 hour for my food?  Why the F--k did I wait 30 minutes to get seated after they forgot to write my name down the first time,  why the F--k would I buy Barefoot Chardonnay for $5.75 a glass when I can get a bottle for $3.00 at the Albertsons across the parking lot,  selling Barefoot Chardonnay at a restaurant should be a f--kin' crime.  why the F--k did everyone around us get served first even though we ordered first?   why the F--k was my table sticky like peewee's seat at the peep show? ...and now I got the runs from eating at this f--ked up establishment.  f--k f--k f--k this TGIF location and for shame on the corporation to allow this f--king place to keep running...

The bar is always going crazy, as are the cops that are circling the block outside. Food is always subpar, but the drinks usually don't fail. We have held one-too-many birthday gatherings here, and plan to do so again in the future. Thanks for putting up with our BS Friday's :)

lets start with I ordered a french dip but when it came it didnt have the cheese, mushroom or onions as described. then my waitress was going to bring everything out on the side for my meat to get cold and build the sandwich myself. I will not come back here again.

Thought we'd get there early and celebrate my kids' bdays. Got there around 4:30 and the place was clearly not busy at all. No one in the front to greet and  take you to your seats. Took about 3-5 minutes. Got seated and I discreetly asked if they do something special for bdays and told her that we're celebrating two. She smiled and said she'll take care of it. There were only four of us so it wasn't like we're keeping her busy. Got the drinks and appetizer just fine. Took a little longer for the entrees. Food was just okay...nothing special. But the service was clearly lacking when you can't even get drink/water refills. Server came around once, probably after we'd each taken a bite or two to check on us. That was the last time. We sat around a long time after we'd all finished our meals, when someone else (not our server) asked about dessert. I guess our server totally forgot about the bday celebrants. I asked for a couple of minutes to peruse the dessert menu. Kids picked out what they wanted, then our original server came around 15 minutes later. We ordered dessert (still didn't jog her memory and I didn't bother mentioning it 'coz it would take away the element of surprise) & asked for water refills. Before she could move too far away, she asked a colleague if she could get us water. The other's reply was "I've got people in the front" & turned her back. 30 minutes later, we finally got our dessert--a couple of ice cream-filled oreos served on a plate with choc/caramel drizzle. 30 minutes!!! At this point I got up to take a look around. Sure...other patrons but definitely not crowded, especially when you see 4-5 servers standing around in the soda station chatting...but no one could be bothered to give us water refills!  We picked this place 'coz the kids said that out of all the places in Union Landing, we haven't gone back to this one in a while-- at least a couple of years. Now we all remember why. We always get spoiled @ Chili's & Chevy's with the fast service, so I think we'll be staying away from Friday's for at least another couple of years.
The food and service was ok. But I didn't liked to have mold in the glass of water I've ordered though. Not professional, and kinda not really healthy too. :(

They have a fantastic array of drinks. Sundays are happy hour ALL DAY. What can get better than that?  The food isn't the best but the drinks def make up for it. The service was also pretty decent. Our server was friendly and very attentive. She made sure to come by and check on us often but not so much that we were crowded. It isnt the place to go party but you cant go wrong if you want some decent drinks and a friendly atmosphere.

Okay, so all Friday's were created equally, right? WRONG! I don't know what it is about this particular location, but the bar is always CRACKING!  You can come here on a random Tuesday night and guess what?  It is ladies' night!  Drink specials, prize wheel, and a DJ!  I came here last night and there were jugglers at the bar, bartending and making drinks!  Of course, they aren't there every Wednesday, but they were celebrating their [long, overdue] bar expansion!  It's crazy how a franchised restaurant in good ol' Union City can bring in people from Oakland, San Francisco, and the South Bay.  Yes, I have met people from all these areas here. P.S. I don't like to review chained places and I realize 4-stars is a lot for a chained restaurant, but it'd be wrong for me to rate it anything lower since I frequently come here.  (Oh crap.  Did I just put myself on blast for being a townie?!?)

Never was a huge fan of the place but went in there recently for the first time in ages and was pleasantly surprised. The TV's they had the last time I was in there were literally there when the place opened in 2000 and they were up above the bar yet behind all the glasses so you couldn't see the anyway. Now it is completely modernized. Looked to be 10-12 flat screens so you could see them from wherever you were sitting and they also got rid of the top part of the bar so it's completely wide open so you can see what's happening everywhere in the restaurant. Kinda like that. This place seems to attract many attractive woman for some reason so I like to be able to scope out the whole scene. As far as food/drink aspect the food used to be terrible but I had a couple different items and was pleasantly surprised. Grilled Chicken Nachos were tasty although a little cold in the middle. Bacon Cheeseburger with Sweet Potato Fries was much better than expected. And as with any Fridays there is a full bar but I tend to stick with beer so the fact that it was ice cold was a major plus. All in all nice upgrade and a much better experience than previous visits. Can already tell this is probably going to be my new fall back spot when I just wanna get out for a bite to eat and a drink or 2. Also they stay open til 1:30 AM Friday and Saturday nights so it gives me a local option other than some dive bar.

I went here all the freakin' time when I was still in high school just for the food and the entertainment.  Now that I'm way over 21 years of age, I go here for the HAPPY HOUR!!  The bartenders are always nice!! =)  As for the wait for the food, it takes awhile to get to your table...  I don't know what's up with that shit??  I go here seldom whenever I'm in the area with one of my girls!! Now the lastest news about TGI Fridays.... They have this new "Give Me More Stripes" rewards card program where you can get a FREE DESSERT with a purchase of an entree on your birthday!  Of course, you'll get a FREE birthday song out of it...... Plus, just for signing up with their program, you will get an email coupon for a FREE APPETIZER  or DESSERT and a pass to go in front of the other customers that was ahead of you. =) Nice!!! You will receive a coupon for an $8 coupon for free food for every $100 you spend and other benefits too!! =)

Today. December. 4th. 2014. At 8pm i wanted to try something. New so i went with my wife and 2kids.  we didnt even get the drinks. It took 10minutes. And nobody came so we left. Thats really sad because their was alot of people working and nobody came to even say the waiter will be with you or anything... They should put more people so they can give a better service:-(

My husband and I just got back from dinner here. It was Sunday night happy hour and extremely packed, it took a long time to be served out meal and my husband's Fire Grill Chicken didn't come out looking like he expected at all, he thought the picture looked like rice with broccoli mixed in, but when his plate came out with a huge serving of broccoli I thought he was going to send it back. He decided the chicken and the rice looked fine and he started eating it instead. I ordered the Jack Daniels Rib-eye and lobster tail, it was really great! I would have given it a 4 stars minimum for my meal, but my husband was annoyed with the really long wait times and his meal.

I got here early before the lunch rush and parking was more than adequate. Seated off to the side and menu in hand, my server got my drink quickly and she NEVER let my drinks get low the entire time I was there (either my Coke or water). I ordered their babyback ribs and got two side-orders (fries and cole-slaw). Fries were not hot and the cole-slaw was neither cold nor crispy.  Forget the side-orders for a moment since they were only a scoop of them. The Ribs were top notch and the meat easily came off the bones.  It came with a small cup of extra BBQ sauce but I used it because I liked the sauce and not because it was dry. This is something I want to eat all the time.  Ribs tasted like ribs covered in sauce, not like sauce with meat flavoring.  For dessert, I had their red-velvet cake with ice cream (I can NOT believe it was that many calories!)  I was disappointed since the cake tasted dry (ice cream made it better).  But honestly, do yourself a favor and just order a dessert and ignore the calorie count printed on the menus!  I think reading that might have made me give an excuse not to give their cake a higher score! I don't know how loud this place gets during major sporting events but I am told it does get loud at times.  Service is prompt and friendly!  Thanks for letting me enjoy my food!
This TGIF is close to everything.  Love the location.  Love their happy hour.  Love their Deep Fried Green beans.

I feel like every time I come here I'm gambling.  I really like some of their food but I hate how inconsistent it is.  Example, my fiancé and I ordered the cajan chicken and shrimp pasta, which is really good (typically), but it seems like every other time we go in there it's a different recipe or something.  One time it tasted AWFUL and all the waitress said when we brought it to her attention was "oh".  The next time we went in it was great!  I don't get it.
This is obviously a "let's get drunk for cheap" place! It's always ridiculously packed and usually with people you don't want to see.  Not a place you'd go out of your way to go...obvi.

This place is better than the nearby Applebees, but it still was not that great. It was pretty expensive for what you got,  and also the music is soooo loud that you have to shout at your friends so they can hear you, that made it unconfortable dining there. Overall, this place is Ok, even though our server was nice, I would probably not return.

Came here for happy hour, and got deceived. The bartender told us all drinks were 1/2 off, and with that decided to buy a couple drinks. When the bill came, each drink was around $9 each! Not happy hour price, it just so happened that only a "select" few drinks are considered happy hour, Long Islands being one of them. Another thing is, there are seating booths on the left side of the happy hour section when you enter. We sat there and ordered happy hour appetizers, and when the waiter came he said that if we sit in the booths we don't get happy hour deals. So basically if we moved 2 feet and sat at the bar area and ordered food, we can get the happy hour appetizers but not if we sit in the booths.  Sort of uh ridiculous ?  I don't know if I would ever come back here, but if I do I sure know where I'll sit and what to order next time.

Service was really slow in the beginning but definitely picked up after a bit. Jesse was really friendly, and more importantly, patient with us. Very enthusiastic and fun to talk to. Probably the highlight of our visit there Everything on their menu seemed so irresistible, but we settled for 2 person $20 special since it was such a great deal. You get a select few appetizers to choose from along with their list of entrees, which isn't half bad. Not to mention your choice of dessert at the end. The prime steak pasta was ok and the steak was actually really tender. Not chewy at all. I had my first red velvet cake here and it was delicious :-) They're open late so its a great place to grab a bite after a night of shopping at the nearby 24-hour Walmart.

Food is ok, service is ok. Place gets packed during happy hour and weekends. It can get loud and noisy. But their brownie obsession is divine! It's warm and topped with chocolate fudge and ice cream,. Delish.

I have to say that I really like the bartenders but the service you get when seated is less than par. We ordered some drinks at the bar and some appitizers while we waited almost 45 minutes for a table on a relatively slow day. We wanted a table around the bar area but was seated right by the bathroom and it took 1 hour for some buffalo wings which came out wrong the first time and we had to wait another 20 minutes for the right ones to come.  If you sit at the things come out better and faster...

I ate at this place one time, and it was enough for me to never go back. The wait time is insane. Once seated, it took forever just to get a waiter to take our drink orders. By the time he came around for the drink orders, we were ready to order our appetizers and dinner. The appetizer came out super late.. late enough that they brought it with dinner! No drink refills. Never came to check on us. The food wasnt that great. Seriously... come on. I am a huge believer in giving tips where tips are due. You sir, do not get a tip. And i will never again come to TGI's... and not just this particular part of the chain. TGI's is ruined for me. Sorry.

TGI Friday!!! Thank God its Friday and Im not in there.. :) This place looks good from outside and pretty good from inside. Sat close to the bar so was close to the tv..  The service was very bad. I waited for like 10 mins for someone to get me the menu and me being a nice guy got up and went to the front desk and ask for the menu.  I wasnt so hungry my other friend wanted to eat so we ordered the "Jack Championship Slider Sampler" and "Buffalo Wings", with Buffalo Wings asked for the wild kind (which is supposed to be spicy/hot). The Burger was ok, meaning lacked in flavor but had meat in it and was small and cute. But the wings was not at all spicy I asked for hot sauce, the waiter brought me a small Tabasco sauce with the bottle almost empty.  I was disappointed with service, but would rate the food with little less average.

Ordered 60 bucks worth of food to go and let me tell yah.. It was pretty shitty.. No condiments or sauces for our appetizers.. Salads where awful.. How do u mess up a salad tho? Never will I order to go again !!

Happy hour - all day on Sundays! Drink specials -  $5 margaritas (no salt on the rim even though we asked for it) $4 well drinks  $3 - $4 beers In my opinion, their drinks were not strong enough. Too much of a heavy hand with the mixers.  Appetizers -  Green bean fries were fried nicely. Tasty! Buffalo wings were undercooked and pretty soggy because they doused it in sauce. Blah Service - Mediocre.

Hollywood. Promises you all the glitz and glam, then throws you out as a one hit wonder, not much richer than you were when you first got there. That's how I felt after I came here for their "happy hour."  They're happy hour is, in essence, advertised as being 7 days a week, times just vary on the weekends (understandable). But when looking to see what items apply "ask your server" probably isn't the best idea when our server directs us to the menu, which keeps directing us to our server. It's a vicious cycle. I  felt like I needed a college course in Fridays happy hour. Finally we were told it was beers, well drinks, and ultimates as well as a few appetizers. It also specifically said that sliders were 1.50 Anyways, the bill comes and two beers, two ultimates, sliders, a JD sampler, and nachos come to $52. Sliders were $4? FAIL.  Our server took awhile to warm up to us, maybe he was upset because they changed the tv to the Laker/Cavs game.. but after awhile he was nice and deserved his tip :) Thanks for changing our small nachos to an actual nachos grande!

I typically don't prefer reviewing chain restaurants too much, but this place has become such a regular spot for me since my high school years, it's hard to ignore. Though it's not my favorite joint for a gourmet dinner, it's become a "default" restaurant when my friends and I don't want to go out of our way for a meal and just need a quick fix.  Lately, it seems like their menu is constantly changing, but I like the new dishes and the "right portions, right price" section. I hate, and I mean absolutely HATE, wasting food or having leftovers to take home. It just doesn't taste the same after being nuked and half the time, I don't even bother eating my leftovers because I tend to forget about it. That leads to perfectly good food being tossed away, which makes my heart break a little every time.....ANYWHOO, smaller dishes for a cheaper price = thumbs up in my book! My favorite dishes are chicken tenders, sizzling chicken & shrimp (the cheese is delish!), and the stuffed potato skins. What really wins me over are the mashed potatoes. I don't know what they do, but I can never get enough of their mashed potatoes. Mango mojitos here are excellent as well as the AMFs - knocked me out during one of my birthday celebrations. The bartenders are well trained. Happy hour is cool: Mon-Fri 4-7pm, all day Sun. Plenty of booths by the bar and even an outdoor patio to enjoy cheap drinks and cheap appetizers. Half off appetizers (except for the sampler and Jack Daniel's tower), buck-fiddy sliders & fries, and $3 beers. My new discovery tonight: Ladies' Nights on Tuesdays...and there's usually a dress up theme. Too cute.

Last time I went to a TGIF's a few years ago, it seemed like it had turned into an overpriced Denny's, with bland institutional quality food, so I stopped going.   But last Saturday night, the date and I found ourselves in the East Bay feeling hungry for a late dinner.  Where to go? We wanted something a little more substantial than the fast food places that litter 880, and it seemed all the restaurants around Union Landing were closed.  Reluctantly, we settled on the TGI Fridays. It was past midnight, but the place was bustling and still serving a full menu.  I had the petite sirloin with sweet potato fries and broccoli.  The steak had that delicious "just off the charcoal grill" flavor, and the sides were surprisingly fresh and tasty.   A plate of onion rings were done just right- crunchy and juicy.   It all hit the spot.  A good satisfying meal, friendly service, a festive atmosphere (ok, a bit noisy, but it was Saturday night), for around $30 for two.   This place is definitely now on my short list of places to go for a late dinner

Been to TGIF several times for lunch and dinner with friends and families.    This place use to be so much better in terms of customer service and food quality.  Well overtime management changes, and so do the staff but that didn't stop me from coming back.  It's close to home, and what more would I want than to have dinner and go watch a movie at the theater which is at a walking distance.  The Jack Daniels chicken strips, french fries with cheese, sizzling chicken and shrimp are my favorite at this place.  They do have meal coupons and happy hour  so if you ever stop by you should check out the happy hour menu as well.  They have a bar area on the right side as you enter.  It has open seating with little outdoor patio.  I hardly see people seated outside as the weather can be unpleasant.  If you want a quiet and romantic dinner, you should find some place else, It can get a little noisy at this place.  They have TV monitors and  during the games people come to have drinks and watch TV at the bar.   Note:  They are open late on Friday's and Saturdays.

I will never go to the Friday's in Union City again!  The service is consistently horrible.  The waiters/waitresses are rude and so sloooowww.   Tonight was the final straw:   Waiting 15 minutes to just be greeted by the waiter/waitress - strike one.  Waiting 30 minutes to get the food (we ordered 3 appetizers) when the restaurant is empty - strike two.  Trying to get the waiter's attention after he walks by 4 times!?! - strike three.   The last 4 times I have gone to the restaurant I left unhappy.  I'm not wasting money here anymore!

Friends have told us TGI Friday's is not a place to order meals, they were right - we found out the hard way.  My meal tasted like it was not prepared fresh, but just warmed up from who knows when.   I had the fish and chips ... the fries were soft and wiggly, and the batter-fried fish was not crunchy.  My friend had the garlic chicken primavera which he said was good although the chicken portion was a little small.  He asked for "no zucchini" in his order and was told "there's no zucchini in the house" ... so...guess what?  his plate arrived with sliced zucchini mixed throughout his plate, so he spent all his time picking them out.  I love zucchini so I ate them, but that's not the point.  When you ask for something to not be on your plate, they ought to honor that.  Suppose you're allergic to it or something. The Margaritas were good, I started off with their new Ultimate Pomegranite Margarita which was not very tasty.  My second Margarita was a strawberry one which was delicious and  I should have gotten that in the first place.   The best part of the evening were the drinks and appetizers ... we had the "green bean fries" and the Parmesan Quesadillas - very good  - but the overall experience just leaves me with just 2 stars.

Once upon a time I worked at TGIFriday's (not this one).  While I worked there, I met a group of lovely siblings that would remain my friends for several years after we had all, long since abandoned the fairly horrible service jobs we once held together.  A good 10 years after first meeting, I would then fall in love with one of these siblings and buy a house and several animals with him.  Because he's a bit of a romantic, he surprised me with a date here last night.  We relieved our late teens/early 20s (yes, I'm robbing the cradle) and had Jack Daniel's sesame chicken strips (YUM), French Onion soup (good, but maybe not worth the hype I had given it - certainly not with the bit of plastic I found in mine), entrees, drinks, AND brownie obsession for dessert.  As others have said, it is what it is, and the great thing about a chain is knowing exactly what you'll get no matter where you are.  Service was fine, clientele was as expected, but I was a bit bummed that I couldn't see the rest of the restaurant from where we were seated. While not everything was the same as I remembered, and this particular location doesn't have that same Friday's feel (no levels, and a few too many windows), it was a fantastic, nostalgic night with one of my favorite ex-Friday's workers. It seems strange that I'd have TGIFriday's to thank for my amazing life, but it appears I do; so thanks for that Friday's.
One * for the Mozzerella sticks - Perfection. One * for the Grande nachos - for making starved me happy. C'mon where were the other veggie options?

Whenever one of my girls is in desperate need of a drink.. Our automatic response is.. "meet you @ Fridays"  In the midst of all the other chain restaurants littered throughout Union Landing.. this place has become our SPOT. There was a point in time where we went to Fridays pretty much every week... yenno.. before this crappy economic downfall. We don't come here as often anymore... but when we do, we never fail to have a good time.  There are always people there in the bar.. its always busy.. The servers are always super friendly, and the bartenders are nice and quick. Only once in a while do we have to wait a little longer time than we're used to... but it happens. Even when we're sitting down in the actual restaurant during Happy Hour, our waiter informs us Happy Hour prices are only at the bar, so he allows us to get up and order at the bar, and come back and order food. I mean who does that? AWESOME. The drinks are good here, although they do change their menu a little too often, and I then I can't find my favorite new drink.. I'm sure they'll make it if we ask.. but then that gives me a reason to try something new!  The food is pretty good too.. Nothing EXTRAORDINARY. But pretty good. I just had their Cajun pasta the other day, DELICIOUS. The fettucini with the salmon and zuchinni is SUPERB. .. I also consider myself a "clam chowder snob"... I am very picky about my chowder.. But Fridays' chowder tops my list of favorite chowders @ restaurants.. Just the right about of saltiness and clamminess. YUMMMMO.  Can't go wrong at Fridays!

Hello. So here it goes.  Me and my cousin had a long days work and decided to go out to this TGIF and watch the NBA finals while having a few beers. After the game was finished we went out to the patio area to have a cigarette. Having come here for years for the food and drinks and not having a problem with smoking in the outside patio area, tonight we learned of the poor management of this business.  The two of us stepped outside for just a little over one minute, lit up our cigarettes and within seconds we noticed a guy dressed in jeans and an oversized black jacket addressing two other guys to exit the patio using the emergency exit because they were smoking in the patio area. Immideatly after, he rushed towered me and my cousin and said "you guys are going have to put that out, there's no smoking." Respecting his request (and assuming he was security even though he was dressed like any other joy in the streets) we put out our cigarettes on the ground and headed inside the restaurant where we had our personal belongings such as our jackets, cell phones, car keys, and the food and drinks that we hadn't even touched. Before we could reach for the door handle, Jermey Codwell (the name of the unprofessional security guard), demanded that we pick up the cigarette butt and throw it away outside the patio. Now this is were the situation gets complicated. As soon as I reached to picked my cigarette butt, this guy starts pushing me and my cousin while saying that we are being kicked out and that we are trespassing by being on the premisis.  Had we gotten a warning first in a professional manner I would not be wasting my time addressing this issue. I have been enjoying the service and hospitality of this business for years, but the caliber of disrespect I exprienced tonight will not be forgotten and swept under the rug.  I will do everything in my ability to get security guard Jermey Codwell FIRED! The time of this incident was a few minutes before 10PM, 07-03-2011 After being kicked out the patio area, the same security guard would not let us in to get our belonging from the table where we were sitting at, on top of that threading us that he was calling the police because we were trespassing. We then luckily came about a second security guard who escorted one of us to get our stuff. Immidetly after stepping outside, I got the establishments phone number, called it and asked for the manager who simply went by the name of "Trisha" (which I think is also unprofessional). Trisha came out and asked what was the problem. The two of us filled her in of the situation. After that the guard was given a moment to speak, who claimed he didn't lay a hand on either one of us. Trisha the manager chose to believe her security guard and turned her back towered us without an apology or even some sympathy that we were long time customers who were highly disrespected.  All in all, if I don't get this uneducated power crazed security guard Jermey, and the evening manager who doesn't care about the customer satisfaction of the business she is running FIRED, then please do interact with these individuals and see for yourself if they are well deserving of their positions at this establishment.  thank you
Great customer service.  Bartender puts on a juggling show to enjoy.  Food is great. Clean environment.

This is a review for Happy Hour only. A few girl friends and I came here on a Tuesday, which is apparently Ladies' Night. Their Cosmos are $3 and strong! Their margaritas are $4. I recommend the Strawberry and not the Pomegranate (tasted nasty). The people there are super friendly and helpful. We ordered 2 orders of the Fried Greenbeans (good but probably only should have had 1), Quesadilla (not awesome), and Nachos (Chevy's is better).  The drinks are good, the food is ok. I wish they had like chips or something else to munch on.  I felt really fatty leaving the place. So maybe I shouldn't come here that often.

My friend said that the clam chowder does not compare wt san francisco. She didnt get her crackers wt the clam chowder... Whats up wt that! the buffalo wings were okay.. the spicy thai flavor.. which was almost to the end of the spectrum of "HOT" in their chart was not even close to mild hot. The bathrooms suck.. It smells and only one out of the three bathrooms were working. Overall the food is great but service is very unorganized and crappy.

It's always a dilemma when I come here. I never know what to order.  There isn't one item I really crave, besides maybe the green bean fries.  I honestly don't know why I come here sometimes, but yet i keep coming back. It's like a black hole, I keep getting sucked back in.   Maybe it's the drinks that keep me coming back, although lately, they've sucked and are a bit overpriced.  I only recommend coming to this place during happy hour when the appetizers are half-price.   I'm done with TGIF......  until i get sucked backed in again

Not a bad place to go to with a group of friends. Sometimes it's hard to find parking, especially at nights on the weekends.  They have happy hour prices on appetizers & drinks all day on Sundays though!

TGI Fridays is great!  I took my honey here for his birthday and we had a great time. Our waitress was super nice. We ate pasta and we had a great seat by the TV just in case he wanted to glance at the football game that was on. We ate, had drinks, and then our waitress and the other employees came and sang happy birthday to him and gave him ice cream.  Afterwards, I gave him his gift (which was some new Nike's) and he unwrapped them at the table. It was such a great birthday for him! we had a great time here!!

The food here is a mash of good and not so good. White chili? Gooood. Fried green beans? Goooood (when you eat a few, not too many). Chocolate peanut butter pie? Gooood. And then there is the cheeseburger, which was more like an overwhelming taste of dry beef rather than the juicy, tasty, to-die-for cheeseburger it should've and could've been. Service though I tend to differ with the other reviewers. Our waitress was fantastic. She was sweet, prompt, and she even returned to apologize when she asked us to order our desserts a second time. If anything the service was probably the best part of our meal, because I sure as hell am not enjoying the fat and calories that I just added to my daily intake.  Going for the food? Don't. Going for the ambience? Sure thing.

This restaurant is okay. There isn't anything special about it. I came here today because I was indecisive of what I wanted to eat, so based on a last minute decision I chose this place. My boyfriend and I came in after lunch but it was not quite happy hour yet. Upon arrival, there was no one to greet us. After about 5 minutes, it looked like a manager who came to seat us. The restaurant was REALLY dead and our server greeted us promptly. I ordered the California Club my  boyfriend ordered the Jack Daniel Burger. Our food came out pretty quickly since there was barely anyone in the restaurant. Our server was very attentive and was happy to get us whatever we needed. We were satisfied with the service. Their menu for happy hour doesn't look too bad, so maybe I will be back soon!

Pretty bad here. Friday's is not first class, but the Friday's in vacaville is a lot better, cleaner and with better tasting food and drink.  This place needs a bit of elbow grease and a new staff. Or at least a few more waitresses. And you really get the feeling here that all the food is bought at costco frozen section and quickly heated up. Even the jd chicken was not as good as v-town.  I never eat dinner here, but go for a drink or two. but sheesh.

Disgusting. Sickening food. I came here last night with my man and this is what I got: -Poor presentation. My 5 Cheese Gourmet Mac n Cheese w/ Grilled Chicken looked like someone smeared cheese sauce and fingerprints all over my plate. Literally, the it looked like someone vomitted all over my food. -The grilled chicken was tiny and overcooked. -The food is always inconsistent. I also ordered the Honey Pecan Salmon which was smoked on a cedar plank. Sounds delicious, right? The salmon was good. However, the side of broccoli was dry with brownish yellow edges. This is an indication that the broccoli was nuked dry in the microwave. Little or no effort was put into my entrees. The "Right Portions" menu should be called "Still Hungry Portions"  or "Snack Portions." Even a child size dish is more generous. In regards to the Food Network Ultimate Recipe Showdown menu: -There is one positive: Try the yummy 5 Cheese Gourmet Mac n Cheese. Just don't expect an appetizing presentation. But whatever you order.... -DO NOT order the Pumpkin Cupcakes. They were old, crumbly and dry. The cream cheese frosting tasted like they sat uncovered in the refrigerator for a week. It had the aroma of the refrigerator and no cream cheese flavor whatsoever!! Maybe this is because the refrigerator odors which the frosting picked up overpowered the cream cheese. Yuck. Order this at your own risk. In fact, order food at TGIF's at your own risk. The cooks do a half-ass job. No surprise. If it wasn't for the Buy One Entree Get One Entree free coupon (from  ), I would have been extremely pissed. In retrospect, what should I expect? Afterall, TGIF's is a chain restaurant. You're better off investing your time and money at another chain, Texas Roadhouse where the food is consistent and delicious. mmm....Texas Roadhouse    :o)

We're not regulars here, but the times we've eaten at this TGI Fridays were during the afternoon (before 4pm), and we've been pleased each time. While the mixed drinks don't need so much ice (which ones do?), everything else was solid. Hot food was hot, cold food was cold, and all of it was tasty. The servers/bussers were pleasant - even if they weren't working your table - and the hosts/hostesses were on the ball.

So,  I was here for my friends birthday and just hoping to get a good meal because I was starving especially since I just got off work and didnt eat anything.First i want to say is that the service was decent, no complaints here, the servers were polite and took down my order quickly. Other than that the vibe is good, not too loud and not too quiet. The only problem, that I can say is the prices for the food did not match what they gave me. Its like they were stingy on the food or something because I ordered a burger and I thought it would be at least decent size because it was bit on the pricey side. The burger was pretty small compared to the picture and they gave me like a size small fries that looked like it was from Mc Donalds. Honestly, I would have gone to applebees because at least there portions are decent size, enough to actually get me full. I only gave it that extra star because of the service and the setting, other than that the food, is not worth spending money over.

Dear Yelp Journal, After completing a 10K race in Santa Cruz in the morning, for lunch I traveled to the East Bay to visit my cousin, and we opted to go here for lunch. I was pleasantly surprised to see that each food had its caloric value in parentheses next to its title. I chose the Dragonfire Chicken -Under 500 calories!  I must comment the meal's picture and the actual food were spot on. I enjoyed the meal presentation and the quality and quantity on the plate was filling and flavorful. I was not left feeling hungry or under-satisfied . The chicken was grilled and moist throughout, and the pineapple pico de gallo was a sweet addition to the dish. The rice was light and fluffy and complimented the complete dish. The service was good, however, the lighting in the restaurant kept flickering on and off, and seemed too dim for my dining tastes. Overall, I enjoyed the meal itself.

I was a bit disappointed of the atmosphere of the place, it is kind of old and needs to be upgraded. We missed the happy hour by 10 minutes which was unfortunate.  I saw the advertisement for the berry flavored Guiness but when I tasted it, it did not taste anything like berry.  Fortunately my waitress let me cancel and order something else.  I got the 2 for $10 deal with mozoreellla sticks and pulled pork sandwhich.  the sticks were good and filing. The pulled pork sandwhich ended up being a burger which was disappointng.
When here with some coworker to get some drinks during happy hour. It was so hard to find a table inside. We decided to sit out and it was freaking. Just after one drink we decided to just go home.

Went there on April 23,2012.  My son and I sat at a table in  the bar area.  It took 20 minuets for a server to come and another 20 min to get the drinks.  When she dropped off the drink, I ordered another since it would take another 20 min. to get it.  I ordered a steak and mashed potato's.  After the first bite I could taste rotten meat and immediately sent it back.  The waitress was very cavalier.  I asked to speak to the manager and she said he was unavailable.  They took it off the bill and I paid for the only drink that was served and we left.  I would not recommend this place to anyone who doesn't want rotten meat.  Service was very poor and a "don't care" attitude. Shocking and disappointed!

Menus a dirty sticky mess.  Dirty napkins on the floor under our table along with a rib bone. They were busy so we knew that it would be a wait, no problem.  Food arrived... slighty warm soup, undercooked lobster, the very small potion of ribs were good, the fries and slaw boring.  Went home washed my hands and ate something.  :-P

We went here last night. I ordered the jack Daniels mixed grill (steak an half slab ribs) I asked for another half slab since I knew my guy would want some too. He ordered a chicken cease salad an a french dip. I should have known when the server brought his soda out wrong that the dining experience was going to suck... He ordered a sprite no ice... got ice.. taken care of right away... my drink took over 20 mins... fast forward to getting our food... my order came out full slab of ribs no steak. When I question it I'm told that I can't add a half slab to my order so the server just put in a full slab without the steak.. I am soo upset I just wanted to leave. I told them to box up my food. They add on the steak. Told them to box that up too. The person who delivered our food was insistant that they dont offer what i ordered... server comes by and says no reason to be upset my order is being cooked..My guy never got his french dip. Got the bill and it wasn't even on there. He asked for the manager. Manager came and listened. Said that our server was a trainee. If he's a trainee why wasn't he following a more experienced server? Long story short. Manager comped what I ordered and the French dip and a drink. Which is why they get one star. I doubt I will ever go back...

-1:ghetto people (i know its not their fault), but atelast get security to calm the rowdy people down -1:dirty tables, bar, and bathroom -1: bartenders are either unknowledgeable, slow as hell, and arent very friendly. (not all of them) the asian guy  is really nice, fast, and helpful. everyone else just doesnt seem happy to work there.  -1: service was horrible. we waited 30 minutes to have someone approach us, 30 minutes to get our drinks (they got my friends, but forgot mine.. and it was still on the bill), and another 30 to get a jack daniels burger.

Happy hour is awesome and that's about it.  Ordered two margaritas last Friday night and knocked out like Ricky Hatton. For five bucks a pop  and gas prices rising, this is a steal. The cheese burger sliders weren't good. Better off buying white castles from Target and serving them here. My mac and cheese with grilled chicken that won the ultimate recipe showdown was a disgrace. How the heck did that get on the menu?   On a sweeter note, I liked my sweet potato fries. They were crispy, little bit sweet--just right.  For dessert, we debated on whether or not to get red velvet cake a la mode. We went back and forth and finally decided to order it here. Tasted ok, seemed like it was old, it wasn't moist. The waiter came up to us and stated that this was his favorite dessert. I laughed and thought to myself this is the worst red velvet I ever had.  Next time I'm just coming for drinks and the game.

After a traumatic experience at TGIFridays in pleasanton, I vowed to never eat here again, but low and behold, as the facebook-woody-free burger promotion came into play, I was back on the horse. And good thing because the food was deeelicious! As the promotion goes, you add Woody on facebook and if enough people add him then everyone gets a coupon for a free burger.  I'm not really much of a burger person, but free is free. We got there and I half expected the waitress to roll her eyes and avoid us for most of the meal, but she was attentive and friendly the entire time. We also ordered a cup of soup and a soda and a beer. The clam chowder was amazing. It was one of the best I've had to be honest. The burger was nothing short of spectacular, it was savory and yummy and so much better than I had ever dreamed it could be.  If it had not been for this burger, then I never would have come here, and now I'm hooked. I will probably be here again and again.  My only complaint bringing it from 5 stars to 4 stars is the family at the table next to us, The had a child with a portable dvd player and we could clearly hear the dvd playing. This stupid mom and dad think they are in their own living room! It was so obnoxious. Other than that it was awesome. I only wish we'd saved room for dessert.

I have been to TGI Friday's several times and have enjoyed it very much. It is similar to Chili's (a little on the higher end though), Texas Roadhouse, and Tony Romas as far as food, service, and affordability.  Last night was an anomaly as we waiting 1.5 hours from the time we ordered, to the time we received our meals. Although the waitress was honest about her mistake (she had apparently forgotten to put in the main order after the initial appetizer and drink order was processed), we continued to wait nearly 25 minutes. Not 5 minutes after telling the manager to forget the food and to just give me a bill for the drinks and appetizers, we received our food.  I was impressed that as soon as the food was delivered, the manager came over and comped us for everything but the drinks. I wished I had gotten his name as I would have called the TGI Fridays corporate office to tell them that this is how business should operate. Mistakes will be made - but you can make up for them if you are honest and are willing to take the hit for the long-term gain. Because of this managers and waitresses honesty and free meal, I definitely will be back.  TGI Friday is a decent operation overall and the food is on par with the mid-end restaurants in the UC Mall area.

This review is strictly on some of their food, service, and on TUESDAY's LADIES NIGHT HH. First of all, I did not know that Tuesdays were Happy Hour all night for the ladies... on top of their regular happy hour times. Most of the appetizers are $6 and their "ultimate" drinks are $5 - I tend to get margaritas and mojitos... both relatively good and worth the amount. Food - if you order a sandwich or burger and like your side to be hefty... do not get the side salad, it's pretty tiny and not worth it. The California sandwich itself was pretty good, but would have preferred more turkey over the amount of ham that was in it. The Jack Daniels chicken appetizer is pretty good too for an app. I've also had the sizzling chicken and cheese entree which is really good! - I'm also a big cheese fan so I can't complain when something savory has cheese on it. It comes with 2 chicken breasts with some mixed in grilled bell peppers and onions plus 2 scoops of mashed potatoes. I managed to finish half of the entree.  Service - the service is inconsistent, but it's almost as if the service in the bar area is MUCH BETTER than if you're sitting in the regular dining area. The servers and bartenders are just more personable so it's easier to get what you want from them. When we eat in the regular dining area, the server messed up our order, triple charged us for our food, and did NOT attempt to apologize for it. One time, my friend ordered a chicken entree and she mistook it for a chicken and shrimp entree.. we brought it to her attention in a very chill manner and she told my friend to "scoop off the shrimp onto the side dish plate" and that she would bring out the chicken on another side dish plate - WTH?! That was extremely unprofessional and, not to mention, TACKY. I mean, I know this isn't a fancy restaurant, but sheesh. This is completely different in the bar area - we are always checked on, asked if we need anything else, etc. - and, no, this has nothing to do with drinks consumed.  My advice - sit at the bar!

Seriously had terrible service here last night. A friend and I came here last night to watch game 1 of the world series (go giants!!) So we sat at the bar where most of the tvs were. We sat there for about 15 minutes and still not 1 person had said anything to us. I finally asked someone if we could order and they didn't help us for another 10 minutes. When we finally ordered our drinks I wasn't pleased at all. I ordered a blended strawberry margarita with sugar instead of salt it seriously tasted like not 1 drop of alcohol was in there. My second one was the same. After being here for about 3 hours I talked to 2 different servers. Seems like this always happens when I come here.

I would go 3.5 , maybe 4  stars because the happy hour kicks ass. $3  for a 20 ounch beer on tap, with a great selection, $3  glass of wine and half off apps..The only reason that this place gets a lower rating from others is beacuse  it attracts a bad clientele after 6...But if you get in and get out for the happy hour, you wont be disappointed..Great value..Best happy hour in the east bay

When a friend says, "Lets go to TGI Friday's"... just say no. I've never had a meal here, that was even close to being good. Horrible service, super slow, getting my orders wrong, bringing me cold food, and all around being a lousy. The food? I've eaten with friends in the past, and got to the point where I refuse to eat here. When it is suggested, I literally refuse to go. I tell my friends to call me later, because I don't want to waste my money on a horrible dining experience. I COULD go along just to hang out, but then I'd be wasting my TIME, and as we all know, time IS money. I even had a friend who was a manager here, and with discounts and free drinks and food, I still refuse to eat here. Steer clear of this establishment at all costs, especially with so many other places to eat at so nearby.

I used to come here ALL the time.  That is until they decided to turn this one into a bar instead of a restaurant.  Yeah who wants to take their kids out to dinner with a ghetto bar inside the restaurant?  Not me.  Hopefully their bar makes them more business then when it used to be a kid friendly restaurant.

With all the restaurants in the Union Landing mall, you'd think the competition would make restaurants step up.  Not so, apparently. I ordered two meals "to go" (chicken picata pasta).  The person taking the phone order seemed to have better things to do -- and had to ask more than once what I wanted.  She repeated it back, finally, --and hung up.  No reference (like name or phone number), no estimate of when the order would be ready -- just hung up! I immediately got in my car and went to pick up the order.  After being asked to wait when I told her I had called in my order (and she asked what I had ordered), the young woman came back after a while and told me they didn't have it.  Apparently, it was a "new item" on the menu (I had looked at the menu on-line) and they didn't "stock" yet. Come on, people.  First of all, Friday's needs to get their act together.  Second of all, Friday's needs to make sure their people are trained so they know what's on the menu and what's not.  I should have been told on the phone that they didn't have that dish.  But probably MOST important, their people should be trained to act a little more professionally.  Hanging up on customers without so much as a good-bye isn't very hospitable at all -- isn't that what the restaurant business is about? Final result:  I said, "Never mind..." and went and ordered take-out from Applebee's.  At least the server there was pleasant and seemed to know what I was talking about when I ordered!

From the moment we walked in til' the moment we left, it was completely and utterly AWFUL. The wait was forever but that didn't bother me as much as the space in the restaurant.
