The waiting area is honestly the size of my hand! There was no room to sit or stand. Everyone was everywhere. The hostess was in the worse location, we could barely even find them. FINALLY after waiting for forever. They finally sat us down. We sat in a booth next to the bar. This booth was located in front of the door. So the whole time we were experience the wind blowing in our direction. It was a really cold night too might I mention.  Trying to disregard this awful seating and wind, we looked over the menu. Now, I've been to TGI fridays a few times. I've never been satisfied but this time was the worse. The menu LOOKS like it has tasty entrees to offer all at a great price ($7-13). YEAH RIGHT. I ordered the Chicken Parmesan over penne pasta. It was pretty awful. I got like 20 pieces of penne pasta (no lie) and over fried greasy chicken. DISGUSTING. The other entrees my friends got were pepper crusted porkchop or something with mash potatoes and onion rings. They got ONE porkchop, two small scoops of mash potatoes (it tasted like the ones from the powder mix), and 3 onion rings. YES, THREE PIECES.  Our server was OKAY. She was nice but didn't refill my water at all. Not even once. She was quite slow. The only thing that was good was the AMF. Adios TGI Fridays.  NEVER coming back. NEVER. So, overall..the service was whack, the food portions were small and the quality was nasty. OH YEAH, and the music selection was TERRIBLE. Better off listening to the radio.  ..I rather eat McDonalds then eat here.

The great thing about chain restaurants is that they provide consistency.  You know you will be able to get some appetizers, and fun drinks and catch up with an old friend.  And maybe get hit on by an old man.....Wait....that doesn't happen to everybody?  Oh well, back to the main review. Since the food here was no surprise, the review is for the service mainly.  We had crap-tastic service.  It was hit or miss. At one point we waited about 15 minutes for a drink......That's just not ok.  When the check came we didn't initially realize they had overcharged us for a drink.  After they ran a credit card we realized it, and refused to sign the slip until they adjusted it.  Welllllllll, eventually they came back to the table and said they weren't able to void it, they had to give us a cash refund.  That seems like BS to me.  And they made no effort to make any accommodations for the overcharge.  This is NOT good customer service.
This place use to be pretty good but the last couple of times we've gone it wasn't that great.

Went to happy hour on a Friday in the bar and the server with the head wrap was our server. We ordered a margarita each. An hour later, she came by asking for more drinks. Are you kidding me? She came to our table 2 times within 2 hours. Terrible service, I'll stick to chilis from now on.

Only reason I still even go to this friday's is because my parents house is in walking distance, and if friends want to meet up its close. The food seriously has gone down hill since it opened... but the BOOZE is just fine :)

Today I decided to torture myself by dining at TGI Friday's.  Actually, I had to kill time while my car was being serviced at Pep Boy's.  Why oh why did I not choose Chilli's where I could order a yummy black bean cheeseburger?  I guess I wanted to try something new; well, something that I have not visited since the 1990's.  It's amazing how we think a restaurant or food is so delicious when we are kids and later discover the reality of the situation.  That sums up TGIF's in a nutshell. Due to the scant vegetarian options on the menu, I ordered potato skins and a basket of garlic breadsticks.  I guess they removed veggie burgers from the menu several years ago because vegetarians only like salads, or so they believe.  Anyway, the kitchen still managed to mess up my order and scattered bacon bits throughout.  Sigh, they had to redo my order, so I munched on some generic breadsticks dipped in ranch.  Olive Garden offers better garlic breadsticks for FREE.  Anyway, the potato skins eventually arrive and taste horrible.  Even though the menu describes the skins as "cheezy", there is barely any cheese on top.  What a generic and plastic-tasting meal.  The prices are also pretty expensive for chain standards even though their food is on par with Denny's. For dessert, I ordered a peanut butter pie, which honestly tasted good.  However, it was so small and not worth the $5.79 price tag.  It seemed half the size of a Cheesecake Factory slice.  Meanwhile, the utensils seemed dirty.  If I could rate this place with zero stars, I would.  However, I will grant the server one star because we was nice and helpful.  I cannot blame him for the poor quality of food.

Nice remodeled bar area. Service was good, could have been better. They have a pretty good happy hour (i'd plan my trip around that 3-7pm). There's something missing from TGIF's food, i cant put my finger on it but its lacking something...
I love the food and the prices are fair! Customer service was good!

we usually eat here twice a week! we are almost always greeted by lala...shes the best waitress in the bay area! she knows what we want and has our drinks in her hands as she seats us. ;) love her!   today? it was past 2pm and she was already leaving as we stood waiting at the door for 10minutes to be seated..mind you...its the middle of the week...215pm...there were only 6 other customers in the regular eating area. the floor was sticky and yes! i slipped on the crap left by the 4 extremely lazy employees! they were so busy chatting with each other, in the back pretending to be doing something...certainly werent getting our food and another one was actually using the business phone for a personal call! good grief! waitress only came to check back with us twice! horrible service! worst in bay area! im shocked that mario would let this happen since he is usually somewhere in the area. will never visit tgif after 2pm again! never! ever! i may also add...most of the employees were new!

TGI Friday's is usually on the bottom of my list of chain restaurants. Food is always just mediocre and is certainly not worth it's price.  With that said, the Union City location makes me dislike the restaurant even more.  Service and atmosphere is always lacking, borderline of ghetto. It gets way crowded and it's definitely a place where you'll run into people if you're a local. I'll ususally try to avoid the place by all means, but when I do come here, it's for the drinks during happy hour. Pros: - Cheap Happy Hour drinks and food - Patio seating Cons: - Way crowded - Hard to find parking sometimes Recommendations: - Come if you like happy hour drinks, and loud music banging.

The food isnt bad at all. The service is horrible evrytime that I go there. Went for happy hour with my friends and some co workers the appetizers and drinks were good only thing that kept me from giving them a higher score was the service the waitress were not attentive and were just chatting among themselves not paying that much attention to customers i had to waive my hand multiple times to get there attention and also to pay lol someone didnt get a good tip thats all i have to say.

I went to lunch here a few days ago and all I can say is meh... The food we ordered was ok. I liked the food better at the TGIF I went to in Campbell...more lively and open crowd when I went. The place was just lame and quiet. My cheeseburger was WAY too salty. gross. and the cups...i never bug about plastic cups but theirs were gross.

My wife saw an add on TV for an offer of a 2 for 20 dinner, what a run around we got, the hostess seated us and brought us menus, our server came and we told him we'd like the 2 for 20 menus , he brought some funky looking cards that we're small and nowhere near what my wife saw in the T V commercial, when asked about it he said that they were printed on some sort of paper, I told him that the whole thing was a scam just to get us in the door, we left.... Got here a little before 6 pm on a Sunday night. I was driving home to Sac when I got hungry all of a sudden and remember those TGIF commercials. Luckily there was one nearby.  It looked like there was a wait, but we walked in and waited to be seated for about 30 seconds when the manager comes to the front and asks us if we had been helped. I said no and we got seated right away. I asked about happy hour and he said Sunday is happy hour specials all day long! Half off all appetizers except platters and seafood. If I wasn't headed back home I definitely would have ordered a drink. We ordered a basket of fries for $1.50, a bowl of clam chowder, garlic parmesan wings, chicken quesadilla, and nacho grande. Came out to $23! Great deal for tons of food. Our server was friendly and fast. It was really busy, but he kept checking in on us. Will be checking out our TGIF in Elk Grove soon. Hope they got the all day happy hour too. Would have given them 5 stars if their wifi signal worked in the restaurant.

We came to TGIF's to relax and have a few drinks before a movie. We literally sat at a table and waited for 20 minutes before we gave up and went to the bar to order our drinks. The bartenders were inattentive, and I had to actually scream out at them to get their attention. Finally, when we did get a servers attention at our table, she was clearly very annoyed with us and was actually kind of rude. When we got our food we did not have silverware and had to actually hunt someone down to get us some. This was perhaps the worst restaraunt experience I have ever had. I will never be going back to this Friday's again.

This was a pretty good dinner for a Friday after a bummer week... Positives: *Call ahead and get on a waiting list *Petite sirloin w/ 5 cheese mac & cheese was pretty darn good *Kid menu items were tasty *Good place to watch *interesting* people *Music Negatives: *Music was really loud *Parking was SWAPED *Our GPS couldn't find it *Their kid menu/color mat doesn't have enough white space on it

I always tell my wife we will never go back to this place because of mediocre food and poor service. I broke my promise and went there tonight--first time in about a year and 10th time in 10 years.  Same dated, boring looking interior with all the crap hanging on the walls. When are they going to update this place? The TV's are circa early 1990's and have blurry pictures. Spring on a dozen big screen LCD's, guys!!  We had to wait for 10 minutes for a table, even though the place was 2/3rds filled at 5p on this Friday. Not enough servers probably. Got seated at our booth, which was very plush and comfy, but the table was very icky sticky.  Strawberry milkshake for the wife was lame. Tasted like powdered strawberry milk. Just sent it back and got a soda instead. Potato skins were good but not enough sour cream. Small sirloin steak was bland and the Mac & Cheese was crap.  Chicken w/strawberries salad was the best part of the meal.  The 40-something waitress was out of it and had the bill wrong and was blaming another worker for it. "I knew he wouldn't take the shake off." Well if you knew that, why didn't you take care of it yourself?  So this place hasn't changed on the bad service and mediocre food.  I swear I won't ever come back here again...until next year I guess.

Location for this place is not that great, but once you gte in, then you feel different and you like it. I would recommend this place if you are having a party and getting together with freinds and family. The guy Andy is preety cool there. I wish they could work on the food a little bit.

Happy Hour at the bar only if you must because of the half-price appetizers ,otherwise this place feels kind of dirty or sticky.  The food is not great, the service was mediocre, I would say don't go here at all but the happy hour deal could prove otherwise.

In the same genre of bland, suburban strip mall fare, TGIFriday's is no better than their competitor (Chili's) at Union Landing. I recently came back because I got a couple of coupons in the mail for buy one entree, get one entree free. Prior to that, I was on a TGIFriday boycott because their food and service sucked so bad. (Seriously, I think the last time I came here was about 2 years ago!)  So I went with two other moms and their strollers and this last time was terrific. We had a server with a kick-ass name - LaLa - who was attentive, genuinely nice, and had great timing. We split the Jack Daniel's appetizer combo, the Jack Daniel's ribs, some chicken melt dish, and the green bean fries. The appetizer combo was actually pretty good. The sauce made everything taste great, though the deep-fried shrimp was a bit cold. The ribs were ok - a bit charred but again, the dipping sauce made it ok. The chicken cheese melt dish seemed to be pretty good, though I only got a couple bites of it. Finally, the green bean fries were their usual consistently good. Time before last was a semi-disaster. Our server was an older woman who basically disappeared between seating us, taking our order, and giving us our food. I felt sorry for the server in the adjacent section because we ended up asking her for everything. I ordered the pulled pork sandwich which was AWFUL. Charred meat and nothing else. The best part was during the bill - we had to ask the other server for it and our server couldn't figure out how to chop it on three credit cards. (WTH??? There's a button that automatically divides it for you!!!) So she ended up jacking our charges but we didn't want her to have to run everything again and screw up once more so we just whipped out our calculator and figured it out ourselves. Awful. Given a choice, I don't think I would choose to come back to TGIFriday's on my own. In the meantime, those coupons save me some money so I guess I'll just settle for some mediocre food and service. *sigh* What has my food life come to???
This place was ok. Would like to give it more but the service was slow and food just average. Best bit of the meal was the Oreo madness.

So I only go here cuz its close and the food is good.  Its usually REALLY crowded. Sometimes they give out coupons which is pretty cool. I like that.  -1 star for expensive drinks -1 star for NEVER asking for my ID. (anyone could buy drinks then, and I JUST turned 21. I dont look THAT old.) the servers are always pretty nice and get you what you need and check up on you alot. there was this one guy who was a D**K but thats another story.  this is a good place for late night deserts. but dont get the brownie obession its TOO small. get the strawberry shortcake. thats the best value.

I hate this TGI chain restaurant, I waited some 20 minutes just standing there at 12am on a Weds night trying to get my grub on because Union City sucks for not having any other late night eatery besides IHOP and Denny's. We tried to get their attention, but stood there looking like dumb@sses, like WTF? They saw us, but ignored us,  Me and Christian B. were like, "fuck this joint". Having five years of experience in the restaurant/customer service business I say fire those @ssholes.

I was never really impressed with this place as a chain.  Out of pure boredom and going to the same restaurants all the time, we went there the other night. I must say I was impressed.  They have changed the menu and have some real yummy things on here.  I am sure it is not all the best for you fried/ Jack Daniels sauces/ creamy mashed potatoes etc.... but it sure is good The service we had the other nite was really good too. Would I go here on a weekly basis?  no  Would I go back again...definitely.

Went here with a friend on a Saturday game night. First off it was happy hour and bartender did not tell me until after I ordered a top shelf margarita :/ which was to sour. There was people behind us SCREAMING at the football game going on very annoying! Bartender was friendly and good service. Got a burger and my friend had spinach dip food was par. They had 4$ long islands for happy hour which was delicious!

booooooooooooooooooooooo. ok i put in my dues and worked at the san bruno store for over a year and after 2 years without any jd glaze in my life i figured it was time. we went in tonight and the first table we sat at was infested with fruit flies. awesome so then we go to the next table and i have no clue who our server is. our food arrives and it meh. i guess im used to the old kitchen guys making master pieces with the fryer. the bill was almost $70 and i think this was the first time since i became a waitress that i didn'tt leave 20%. i doubt we will be back.

Some friends and I went there last Sunday. We didn't have reservations and there was a line for a wait but we were seated rather  quickly.  We started with potato skins and some drinks. I had a strawberry-mango margarita. My goodness the drink was AWESOME!  I ended up ordering a California Veggie Burger, with some avocado to go with it.  One of my friends also ordered a burger but she went for the sweet potato fries (apparently they were not what she expected. It seemed like they had been fried and refried or something.)  Our meal was alright, the music was nice as well though slightly loud. I understand that it's loud so that those waiting outside to be seated can also listen; however, why  not have it slightly lower? It was a big hard to have a conversation because the music was really loud.  IAs for customer service, it could improve. Don't get me wrong now, some of the people that work there were pretty nice, but then again the waiter we had was a little off. He would forget some of the things we had ordered.  I think I would go back again but not anytime soon.

we were here on a really busy friday; it was hard to find parking. but we were seated within 10 minutes, our waitress got our drinks right away, and we didn't even wait 15 minutes for the actual food to arrive. our waitress candice was so sweet and genuine! i'd hate to be alive if i was working here at this time of day but she was sweet and took care of us. we also did the 2-people-3-courses deal for $20. ok, so it's $20...i'm not expecting anything fancy. and it wasn't...it was all meat and cheese, no veggies at all. i guess that's how they keep the prices low. but who cares...people come here for cheap drinks ($4 beers, $5 margaritas!) and greasy onion rings, and they meet these expectations.

Food prices are ehhh a little over priced.  Service is hit an miss. Sometimes you get a good waiter sometimes you don't. The drinks are also hit and miss sometimes plenty of alcohol sometimes just a splash. But it's a decent place to bring a group of friends.

I like TGI Fridays food.. not the best, but it isn't the worst either.  But that's not the reason for this review.  If you ever decide to own a restaurant and you want to see how a waiter/waitress gives bad service or underperforms, this is the place to go.  This isn't just one occurrence either.  Whether it be missing my meal, a fork that I was asking for 20 minutes ago, burning my chicken and saying that's "normal", waiters waiting on the bar customers more than your booth, never having your drinks refilled unless asked, etc.  This place is not the place to go.  And it's only this TGI Fridays I have issues with.

I haven't been here in a few months and the menu doesn't really appeal to me anymore. The menu seems to just rehash the same thing but add jack daniels sauce to it and then bam!, its a new item.  Today for lunch I had parmesan crusted chicken and a cup of french onion soup. The soup was decent. I'm glad it wasn't salt in a bowl like some other places. The chicken was average and so was the tortellini pasta that came with it. I didn't really care for the tomato salad? side thing that came with it. It was served cold with cheese balls, onions and cherry tomatoes i think.  Next time I'm just going to stick my usual whenever I go to a chain restaurant.... chicken nuggets.

The service and food isn't the best but its always cool to hang out at the bar on Friday and Saturday nights. Its pretty chill and there is security that is a little up tight but that's not a bad thing. There is usually a few pretty girls there which is always a good thing. If your planing to get a table the service does take forever so I suggest you only go there to drink and if you want to eat go somewhere else.

A good place to have a shitty overpriced drink before you see a movie at Century 25.   Another crappy TGI Fridays.  just like McDonalds...they are all the same.  crap. Good place to run into someone you want to have sex with more than the person you are on a date with.  lol end of story.  3 stars becuz it is what it is.

Two tables go into a shouting match with each other years ago here and I just can't get over that negative image of the place.  My sister did have me take her here last year for her birthday. Drinks were fine, but not strong. Food was unimpressive and the waitress clearly inexperienced.

Their food is way toO salty period.  The only thing I like here is the alcohol and their Jack Daniel sauce that comes with those steak/salmon combo meals.  Also if your table is near the front window on the bar side the service is real slow.  The only reason why this place gets more business than the other chains is because its open late.  TGI Last Resort
5 stars for the best bartenders in the bay! Fernando and John are my two besties whenever i come here to enjoy dinner and drinks. They are the fun duo that knows how to entertain guests.*thumbs up!

I come here only because I'm addicted to the green bean fries and their specialty cocktails.  If not for those 2 things I would not be able to stand this place. Service is really, really, really slow and none of the workers are especially friendly. Last time I was here for lunch it was midweek at about 12:30 and fairly empty. Our server took our drink and green bean order first while we looked over the menu. It took over 20 minutes for our drinks to arrive and the green beans didn't make an appearance until after all the other stuff we ordered was served. If we didn't ask what happend to them I'm positive we wouldn't have gotten them at all.

I love T.G.I. Friday's and that is only based on the fact that I can't really get their Jack Daniel's sauce any other place, plus I love their maison butter. I used to go all the time just to have the petite sirloin with loaded mashed potatoes and fries but their service has been lacking for let's say the past 2-3 years? Busy day or not you will spend quite a while waiting for your server to get to you. Once you get seated sometimes it takes a while for them to even ask you for what kind of drink you want, then they get you drinks and take even longer to come back and get your order. It would be great to have had a server who is always checking up on you and not you having to look around for your server just to get a refill, extra sauce or even just the check. My point is, they need better servers and I'm sure they actually have decent ones but this review is based on the not so great ones.

Went here for lunch today. The host didn't seem to be too thrilled to be at work when she greeted us as we walked in. We sat in the bar area for happy hour. There wasn't much table selection though, not because they were busy but because all the tables were dirty. The only table open was a big six seater and I felt weird sitting at such a big table but we did anyway. We waited a few mins before anyone even brought us a menu. The waitress was pretty slow and quiet. The main reason I wanted to sit in the bar area was because of the good prices they have on tap beer. But come to find out they were out of Heff, Blue Moon, and Stella. The biggest bummer ever. I got a Bud Light instead, was a big let down. The food was great, it never seems to let me down. Anything on the Jack Daniels menu is excellent. At the end of the meal I ordered a Sam Adams, which I wasn't pleased with but I had ordered it just to try.

Yes I am a fan of good ole' Fridays in Union City. I, and all of my friends have been going here since 2006. This place is cool for the most part. The bartenders are friendly and actually know us all by our first names. I guess it's b/c we've been there sooo many times. HA. Anyhoo, the food is usually decent - I've never had any problems, AND the drinks are always on point. This is a cool spot to go if you: are meeting friends, are looking for somewhere to eat for lunch, just got off of work, need a drink after class, or had a bad week. YAY for Fridays :)

Yesterday was the first time I visited Fridays. In the past, the waits would be so long so we'll just skip and go somewhere else nearby. So my boyfriend decided to go there since I've never been there before. We went early hoping to skip the crowd.  So when we go in, got sitted right away and ordered the 3 course meal. I ordered the house salad, Chicken Bruschetta Chicken Pasta, and the oreo cake. The house salad was alright, they put too much cheese in it though. Halfway into eating the salad, the pasta came out. Right when it came out I wasn't please already. The plating presentation was off and it didn't even too appetizing. Had my first bite into the pasta and the texture of the angel pasta was soo gooey. It was wayy over cooked and just really nasty. The sauce, well I don't know how to describe it, but it was not good at all. Then the desserts came and the cake I liked.  Overall, the food here is gross and wasn't worth what I paid for. The only reason I gave this place two stars is because I received great service and the dessert was good. This is definitely not a place I would go back to.

The food is marginal, and they have an inconsistent pet policy (and from reading the other reviews, obviously this isn't the only thing they are inconsistent about...).  Anyhow, the first time we went there, they were more than willing to sit us in the patio with our dog, who sat quietly under the table the whole time. We had a good experience with the service. When we went there again, we were told dogs were not allowed in the patio. We had specifically made our way to Friday's because we were with our dog that day, and they changed their policy on us.  In fact the person at the door did not know the answer about whether they allowed dogs, and went to ask his manager. I saw her hesitate when he asked her, then she decided that the answer was no. I guess they do not follow any standards or consistent training practices. Well, 2 stars for the first good experience, and no further stars as after the inconvenience they caused us, I'm never going back again.
I haven't been to TGIF in years and its exactly what I remember; over priced, small portions and taste like a tv dinner.

I love their jack daniels steak and shrimp. The service here is so so and could use some improvements, and the lighting is too dim. I come here with some biker friends once in awhile, and they let us park on the curbside without giving us a hassle. Not too shabby for a chain restaurant.

it's a fridays..... i'm just reviewing because we walked in today and they had frikken white girls by e40 blastin.. thought it was an interesting song to be playing. Oh.. actually i DID try the new buffalo chicken sandwich and i'm coo... nothing special about it besides the fact they skimped on my fries.

Went here on a Tuesday afternoon for a late lunch. We ordered drinks and appetizers........ it took a while to get our drinks and they werent even that busy... The food was alright. We had the potato skins for appetizer and the crispy chicken california club. The chicken sandwich was proboly the highlight of the meal.  The server wasnt all that great either. We kept on having to repeat ourselves to her, she must not hear well. Could you imagine if they were busy and the place got any louder she wouldnt be able to hear crap.?! Well there are other Fridays out there.. maybe it was the time of day.

If I could give this place zero stars I would... Maybe I can, but am still new to yelp... So I get in there pretty early say 2ish & order a 22oz of beer and it was flat, but I smash it, cause I'm a man, then order another type of beer and its flat. The buddy I'm w/orders 2 different types of beers and they're flat too! So now comes the food! Crazy dry ribs, burned to blackness potato skins or overly breaded chicken... Never Again!

If I could give this place lower stars, I would. I have no idea why this chain restaurant is still packed, but I think it has more to do with location than anything else. The food here is your typical American bar and grill fair, as no dish stands out as fantastic, but the biggest problem with this particular restaurant is the service. I cannot say enough about the horrible service at this location. I used to frequent this particular location with my friends but the service has taken a nose dive in the past couple of years. For the most part, the waiters are much nicer to larger parties and tend to ignore the smaller ones, and sometimes seem very rude if you approach them for something first rather than them coming to your table.  Other TGIFridays may have great customer service but this one does NOT. Stay away and pick another restaurant in the area. The wait in line is definitely not worth it.

I have gone here several times when they've forgotten to charge me for a soda or dessert.  And it tends to happen when I go with just one other person.  I guess they tend to be nicer when they think you're there on a date.  My experience has actually been the opposite of what Jay P. wrote.  I have had good service in smaller groups.  There were times when I've seen lots of people waiting outside and I come up and get a table instantly.  But that doesn't always happen. I usually get the Flat Iron Steak or something from the Jack Daniel's menu.  For dessert I normally get the Brownie Obsession, although one time they messed it up and put way too much fudge sauce.  I love their long island iced teas!  They're a bit pricey but you get A LOT; you get a good buzz before you even finish it.  In general the food is decent, but I go here for the atmosphere more than the food.

the Friday's bar is always cracking! great atmosphere, especially nights. it gets packed on the weekends. any time theres an important game one TV they usually play all around the restaurant. last time I went I noticed the recently added a digital jukebox. 25cents a song. as far as the menu: I always recommend the Cheesy Bacon Cheeseburger with avocado and Jack Daniels sauce on the side. All there burgers are delicious, as well their boneless kung-pow wings.  Hit up the Fridays bar on a "friday" night and watch see for yourself! Tip your bartenders/severs!!!

I've been going to TGIF afterwork for years now and its a great atomosphere to meet with friends.  The food is good (not Great) but I've had a few dishes I ended up ordering a second time.  The Bartenders are friendly and attentive.  Funny to say but we are on first name basis.  Also the regulars are so great and friendly, they too call me by first name when I sit up at the bar.  It's nice.

This place is so bad I just downloaded the yelp app on my phone to review it.  They are slow, the food price is higher than the quality and the alcoholic drinks are worse!  Our two drinks are bad and I can hear the table over complaining too.  The waiter only said "I'm just the middle man"

Woo Hoo!! The $4 margarita was wonderful, my pasta plate was hot and yummy and the wait person was super friendly and helpful.  This is a great place to sit and talk with friends when you need to get away for a few hours to relax. It's a great atmosphere and you can see a movie after if you want! Bonus!

Yuck.  This place is totally on my wall of shame.  TGI Friday's is not usually very good, but this location is the worst!!!  The last time I ate there we got seated outside on the patio and were forced to order at the bar b/c there weren't enough servers (we also had to prepay?).  On top of that what I ate made me totally sick.  Eww.  Will never return!!!

Been here twice and both times someone in my party have found bugs in what they were having. WTF!!! First a fly in my cousins mixed drink and now an ant in the shrimp cocktail. A person in the kitchen tried to tell us in was probably the vein in the shrimp, the dam thing was crawling and had six legs. I'm pretty sure it was an ant. Besides the unwanted protein in the food and drinks the food here is alright. I'm never going to another TGI Fridays again.

i used to come here a lot in the past.. but i finally had the time to drop by here again after i think a year lol.. originally we wanted to sit by the bar.. since it was a saturday.. and we wanted to get some drinks..but man..it was sooooo crowded!!! in the regular dining area it was empty!! i guess everyone wanted to sit by the bar as well.. so instead.. we sat near the bar.. our server ( i forget his name) was on top of his game! we ordered the deep fried string beans w/ wasabi ranch dip and the jack daniels burger, which we shared.. our server was even kind enough to have it cut and served on separate plates! as our other friends came.. one ordered the nachos and this brownie dessert.. by then i was too  full to try the nachos.. but i decided i think i might have room for a bite of his dessert.. wow.. it was like eating a spoonful of sugar.. (yuck)

I haven't been to a TGI's since...forever. I think the last time I went was when I was in Taiwan. Yeah, the experience was much different.. Anywaayyyy, my friends wanted me to meet them here one Friday late night. I think it was their happy hour? Service was really good. We didn't sit in the bar, but the server didn't seem bothered that we were just going to drink, no food. I ordered a lemon drop martini, SO good! And really strong. They were having a special of these classic cocktails for $3.50 each, and my friend decided to order all 6 of them. Yeah, the server kind of laughed, but was accommadating. Despite them being really nasty because I didn't like the alcohol in them, they were super strong. I'm sure if you liked that kind of alcohol, you'll love it.  Don't know if it was just the one time, but all the drinks were strong. Happy hour doesn't include a lot though, unfortunately... I had a good experience here, I'll probably come back.

Considering the price i paid (i understand this is a chain rest).  The food was not good, portion - aveage and slow service. Not sure why ppl wait for this place. I'll never go back again. Over priced and ....food.

The food is always pretty good here. Service on the other hand.. not so much!..Our waiter seemed kinda spaced out when we were ordering. Table was sticky when we sat down. and they told us 10 mins when we got there, it was about 20.. granted, it was expect since they seemed busy, but they could have been a lil more precise, be honest with the customer instead of tryin to keep them by lying, they'll appreciate the honesty instead of being disappointed.. probably will come back, because again, it's convienently close.

WORST PLACE I HAVE EVER EATEN PERIOD. SERVICE IS FAIL FAIL FAIL - HORRIBLE !!! WORST SERVICE EVER! Bar & Restaurant alike, both are staffed with disrespectful arrogant punks. Nothing but smart ass brats working here. They do not care about customer service, they are obviously locals who work there to be "cool" & hang out with friends. I've been to this place a few times, sometimes it was for drinks others to eat. Each time I left annoyed to hell. Why i went back I don't know, but I know now I am never ever going back. The management here needs to all be FIRED !! Just one example of the bar service, after waiting FOREVER to get one of the PUNK bartenders to take my order he pours my drink (margarita on rocks) & its really really weak & sugary, I mean all mixer & no liquor. My friend tastes it & agrees, I kindly notify the bartender & he appears to get really annoyed then rudely snags the drink out of my hand, spilling some of it on the counter AND my hand, then proceeds to pour liquor down the straw before passing it back to me with a serious "Eff you" attitude. I try to tell him that was not cool & I wanted to speak to a manager, he tells me "no problem", walks away but no manager ever comes. I was so pissed I drank the drink & left without paying for it or leaving a tip. SCREW THESE GUYS!!! Sorry, but there was NO excuse for that!!! Another time I went to eat with a few friends. The waiter was a classic case of someone who has no business being in the customer / food service industry cuz he speaks way too much ghetto. WTF !!! WHO HIRES THESE PEOPLE??? And lets not forget to mention... THE FOOD IS HORRIBLY PREPARED. TGIF's is supposed to have some good food & I want to say they still do but the parolees cooking in the back here absolutely destroy the dishes. Beware eating here! It will NOT look anything like what you see on the menu, sh*t I bet the menu itself probably tastes better than the food itself. These people screwed up the appetizers & got really testy when we complained. I sincerely hope they shut this dump down, there is NOTHING good about this place!!! Do beware, it's a magnet for local youngsters & troublemakers, you will often see cops or hoodlums in the parking lot. Next time I go here I will make sure I bring my sawed off. This place is so ghetto. The food sucks and the drinks, well you need to spend about 100$ to get a buzz. There is one perk... the extra security!!!  They call themself the Union City police!!! There were so many fights at this location that the cops just can't stay away. If you want to dodge some bullets go to TGI Fridays in Union City.

so i just moved to the area 7months ago so i was looking for a place to be my REGULAR spot..i found it here at Fridays..this place has amazing staff!! bartenders are awesome..treats u well..good food! great happy hour! security is great..i really like just being able to walk in and people knowing me..seeing good local faces..good spot to also meet people (friendly or intimately) only reason why its missing the fifth star is bcuz of they're bathrooms! lol hate that part..but in the end..im there nearly every weekend night or even some days during the week having a great time with the great staff or with the local people! awesome spot!

Me and friend came here on a weekday dinner. The place was ok, food was ok, but the service? NO! Our food came first and we waited for 3 mins just to get our utensils. It wasn't that even busy because it's only a weekday. I give the two stars because of the great drink. I had the Mango margarita which was really good!

where better to celebrate jesus birthday than TGIs?... and u call yourself.. *humph nah jus joke.. pounded couple cups of jonny walker at the hotel before heading over to TGI to get a head start on my buzz all 3 nights to watch Lakers toy wit GS and Seattle demolish the 49ers. had to say for a family environment restaurant, was getting loud in there for the sad face bay area fans. food was good and everybody was in good spirits, no sissy boys trying to start shet, and plenty oppertunties to holler at the hollerable... had the lobster tails drowned in butter and steak w/ lobster sauce. was very filling. i like the vegis and would reccommend opting for the sweet potato fries, and avoiding the cheesy. they offer a full bar with couple pages of mixed drinks, and wines, but mostly had beer. wait staff was able to customize my order. was a pleasant evening. applebees only stay right there but wasn't as crowded. TGIs was worth the wait.
Everytime my boyfriend and I came here we had fast service and the best chicken fingers and fries. Just don't go here after drinking an oreo shake from the neighboring Baskin Robbin's.

I would give them five stars, but the food sucks here. The bartenders are super nice and funny!! They rock! Justin and Mike are the best!! Oh, and lu-heffner.lol. B.T.W. This place is not ghetto. Some other lady that wrote a review said it was. but it's not!( anymore)ha!
service really really slow.....not good in an area surrounded by restaurants

I like nice place, right, and so when I come to chain like Friday's, I don't expect much.  One night, our server named "T" went above and beyond my expectations of this place.  She was friendly, happy, fast...  What was she doing there? I don't know.  Been there one time since then and didn't have the pleasure of having her as a server. Unfortunately, she had to go on her break and some horrible server took over.  I hated leaving him a tip but left him a note on my bill to split it with "T"  She's great!  Also like the Jack Daniel's Chicken Strips appetizer.  I think it'll be a bit before I return.

There was a time when I used to love this place because of how good they made their food but ever since the recession hit, they have been going downhill. Their food is not made with quality and their prices have sky rocketed. Only come here to have a little bit.. too much & you'll feel more and more dissatisfied. Fajitas are good, as is their red velvet cake. Service is nice - especially on your birthday :)

This place is always packed and always a good time.  The staff is fun and if you go, look for the bartenders Mike and Anne.  They will make your experience even better.  Enjoy the drinks, but choose wisely on the food.  Always a great time.  Make sure to ask for a "Tea de Rico" if you like real drinks.

5 STARS ALL DAY LONG. Its fun, friendly, not that pricey, has happy hours, cool people. It just recently became one of my fav. places to hit up. Easily accessible too. Alot of free parking and tons of places around TGIF in case you wanna do a movie or smth afterwards.

This was the first time we went to this Restaurant and it was because the one close to where we live has been closed. The food was great and right temp. The table was clean as well. Only I was not happy when waitress asking to get our drinks refill did not mention that it won't be free. The refill for a regular drink normally is free in any restaurant. In this single restaurant It costs the same as original glass and got me by surpise. The hostess was also a little rude when we asked to be seated at a different table, she totally denied it.  I would have given this restaurant 5 star if these two problem was not there.

Why I keep coming here I have no idea...wait yes I do!  Its the idiot I live with being like oh let's go here.  And every time I remind him that the last time we went it sucked.  But he forgets and again we go, and again the food is terrible.  Always sounds good on the menu but falls seriously short.  Except for the fried mac and cheese, thats what got it one star.  How do you get cheese and noodles into a fried batter?

We went to the restaurant and the girl (the short one, available in the afternoon) who was giving us the sitting wanted to give us the worst possible sitting. We requested a booth and she said all the booths are taken, when we saw that there were couple of booths open; still...... We saw that there was an open window sitting, so we requested that. It was very obvious and she couldn't say no. With a great hesitation, she gave us that table. So, if you go there during afternoon and come across the short girl allocating seating, avoid her big time. But later on, our waitress was really good. Her name was Terri and she gave us the best possible service on the earth. We will go back to the restaurant for Terri's service and will avoid the short girl at the front.

Uhm...hella crowded.  And since when were the booths by the bar not considered part of the bar.  Also  when did they have to get a bouncer to check ID's before you get into the bar area.  Man this place is kinda ghetto.  Kinda sad when you see girls dressin all hoochie tryin to have a night out at...TGI Friday's.....hmmm...  Also check your bill before you close out at night.  We ordered some drinks on the happy hr menu and they charged us regular cost.  Hey guy we weren't that drunk to overlook what we ordered.  We pointed it out and he fixed it but still...don't mess w/ a guy about his alcohol.
The appetizers are really good and I like the fact that they stay open until 2am. There is plenty of parking, even behind the Extended Stay hotel nearby. My GPS could not find this place though!
This place is just wrong it should be closed. The wait is insane to get in. Also to get service. The food quality is not worth the effort to even eat there.

i have been here once, and i think its relatively nice, i do agree with the other reviews that it is packed most of the time, but i guess that adds to the atmosphere. The staff there is quite friendly, even though i was in a really small group (3 people). I like how they have someone who makes balloon animals. I cant really comment on their food since ive only had one thing there and it was the "grown-up Mac & Cheese" and i thought it was delicious. I like this place, but parking is a bit of a hassel.

I hate to take it out on this TGIF's in particular but my kids sometimes have dragged me to this location so it's the only one I have ever been to more than once.    I have come to loathe TGIF's.  I have given them more than one opportunity (mostly for convenience) but no matter which one I have tried anywhere in the world the service has been consistently atrocious, and the food mediocre.  My first experience with them was co-ordinating a group banquet back in the 1990's.  I brought over 100 people which they said they could handle and they totally hosed it up and embarassed me by how totally inept they were.  I should have known better than to think this one would be better.  Trust me, it isn't.  If you just want to go there and get rowdy on Friday night, that's probably all it's good for.  Me?  I'll spend my money elsewhere.  I'm giving it one star because I might be willing to eat some of their greasy fried zuchinni if someone else pays for it and I'm starving.

Came her for my bday with one of my girlfriends.  Our server was stupid.  Seriously.  He'd rather talk and conversate with you than take your order and get what you ask for.  I had to ask this mo fo for water five times.  How hard is it to get water?  I know there's a drought, but shit, I have a ginormous mango mai tai infront of me and am avoiding a hangover.  GET ME SOME WATER.  The appetizers were good, and this place was really popping on a Saturday night.  I'll definitley come back, but I won't sit in mo fo's section, that's for sure...

Great late night crowd last night here... busy bar, busy patio, busy wait for tables, busy everything!  Smooth and strong drinks, great idea for a late night happy hour (food only, though, no drinks... that's from 3-7pm), but still a fun crowd nonetheless.  Drop by on a Tuesday night and see Chris at the bar... tell him the folks from Chili's down the street sent you!

the bartenders last night were HELLAAAA SLOWWWW. i understand when a place is busy or they've had a rough day, but really. to see other people get served while we've been sitting there at the bar for 20 minutes without having someone even greet us? IS IT BECAUSE WE'RE BROWN!? haha jk. but forreal... hurry that shit up. all i wanted was one drink!

This has got to be the wrost resturant ever!!! The service sucks!! I worked in a resurant before and I was trained to introduce yourself, our server never did that. The food was not cooked the way we asked and all the high chairs had broken set locks on them!!  This place is the worst ever!! Do not eat here you will regret it!!

I usually like this place except for last night. It was friday and busy probably because there was nothing else open late. Our waitress was slow and kept forgetting things. ie. utensils, ketchup, napkins, straws, drinks.But she did give us our check real quick.  She came to our table and said sorry I forgot to put in your drink orders, I was caught up with some of my high school friends.....Seriously the guys who were flirting with her and her annoying voice got their drinks quick. Sorry that was mean but she needs to learn how to not get side tracked.

I went to this TGI Friday's a couple of weeks ago with some friends.  I had been to other ones over the years and don't recall a really bad experience.   About two years ago I became a vegetarian.  Most restaurants have a minimal selection of vegetarian dishes.  I don't mean order a meaty dish, without the meat. That defeats the purpose for a humane-focused vegetarian.  I do not want them showing selling a meat dish.  I want to show them selling a vegetarian dish....if they had any...which to my (and my non-vegetarian friends) amazement, they did not!   How does a restaurant, in this day and age not have a single vegetarian main course, not even a veggie burger patty?  The Mac n' Cheese even had meat.  C'mon!!!  How frikken' crazy!  With more and more people becoming vegetarians and vegans all the time, for humane and health reasons, how could they not have options for them?   When I asked the waitress what vegetarian options they had, she actually said (with a smile...) "We don't have any".  Uhh??!??!?!?   I will say that the chef did make me a nice veggie quesadilla, which I only was able to get after a rather painful conversation with the non-helpful waitress. I will not go to any TGI Friday's until they have changed their menu.  What crap!

We came here for last minute drink.  It was crazy cuz the security cards only the people they want to card.  We sat at the bar it was pretty tight since they had that dumb ass poker machine there! The drinks were ok.  We wanted air so we went outside, the heaters weren't even on! Ugggg! Anyways thank goodness the drinks weren't watered down or else they would have received 2 starts.

First off, TGIF puts all the nutrition info on the menu.  So when you're watching your caloric and fat intake, that's a bit of a buzz kill.  After all, knowing that you're getting ready to eat two days worth of calories isn't how I like to start a meal.  It was hella crowded so the food was tasty and fresh.  I had the sizzling chicken and shrimp and hubby had baby back ribs.  We waited about 30 mins. for a table because we went on Valentine's Eve.  The margaritas were on hit except for they had a bit too much ice in them.  Our waiter was pretty good and when he went on break, his replacement was REALLY on the ball.  We ended up tipping him $7 and tipping her $5.  Overall the experience was pretty good.  I would go back.

TGI Friday's are usually all the same.  Mediocre menu, mediocre food, and ok drinks.  The only reason we continually come here is for the late night happy hour from 10pm - 2am.  The security guards have come to known my friends and I.  We always enjoy ourselves, BUT that's mainly because of the company.  They recently changed it, so there is no smoking allowed on the patio anymore which is a bummer, because we always sit outside so that the smokers can smoke without having to leave the table.
The food is definitely subpar, but we love the Jack Daniels sauce!!!!!

TG[It's not] Friday's! That's what I thought this afternoon at lunch... Yesterday my friend and I went to TGI Friday's.  Neither of us had ever been, and thinking it was a safe enough bet, we ventured inside.  The service was quick, if not a little annoying.  When we say we're newbies and need some time, don't come back one minute later.  sheesh! As for the food, my chicken parm pasta was total crap.  It tasted totally bland and the crumb coating on the chicken was completely soggy, even though the whole dish was piping hot.  Ick. My friend got the Cobb salad.  Eh, it's pretty difficult to screw up that one, so I suppose it sufficed. Their beer on tap selection is superb, which I took advantage of by ordering a Guinness.  I wouldn't order anything besides appetizers (we had the parm-crusted quesidilla, which was pretty good) and drinks. If you want a good meal, go elsewhere.
Happy Hour on Sunday all day is Great. Half off the apps and domestic beers are cheap
This particular Fridays has horrible customer service. If you go when its busy they  rush you and the food is not good. Watered down drinks

Went here after a party at iFly around the corner. 2 adults, 7 teenagers. Waitress was friendly and responsive, and the food was OK. It didn't all come out together, which made some cold and others overdone. My biggest complaint...they're too nice...to the point of nausea. Look...it's OK if you want to open the door and great me, but then the person right behind you did the same thing...then the person right behind her. Then the waitress...then the manager...then the hostess again. Give me a break.
